loans.name: Archagul

texts.ru: Арчагул досрочно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем инвесторам, помогшим ей в финансировании. В данный момент Арчагул работает реализатором обуви на рынке и по-прежнему занимается животноводством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 1 теленок и 12 овец. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в среднем в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Доходы от кредита Арчагул планирует использовать для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Archagul repaid her loan on time and used it as intended.  She is very thankful to Kiva and to all its lenders who have supported her financially.  She now sells shoes at the market but also continues to be involved in animal husbandry.  She owns two cows, one calf and 12 sheep.  Her activity currently brings her an average monthly income of 25,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and taken a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of ten sheep.  She is planning to use her earnings from this loan to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase ten sheep in order to expand her livestock business.

loans.name: Marlis

texts.es: Marlis tiene 28 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo. Marlis tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual ha logrado sacar adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación. El primer préstamo que obtuvo con KIVA-MiCredito le ayudo a diversificar la oferta de productos en su negocio. Marlis desea seguir creciendo y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos y así lograr satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes es por esa razón que requiere de otro préstamo para comprar Arroz, Frijoles, Azúcar, Aceite, Jugos entre otros productos. Este crédito le ayudara a obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Marlis, age 28, is married and the mother of one son. She runs a small general store that she has managed to get ahead with through hard work and dedication. Her first loan with Kiva-MiCredito let her diversify her selection of products. Marlis wants to keep growing and providing even greater variety in her products thus meeting her customer's demands. That's why she is requesting another loan, which she will use to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, juices, and more. This loan will help her increase her income.

loans.use: buy food products to stock her store

loans.name: Barnabas

texts.en: Barnabas is a maize farmer from Tsirya village. As a member of Babban Gona, Barnabas is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Barnabas expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Barnabas would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest in order to receive cash for his immediate needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Barnabas can now store his maize at harvest and sell it for up to 40% higher than the prices at harvest time. This allows Barnabas to generate earnings of up to 1,000 USD/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Barnabas said, “I will now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To access a loan to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and  farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
Luciana es una joven con muchos deseos de superación, madre soltera de una hermosa niña que significa todo para ella y por quien lucha día a día para poder brindarle un futuro mejor, vive en San Martin junto a su madre y su hija.
Ella con mucho esfuerzo y la ayuda de su mamá estudió la carrera de Contabilidad, mientras ella trabajaba y estudiaba su mamá cuidaba a su hija por eso siempre vivirá agradecida con ella.
Actualmente está trabajando como jefa de un servicio postal, ha luchado mucho para obtener ese puesto y con mucho esfuerzo ha podido conseguirlo.
Luciana quiere estudiar una Maestría, es por ello que piensa utilizar el crédito para poder pagar este curso y así pueda mejorar sus conocimientos. Ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que con esto sus oportunidades laborales mejorarán y así mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luciana is a young woman with desires to get ahead. She is a single mother of a beautiful little girl that means everything to her, and she strives every day to provide her a better future. She lives in San Martin with her mother and her daughter.

With great effort, and the help of her mother, she studied accounting. While she was working and studying her mother took care of her daughter, and for that she will be forever grateful for her mom.

She currently works as a manager of a postal service. She has worked very hard to obtain this position, and with much effort she was able to get it. Luciana wants to study for a master's degree, and this is why she is requesting a loan to be able to pay for the classes. This way she will be able to increase her knowledge. She is very grateful for the Kiva lenders for their generosity. She wants them to know that with this loan, her work opportunities will improve, and she will then improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her master's degree studies.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es una mujer de 33 años de edad, soltera tiene dos hijos de 12 y 14 años, y su negocio es la venta de artículos para autos.
Ella es luchadora, fuerte, constante, responsable, buena madre y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza de forma ambulante en varias ferias de la ciudad.
Gregoria es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo trenzado, su vestimenta es típica (manta, pollera y sombrero) y su lengua materna es el aymara y también habla español. Su vida la comparte con sus dos hijos que estudian en la escuela y a los que durante el día no vé, porque se encuentra trabajando, su casa está en construcción y cuenta con los servicios de agua, luz y gas. Su negocio es el comercio de artículos para auto, como; fundas, cargadores de celular, ambientadores, usb con música, limpiaparabrisas, etc. Su actividad es constante y gracias a eso terminó de pagar el terreno donde vive. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos en sus seis años de experiencia en el rubro. Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen la escuela para que puedan estudiar una carrera y trabajar y desea aumentar su capital de trabajo y terminar de construir su casa.
Es por esos motivos que Gregoria solicita un préstamo para aumentar su stock de productos y con los beneficios pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gregoria, age 33, is the single mother of two children, ages 12 and 14 years. Her two children are both in school, and she doesn't see them during the day while she is working. She is tough, hardworking, constant, responsible, a good mother and a hard worker. She is dark-skinned, medium height, and has long black hair that she wears braided. She wears traditional clothing -- a shawl, a full skirt, and a brimmed hat; her first language is Aymara and she also speaks Spanish. Her home is currently under construction, but they do have water, lights, and gas supplies

She is in the business of selling car accessories and supplies. She does her work by walking through the various markets of the city.  She sells items like seat covers, cell phone chargers, air fresheners, USBs with music, windshield wipers, and more.  She works constantly, and thanks to that, she was able to finish paying the land her home stands on. This is her first sequence of loans in her six years in the program.  

Her goals are to see her children finish school and study for a career, to expand her working capital, and to finish building her home. For all these reasons, Gregoria is requesting a loan to expand her supply of products, and with the income from their sale, she will pay her children's school expenses.

loans.use: expand her product stock and keep her children in school

loans.name: Blanca Lilia

texts.es:
Blanca una mujer viuda que a sus 62 años de edad se dedica a la comercialización de mercancía principalmente ropa, la cual carga y muestra a sus clientes con la esperanza de lograr una venta que le permita llevar un bocado de comida a sus 6 hijos que tuvo,
Blanca es una mujer carismática, responsable y trabajadora que aunque perdió a su esposo tuvo el coraje de levantarse y luchar por esos hijos demostrando gran carácter, valentía y responsabilidad.
Blanca solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía pues se volvió una experta vendedora y su idea es llegar a más lugares ofertando sus prendas y ya que logro criar a su hijos en momentos muy complicados quiere recoger capital para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca is a widow who at 62 sells merchandise, mainly clothing, which she carries around and shows to her customers with the hope of achieving a sale that will allow her to support her six children.

Blanca is a charming woman, responsible and hard-working, who although she lost her husband had the courage to pick herself up and strive for those children, showing great strength of character, courage and responsibility.

Blanca  is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise, as she has become an expert salesperson and her idea is to get to more places, offering her articles of clothing. As she has managed to raise her children in very difficult times, she wants to put together some capital to improve her housing conditions.

loans.use: To buy general clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Martin De Jesus

texts.es:
Martin un hombre muy responsable, saludable, alegre y honesto que se dedica al negocio de cultivo específicamente hortalizas el cual heredo los conocimientos, el terreno y la administración de la finca donde actualmente vive con su esposa y 3 hijos de 19, unos gemelos de 16 años de edad. 
Martin sabe lo difícil que es sobresalir en el campo pero quiere que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar de labrar su propio futuro y trabaja incasablemente hasta 15 horas por día por esos muchachos que representan toda su fuerza y motivación para levantarse cada mañana. 
Solicita un crédito para comprar insumos agropecuarios ya que tiene una plaga que  está acabando con sus cultivos y esta próxima una cosecha y necesita ciertos abonos, fungicidas que mejoraran considerablemente la cosecha esperada y tendrá los insumos necesarios para abonar la nueva cosecha.
texts.en:
Martin is a responsible, healthy, happy, and honest man who is in the business of cultivating the green vegetable crops that he inherited, along with the farm and the know-how to run it all. He currently lives with his wife and their three children: their oldest is 19 and they have 16-year-old twins as well. Martin knows how hard it is to stand out in farming, but he wants his children to have the opportunity to study and shape their own future. His children are his motivation to get up every morning and work tirelessly, up to 15 hours a day.

He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies as he has a plant disease wiping out his crops and harvest time is soon. He also needs certain fertilizers and fungicides that will both considerably improve his anticipated harvest and enable him to fertilize the new harvest.

loans.use: buy supplies to exterminate a plague that is attacking his crops

loans.name: Gloria Luz

texts.es:
Gloria siempre ha sido una apasionada por los niños, desde que inicio con su guardería siempre ha procurado generarles bienestar y cuidado a los niños que actualmente tiene a su cuidado.

Buscando mejorar su servicio y aumentar igualmente su número de clientes, solicita un apoyo económico para comprar materiales didácticos y colchonetas con los cuales los niños puedan jugar y aprender al mismo tiempo.

Con este negocio ha podido salir adelante y puede sostener a sus dos hijos menores. Recibe gran ayuda de su esposo que es un pilar fundamental en su vida.
texts.en:
Gloria has always been passionate about children.  Ever since she started her daycare, she has endeavored to ensure the well-being and care of the children under her care.

Looking to improve her service and increase her number of customers, she is requesting a loan to buy teaching materials and mats with which the children will be able to play and learn at the same time.

She has been able to get ahead and support her two minor children with this business.  She receives great help from her husband, who is a fundamental pillar in her life.

loans.use: to buy teaching materials and mats.

loans.name: Aishatu

texts.en: Aishatu is a maize farmer from Makera village. As a member of Babban Gona, Aishatu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. As a result of her previous loan for inputs, Aishatu expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize which is double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Aishatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Aishatu can now store her maize at harvest and sell it for up to 40% higher than the prices at harvest time. This allows Aishatu to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Aishatu said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.”

loans.use: To access a loan to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and  farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing incomes by up to 37%

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia Felicitas sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas”, la socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de venta de fruta, la socia continua vendiendo frutas como platanos,manazanas entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de papayas, manazanas entre otros.
 La socia Felicitas está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Felicitas continues to belong to the “Mujeres Unidas” communal bank. She still has her fruit business. She continues selling fruit like bananas and apples, among others.  She is a responsible and diligent person.  This is the way that she gets her family ahead.

Felicitas is requesting the loan to buy papayas and apples, among other items. She is happy to have this loan and pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy papayas and apples, among other items.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 41 years old.  She is married with an only child. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She has been operating a general store in her community to earn a living. 

For over four years, she was able to sustain and improve the business and it is doing well. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used to buy goods for her store. To increase sales, she recently took a new loan to purchase grains and feeds to sell in her store in addition to her grocery goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase grains and feeds to sell in her store in addition to her grocery goods.

loans.name: Soraida

texts.es:
Soraida es una mujer de 31 años de edad que desea iniciar un negocio de cultivo de frutas, actividad que aprendió gracias a su hermano y ahora quiere empelar pues su familia presenta necesidades económicas.
Hablando un poco de Soraida es una mujer muy alegre, muy positiva y trabajadora madre de 2 hijos de 9 y 13 años de edad que quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos, abonos y semillas pues solo tiene el campo pero esta todo por hacer y el costo de los insumos agrícolas es muy alto lo que justifica el monto solicitado.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá iniciar su empresa de cultivo de frutas, establecerá su negocio y aspira a que este le permita mejorar las condiciones de vida que hoy tienen.
Soraida invita a los prestamista a apoyar su crédito, ella busca una estabilidad económica para brindarles un bienestar y un futuro a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Soraida, age 31, wants to start a business growing fruits. She learned the work from her brother, and she wants to use her knowledge as her family finds itself in economic need.  Soraida herself is a happy woman, very upbeat, and the hard-working mother of two children, ages 9 and 13. 
She will use the loan to buy supplies, fertilizers, and seeds as she only has the land right now. All this is yet to do, though, and agricultural supplies are very expensive, which explains the amount requested.
With the help this loan provides, she will be able to start and establish a business selling fruits; she hopes that this will let her improve her living conditions from what they are today. Soraida invites lenders to support her loan. She is looking for economic stability so that she can provide well being and a bright future to her two children.

loans.use: get her new business growing fruit off the ground

loans.name: Theophilus

texts.en:
Theophilus is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in carved African masks. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials and supplies, including wood, paint, nails, aluminum plates and polish.

Theophilus has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"I am a calm, humble and quiet person who also loves arts and crafts. When I was in primary school, I admired art and used to draw animals and images that I found. After school, I'd stop by the workshop of a local wood carver, Salihu, to observe him and his workers as they carved different objects out of raw wood. They really caught my attention, and I visited the workshop daily. Realizing my interest, Salihu offered to train me. I was most interested, so learning the skill was not a difficult thing. Within a short time, I could finish the carved items. At a certain point in time, my parents could not afford to further my education so I decided to continue learning under Salihu and pursue a career in this field. What inspires me most is when people express appreciation for my designs. It is my dream to one day become the owner of a well-established art workshop and be able to employ many workers to reduce the alarming rate of unemployment in my country."

"I thank you so much. This loan will enable me to increase my inventory as well as develop new designs."

Use the link below to view Theophilus's carved African masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8505

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials and supplies

loans.name: Sulma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sulma de 46 años de edad, no tiene grado de estudio ya que por ser muy pobres le tocaba ayudarle a su familia a trabajar, su esposo es agricultor, los tres hijos estudian en la escuela. Sulma se dedica al comercio, tiene un cafetín en donde vende productos de consumo como  fresco, gaseosas, golosinas etc, esta actividad la desempeña desde hace mas de 10 años.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una motocicleta para uso de su esposo porque muchas veces ella sale tarde y él la va a traer; porque esta lejos de su casa el cafetín.

ella sueña con hacer el cafetín mas grande, surtirlo mas de productos y de ahí sacar para el estudio de sus hijos y que se preparen academicamente.
texts.en:
Sulma is 46 years old and did not go to school, as because they were very poor, she had to to help the family work.  Her husband is a farmer, and the  three children go to school.  Sulma has a business, a small café where she sells fruit drinks, soft drinks, candy. etc. She has been engaged in this work for more than 10 years.

The loan she is requesting is to buy a motorcycle for her husband to use, as she often leaves work late and he comes to get her because the store is far from their home.

She dreams of expanding the café, stocking it with more products, and earning money for her children's education, so that they can prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her husband to use, because she often leaves work late and he comes to get her.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer for her daughter

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José de 70 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, esta casado y su esposa se dedica a administrar una pequeña tienda, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo dos viven con él que van a la escuela de la comunidad.

José esta jubilado y por el momento, solo se dedica al cuido y educación de sus hijos, ademas ayuda a su esposa a atender los clientes que llegan a comprar a la tienda.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, pan, café, etc. para vender en la tienda y así tener mas ingresos para el sustento de sus hijos.

Planea tener junto a su esposa una tienda bastante fuerte y surtida para darles una mejor atención a sus clientes y con las ganancias darles calidad de vida a sus hijos pequeños.
texts.en:
José, age 70, went to school through the sixth grade.  His is married, and his wife runs a small store.  He has five children, two of whom live with him and go to the community school.

José is retired.  For now, he devotes himself to the care and education of his children.  He also helps his wife tend to the customers who come to buy at the store.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, bread, and coffee, etc. to sell at the store.  This way he will have more income to support their children.

Together with his wife, he plans to have a very strong and stocked store in order to give better service to their customers.  With the earnings they will give their little children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, bread, and coffee, etc. to sell at the store.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en: Mary Joy wants to own a business in the future. She studied with determination to succeed. She is helping her parents to earn a living by selling fish in the market. She had her previous loan which she used to pay her tuition fee. And she is now beginning to reap her success for she has finished her studies. She took another loan from GDMPC to pay for the graduation fees because she has finished her studies. It is her desire to gain a better job in order to pay her debts and to help her parents in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for her graduation fees.

loans.name: Jojelyn

texts.en: Jojelyn earns a living from selling dry goods in her store while her husband does fishing. For six years,Jojelyn has earned well from selling ready-to-wear products and was able to put up another business. She is buying and selling coconut wine which she can sell daily in the village. She earns income from her investments daily and is doing well. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the RTW  buy and sell business. She took a new loan recently from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase more coconut wine to sell in their village to gain more profit for the family. She hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of providing better education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut wine to sell in her village.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 38 years old, married and lives with her family. She has a retail store serving several customers; she sells assorted groceries and beverages to generate additional income while her husband works as a carpenter.
 
Rosalie has been in this field for ten years. Rosalie is working hard every day in order to provide income for the family and to show customers her responsibility and reliability to serve. 

Rosalie requested this loan to purchase canned goods, soft drinks and grains for sale in her store. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she may open a bigger place and continue assisting her family with the additional income.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soft drinks and grains for resale in her store

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es: Ivón de 23  años de edad, tiene una experiencia de 5 años comercializando productos de piñatería, y 2 de tener su propio negocio,  actividad con la  que aprovecha cada temporada,  para ajustar sus artículos a la demanda de sus clientes. Ivon inicialmente trabajó en uno de los centros del comercio más importantes de la capital de Colombia, “ Bogotá” , hasta que decidió independizarse y  generar por si misma, ingresos para sostener principalmente a su pequeño hijo de 7 años, a su madre y a si misma, o sea del negocio dependen tres personas. Antes de iniciar   su negocio Ivon  había referenciado muchos contactos en el centro de la ciudad, ellos en la actualidad  siguen siendo sus principales clientes reales y potenciales. Sus ventas las realiza de contado, en un local donde presta el servicio de internet, de domingo a domingo, en un horario de 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.   Ivon tiene una  meta  que cumplirá más adelante,  la cual es dar apertura a un nuevo punto comercial en otro centro de la ciudad, porque planea continuar sus estudios de gestión del talento humano, su mayor desafío es gerenciar su tiempo, el cual se ve afectado por multiplicidad de actividades  productivas, domésticas y educativas, que debe  realizar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, para iniciar su historial crediticio, pues aun no tiene; este es el primer financiamiento que hace y es justamente a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el financiamiento comprará muñecos de peluche, disfraces, artículos de decoración, globos tarjetas etc, todo con motivos navideños, para impactar la potencialidad de sus ventas, aprovechando esta bella época del año, donde las familias esperan celebrar muchas fiestas de integración, entre pitos, matracas, música, abrazos y sonrisas., mientras la diversidad del surtido hará que su credikiva impacte positivamente  su microempresa.
texts.en:
Ivón is 23 years old. She has 5 years of experience selling party supplies, and has had her own business for 2 years. She enjoys this work each season, and adjusts her stock according to her clients' needs.

Ivón first worked in one of the most important shopping centers in the capital of Colombia, Bogotá, until she decided to become independent and to generate income on her own. These earnings mainly support her small 7-year-old son, her mother, and herself; the business also depends on them.

Before beginning her business, Ivón had reached out to many contacts in the center of the city; they now continue to be her real main and potential clients. Her sales are made in cash at a location that offers internet services, from Sunday to Sunday, with a schedule of 9 in the morning until 9 at night.

Ivón's goal is to move forward by opening a new location in another one of the city's shopping centers, as she plans to continue her studies in talent management. Her main challenge is to manage her time, as it is affected by the many productive activities - household and educational - that she has to do. 

She now is applying for a loan through Kiva to establish her credit history, as she does not have one. This is the first financing she has done, and it is, justly, through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the financing, she will buy stuffed animals, costumes, decorations, balloons, cards, etc. for Christmas. This will impact her potential sales, taking advantage of this beautiful season this year, when families look forward to celebrating together with whistles, rattles, music, hugs, and smiles. The diversity of the supplies will make the Kiva loan have a positive impact on her small business.

loans.use: to buy stuffed animals, costumes, decorations, balloons, cards, etc.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.es:
Rudy de 44 años de edad, es albañil, esta casado estudio hasta segundo grado, su esposa tambien trabaja los fines de semana elaborando pupusas, tiene 4 hijos dos de ellos estudian bachillerato a distancia y otro estudia básica en la escuela de la comunidad.

 Rudy es albañil desde hace 25 años y aprendió ese trabajo porque trabajaba con un tío como ayudante y fue de él de quien aprendió ese oficio, viaja a 30 minutos, en carro para trasladarse de su casa hasta su trabajo que realiza de 7 de la mañana a 4 de la tarde.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para reparar las paredes y cambiar el techo de su casa.  Desea seguir trabajando para darle el estudio a sus hijos y seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rudy, age 44, is a bricklayer.  He is married, and he went to school through the second grade.  His wife works on the week-ends making ‘pupusas’ [stuffed tortillas].  He has four children.  Two of them are studying for a high school degree through distance learning.  Another is in elementary school at the community school.

Rudy has been a bricklayer for 25 years.  He learned this work because he worked as a helper with an uncle.  His uncle was who he learned this trade  from.  He travels 30 minutes by car in order to get from his house to his work.  He works from seven in the morning until four in the afternoon.

The loan that he is requesting is to repair the walls and change the roof of his house.  He wishes to continue working in order to give his children an education and to continue improving his house.

loans.use: to repair the walls and change the roof of his house.

loans.name: Ana De Jesus

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer pujante, servicial y trabajadora, a sus 58 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Desde hace 7 años se desempeña en el campo de la confección, prestando el servicio de confección a terceros y a clientes directos, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y trabaja sola todos los días, así genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
Actualmente se motiva a solicitar el crédito para comprar una maquina plana.

Ana manifiesta que desea continuar realizando su labor con mucho empeño, pues quiere ampliar su negocio y poder generar oportunidades de empleo, además de garantizar una estabilidad económica para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is a hard-working, obliging, and thriving woman of 58 years. She is married and the mother of two children whom she has managed to get ahead with a lot of hard work and dedication.

Seven years ago, she started working in the sewing industry, providing services both to third-parties as well as to direct clients. She learned the work by doing, and she works alone every day. She manages to generate enough income to support her husband in running the household. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy a flat-bed sewing machine.

Ana says she wants to keep working hard, so she wants to expand her business and be able to provide opportunities for employment. She also wants to be able to guarantee her family's economic stability and give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy a flat-bed sewing machine

loans.name: Primero Dios Group

texts.es: Primero Dios, es un grupo solidario integrado por tres socios exitosos en su vida laboral, lo coordina el señor Damaso, quien tiene la edad de 57 años, casado y padre de cinco hijos de los cuales solamente dos dependen económicamente de él, es agricultor de granos básicos y frutas, además los comercializa en su domicilio y comunidad, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de quintal de maíz y frijol, y saco de yuca este último producto lo impulso gracias a los financiamientos obtenidos por la institución, el socio lleva cinco años de trabajar con los financiamiento de la institución y ha demostrado ser responsable y puntual en las fechas de pago del crédito. El resto de los integrantes son el señor Rolando de 51 años de edad y propietario de un taller de zapatería desde hace diecisiete años, y la señora María Luisa, quien tiene la edad de 54 años y se dedica a la comercialización de calzado desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
Primero Dios is a united group made up of three members who are successful in their work lives. Mr. Damaso coordinates; he is 57 years of age, is married, and is the father of five children. Of his children, only two depend on him economically. He grows basic grains and fruit; he sells them in his home and community. 

He is asking for a loan to buy approximately 46 kilos of corn and beans, and a sack of yucca. This last product is an addition, thanks to the financing obtained from the institution. He has demonstrated that he is responsible and punctual with his credit repayments. 

The other members are Mr. Rolando, who is 51 years of age and who has been the owner of a shoe workshop for the past seventeen years, and Mrs. María Luisa, who is 54 years of age and who has worked in shoe sales for two years.

loans.use: to buy approximately 46 kilos of beans, corn, and a sack of yucca.

loans.name: Cerenisa

texts.en: Cerenisa has provided transportation services in her community for a decade and she is earning well from this business. She has successfully repaid her previous loan which was used for buying tires. She has her tenants who rented her tricycle daily. She took a new loan recently to repair a transport vehicle used in the business to provide a safe and comfortable service. In the future, she wants to give her family a better living.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in her business to provide a safe and comfortable service.

loans.name: Alba Patricia

texts.es:
Alba una mujer de 39 años de edad que se dedica a la actividad de cultivo de flores, la cual aprendió trabajando en diferentes campos de flores y los hermosos terrenos que se pueden apreciar en la foto son heredados de su padre y ella con su iniciativa lo lleno de uno de los elementos naturales más hermosos del planeta las flores. 
Para que los prestamistas entiendan un poco el costo de los insumos agrícolas son muy costosos y lo que quiere implementar Alba es rodear sus campos de plástico polietileno para cultivo pues debe proteger a toda costa sus terrenos de esa fiera que llamamos clima y el costo es el doble de lo que alba está solicitando pero ella asumirá una parte y la otra la quiere hacer a crédito pues son dispone de tanto capital. 
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar todo lo que necesita para proteger sus campos del clima y seguirá comercialización este hermoso producto.
texts.en:
Alba, 39, earns a living growing flowers, which she learned working on different flower farms.  She inherited from her father the beautiful land that can be appreciated in the photo.  She had the initiative to fill the land with one of the most beautiful natural elements on the planet: flowers.

So that the lenders understand somewhat: Agricultural inputs are very expensive.  What Alba wants to do is surround her fields with polyethylene plastic for crops because she must protect her fields at all cost from that beast known as the weather.

The cost is double what Alba's requesting, but she'll assume part and get a loan for the rest because she doesn't have too much capital.  The loan will help Alba be able to buy everything she needs to protect her fields from the weather, and she'll keep on selling this beautiful crop.

loans.use: to buy polyethylene plastic, a costly material she needs urgently to protect her crops

loans.name: Jeanna

texts.en:
Jeanna is 46 and has 4 children. She has been helping her husband with their farm for more than 6 years. Aside from this, they also have a fishing business and a piggery to earn a living.

She has successfully repaid her previous loans used for her farm, and it is doing well. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase fertilizer and pay weeding maintenance costs to have a greener farm. 

With determination and in the spirit of helping each other, Jeanna is a better entrepreneur and she has been able to improve their way of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and weeding maintenance

loans.name: Alpedita

texts.en: Alpedita has been running a general store for many years to make a living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. While her husband works as a carpenter, she works in her store to make additional income for the family. She took a new loan recently to purchase additional stocks like grains and feeding supplies to sell in her store. She plans to expand her business to earn more income and create a better life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like grains and feeding supplies to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish and salt for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for pesticides, fertilizers, and labor.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian used the previous loan to buy film and battery cells to use in his studio which enabled him to increase on his business stock and expand his capital base. He is still taking photos and has hopes of making a good film studio and video producing company. Brian is determined to take his business to greater heights although he still complains of high rental fees and bad debtors.
 
Brian is requesting a loan to buy more film and battery cells to use in his studio.

loans.use: to buy more film and battery cells to use in his studio.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay some household expenses and begin studying for a career

loans.name: Señor Cautivo De Ayabaca Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo “Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca” que está constituido por 06 socios responsables. Miriam de 23 años de edad es separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella es empleada municipal. Viene desempeñándose hace más de 02 años donde todo le va bien. A si mismo pudo implementar su propio negocio de venta de golosinas. Se siente feliz por darle una mejor educación a su único hijo. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de caramelos, chupetines y chicles. El grupo “Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva que hicieron posible este crédito. Miriam se encuentra de pie es la primera del lado derecho, viste polo negro.
texts.en:
This is the “Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca” group. It is made up of six responsible members. 

23-year-old Miriam is separated with one dependent child. Miriam has been a municipal employee for more than two years and it is going well. She wishes to start her own business selling candies. She feels happy to be able to give a better education to her only child. She requested this loan in order to buy candies, lollipops, and chewing gums. 

The “Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca” group is grateful to the Kiva investors who made this loan possible. Miriam is standing on the far right. She is wearing a black shirt.

loans.use: to buy candies, lollipops, and chewing gum.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 19 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace 2 años, su negocio está ubicado en una zona muy transitada por eso posee muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan, la joven es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo y sus padres, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de zapatos por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos y asi una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This young woman has had her face pixellated because she is 19 years old and she lives in a high risk area.  She has made a living selling shoes for two years.  Her business is located in a busy area and, therefore, has many customers.  With the sales that she has made, she is able to cover the expenses that she faces.  

The young woman is a single mother who lives in her own house with her son and her parents.  She is requesting a loan to buy wholesale shoes to be able to have a better income and thus a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale shoes.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La socia Nieves sigue dedicándose a la  venta de comida, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo arroz con pollo, saltado entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz,aceite,menestras entre otros.
  La socia Nieves agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Nieves is a member who continues to sell food. The member has had her business for a good amount of time, and it is going well, thanks to the effort she puts forth each day. The member continues to sell rice with chicken, salted and other types - this being the way the member helps her family to move forward. 

The member requires the loan to buy rice, oil, mixed vegetables, and other items. The member Nieves is thankful for the help that will be provided, and she herself promises to pay back the loans in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, mixed vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Abert

texts.en: Abert is a 29-year-old married man with 3 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sews clothes to earn income for his family and has managed to get many friends out of this business. He has a vision of expanding his business to new areas despite the business being seasonal in that he gets very busy when his clients are going to have parties and on Easter and Christmas seasons. Abert needs a loan to buy materials for the tailoring business ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy materials for the tailoring business ahead of the Christmas season

loans.name: Arolyn

texts.en:
Arolyn helps her husband in their fishing business to make a living. She has been in this business for four years, and owns a fishing boat.

Her previous loan was used to buy nets and it was repaid successfully. She has expanded her business and become a fish supplier in the market. She took a new loan recently from GDMPC (Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative) to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets to increase the size of her catch.

She wants to increase her income to provide a better education for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets to increase her catch.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn's husband works on their farm to make a living, while she sells goods in her retail store. After many years in running her store, she was able to support the family needs. She has successfully repaid her previous loan which was used for buying goods to sell. Her business has started to grow and to increase her sales, she took a new loan recently in order to purchase more grocery goods and food supplies to sell in her store.

She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve and expand her business, thus ensuring a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods and food supplies to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rosales De Santiago Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSALES DE SANTIAGO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Máxima es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de golosinas, tienda de barrio, venta de cerveza, venta de papa y chuño, venta de comida, venta de carne.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maxima es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de golosinas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con un capital básico al observar que el mismo es muy rentable.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra golosinas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The communal bank Rosales de Santiago will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of the Central Focus for Patacamaya. The group is made up of 9 members and is led by a board where Maxima is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are various. Among them are: candy sales, neighborhood store, beer sales, potato and chuño [freeze dried potato] sales, food sales, and meat sales.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small entrepreneurs where Maxima is a member. She states that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of an adviser of the institution, that went to visit her in her home. Currently she has a business selling candies. She mentions that she started this business with little capital after observing that it was very profitable.

The loan that is being requested is to increase her capital to buy candies in bulk that she will get from wholesalers in the city of La Paz to then sell at her sales venue. This form of work allows her to generate the means to support her family, since she is married and has six children.

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy candies in bulk.

loans.name: Dionisio Valentin

texts.es:
El Sr Dionisio Valentin es profesor de primaria de un centro de educacion de primaria impartiemdo clases a niños de entre 10 y 14 años desde hace 24 años imiciamdo sus labores a las 12 dedl mediodia terminando sus labores a las 5:30 pm de lunes a viernes.
El Sr dionisio Valentin Necesita el pretamo para la mejora en la infraestructura de su casa de habitacion ya que necesita reforzar las paredes interiores y el techo de su casa por eso esta solicitando este credito a kyva y ceprodel.
texts.en:
Señor Dionisio Valentin has been a primary school teacher at a primary education center teaching classes to children between the ages of 10 and 14 for the last 24 years, beginning his work at noon and ending his work at 5:30pm from Monday to Friday. 

Señor Dionisio Valentin needs the loan in order to improve the infrastructure of his home since he needs to reinforce the interior walls and the roof of his house. That is why he is requesting this loan from Kiva and CEPRODEL.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, metal sheeting, iron, and blocks.

loans.name: Saul

texts.en: Saul is thirty-five years old and married with three children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. Saul sells cassava flour and earns additional income from his salary as a teacher. Saul has a dream of becoming the biggest cassava supplier in the area, in spite of major challenges such as high transport costs, market competition, and price fluctuations. Saul will use the loan to buy cement and sand to plaster his house.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to plaster his house.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 26-year-old single man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a retailer and at the same time does mechanic work to supplement his income. He hopes of becoming a wealthy person and getting married after his business has stabilized because then he will be in line to support his family with ease. He faces difficulty of the constant price changes of retail products. Francis needs a loan to buy a popcorn making machine.

loans.use: to buy a popcorn making machine.

loans.name: George William

texts.en: George William is a hardworking, married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer and at the same time earns a government salary. He faces challenges of weather changes, inadequate capital and labor force. Besides that, he hopes of becoming an extensive tea farmer with a very big tea plantation. George William needs a loan to extend his tea plantation by planting more tea.

loans.use: to extend his tea plantation by planting more tea.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Sol Group

texts.es: El grupo “Mujeres Del Sol” está conformado por 07 socios emprendedores y solidarios. Tulia de 44 años de edad es separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Hace más de 04 años que Tulia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Gracias a su esfuerzo puede darle una mejor educación a su mejor hijo. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, leche, aceite, harina y azúcar. El grupo “Mujeres Del Sol” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitar este crédito. Tulia se encuentra sentada es la segunda del lado derecho, viste polo turquesa.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Del Sol" [Women of the Sun] group has 7 enterprising and supportive members.

Tulia is 44 years old, she is separated and she has a dependent son. Tulia has been making a living selling groceries for more than 4 years. Thanks to her efforts she can provide her son with a better education. She requested the loan to buy rice, milk, oil, flour and sugar.

The "Mujeres Del Sol" group thanks Kiva lenders for facilitating this loan.Tulia is sitting second on the right and she's wearing a turquoise top.

loans.use: to buy rice, milk, oil, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Tercero

texts.es:
Tercero es un padre de familia siempre dedicado, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, vive en San Martin junto a sus seres queridos. Es una persona que nació y creció en la chacra, desde muy joven apoyó a sus padres en cuanto a los cultivos, ahora que tiene su propia familia es él quien se hace cargo de todos, con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante con los cultivos de cacao que tiene en sus terrenos. Él sale muy temprano a trabajar, cuidar la tierra, limpiar el terreno para que así pueda mejorar su producción.
Tercer está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar insumos para poder realizar el abono de sus plantas, de esta manera su cosecha será mucho mejor y la demanda aumentará, él espera más adelante ampliar sus cultivos para convertirse en un próspero empresario.
texts.en:
Tercero is a father who is always dedicated, with a lot of enthusiasm to get ahead. He lives in San Martin together with his loved ones. He is a person who was born and raised on the farm. Since he was very young he helped his parents with the farming.  Now that he has his own family it is he who is in charge of everyone. With a lot of effort he is getting ahead with the cacao crop that he has on his lands. He leaves very early to work, take care of the land, and clean the land so that he can improve his production. 

Tercero is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have given him he will be able to buy supplies to be able to carry out the fertilization of his plants. In this way his harvest will be much better and the demand will grow. Later he hopes to expand his crops to become a prosperous business owner.

loans.use: to fertilize his cacao crop for a better harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy quintals of corn and lime powder

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les sept membres du groupe  Teriya ont en moyenne 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Hamdallaye l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Hamdallaye. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits, des jus, de parfums et  des chaussures. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame  Mah (femme  arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse des habits. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 32 pagnes wax  en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à  Hamdallaye  et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mah compte  avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The members of the Teriya group are married women living mainly in polygamous households. On the average, they are 36 years of age, with three children. They all live in Hamdallaye, a neighborhood of Bamako, and know each other as neighbors as well a through work as local vendors. The group members sell clothing, juice, perfume and shoes. With the goal of bolstering their work capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second solidarity loan.

Mrs. Mah (the one standing on the far right in the photo) is a well-known clothing vendor. She plans to use her loan to buy 32 sets of traditional colorful "pagnes" fabric wholesale in Bamako. She sells retail in Hamdallaye and as an ambulant vendor, mainly to female customers. With this loan, Mrs. Mah plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 100,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvest in her business and cover some minor household expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing [for resale].

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Collana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE COLLANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mauricia ella es soltera y tiene 40 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de pan, la socia prepara pan y luego los vende en los diferentes mercados, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de pan. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar ingredientes como harina, azúcar, mantequilla y leche para preparar el pan.


Las socias que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de servicio de taxi, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de crianza de animales.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “SANTA ROSA DE COLLANA.” This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Mauricia. She is single and 40 years old. The member works in her business of selling bread. She makes bread and later sells it in the different markets. The member works from 8:00am to 6:00pm. Through this loan she wishes to get ahead, and her goal is to expand her business of bread sales. The member requests the loan in order to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, butter and milk in order to make bread.

The members that are pasted to the group photo had their photos taken after the meeting because they asked permission due to work.

The other members work in the food sales business, taxi service business, grocery store business, and the business of raising animals.

The member thanks those who are a part of this dream through these means and she promises to pay her fees on the established deadlines.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, butter and milk in order to make bread.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She has five children. She was selling fish in the market and with her income she was able to buy a tricycle for a transportation service-based business. She has successfully repaid her previous loan which was used for expanding her fish vending business. This current loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business so that she can provide a secure service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in her business so she can provide a secure service.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is married and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals in motorcycle transport. He also deals in cocoa buying and selling. He is a hardworking man and hopes to buy a large piece of land in the future. 

He used the old loan to buy cocoa, which he sold and made reasonable profits.

Patrick wants a loan to buy his own motorcycle for transport purposes.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle for transport purposes

loans.name: Levina

texts.en:
Levina is a 37-year-old female. She is married with seven children and is living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling second-hand clothes for two years now in order to support her family. She also sells firewood to get a side income. A challenge of limited capital hinders her dreams of expanding her business and finishing her residential house. 

Levina wants money to buy firewood for selling.

loans.use: to buy firewood for selling.

loans.name: Kayonza Twimukye Group

texts.en:
Anna is a married woman with eight children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is a member of a village bank where they guarantee one another to get a loan. She sells fish in different markets in the rural areas. She started with capital from savings in their group and group loans. She experiences low capital hardship to buy more fish, and her vision is to buy fish-preserving equipment to stop her fish from going bad.

Anna is requesting a loan to buy more fish for selling.

loans.use: to buy more fish for selling.

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette is 37 years old and married with four children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, with her family. She had her previous loan from GDMPC that she used for her snack-vending business. She repaid successfully her previous loan, for she works with determination in her business. 

Aside from this, she has a farm managed by her husband. With her business income, she was able to expand it. She took a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer to have a more productive rice harvest. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to have a more productive rice harvest.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 53 years old. She is a widow and lives with her family. She has a retail store serving several customers; she sells assorted groceries and beverages to generate additional income in order to make a living. 

Carmelita has four years' experience in this field and was able to sustain the business successfully.  

Carmelita requested this  loan to purchase grains and feeding supplies for sale in addition to her store. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits to provide a better living for the family.

loans.use: to purchase grains and feeding supplies for sale

loans.name: Gracelyn

texts.en:
Gracelyn is married and resides at Sto. Niño, Tukuran, with her family. Gracelyn sells fish in the market, while her husband fishes for a living. She's been in this business for over six years.

She had repaid successfully her previous loan used for the business. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets, to catch more fish to sell. In the future, Gracelyn hopes to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets, to catch more fish to sell

loans.name: Nua Ngam 4 Group

texts.en:
Thoan is 48 years old and lives with her husband and her only son in a small house of a remote village. Thoan and her husband earn a living by doing all sorts of agricultural work, including planting rice, vegetables and cereals, and raising pigs, chickens and a buffalo for plowing. 

Thoan has been a farmer since she was very little and now she keeps doing her job very well. To have enough capital for expanding her business of raising pigs, recently, Thoa has taken out a loan from Anh Chi Em Program to buy piglets. Her husband has suffered from gravel (kidney stones), so she hopes that her investment will help to improve income for the family so that she could afford to cover all living expenses, including her husband's treatment costs and her son's tuition fee. 

In the picture, Thoan is the small Thai woman who stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a hardworking married man with four children. He does produce buying and selling, majorly maize and beans. He has been in this business for 18 years and has been able to support his family, though price fluctuations and high transport costs affect his profitability expectations. He desires to increase his business stock.

Peter needs a loan to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Global Education School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is James. He is the Head Teacher of Global Education Centre School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kamuli with 500 students. Global Education Centre School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining an Ultra water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase an Ultra water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Global Education Centre School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. James ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Yosia

texts.en:
Yosia is a resident of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is 40 years old and a father of four children. He is a hardworking man and a cattle trader. He buys cattle and fattens them to mature faster for the growing cattle market in rural and urban areas. He earns extra income from dairy products he sells, like ghee and milk. 

His dreams are educating his children and buying a motorcycle to aid him in transporting his products with ease. However, he is faced with a lack of enough capital and seasonal changes, especially drought. 

Yosia wants a loan to buy more cattle for fattening to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening to sell.

loans.name: Kabale Tweimukye Development Group

texts.en:
Eriazare, with a hand raised in the photo, is a resident of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He buys and sells cattle in different markets to cattle dealers. He earns extra income from the growing of cereals like millet, wheat and maize. 

He has hopes of educating his children with proceeds from his business during the Christmas season, when cattle demand is at its peak. However, he is faced with a problem of cattle quarantines to serve different market segments.

Eriazare is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: St. Monica's School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Jonathan. He is the Head teacher of St. Monica’s Secondary School, a mixed school in the Rural-area of Mafubira in Jinja with 420 students. St. Monica’s Secondary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Monica’s Secondary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Jonathan ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Trinity School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Laston. He is the Head teacher of Trinity Junior School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kamuli district with 850 students. Trinity Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Trinity Junior School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Laston ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Our Lady School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Rose. She is the Administrator/Bursar of Our Lady Junior School, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Mukono town in Mukono district with 600 students. Our Lady Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Our Lady Junior School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Rose ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Kyomya School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is James. He is the Head Teacher of Kyomya Primary School, Buwagi a mixed school in the Rural area of Budondo in Jinja district with 1001 students. Kyomya Primary School, Buwagi has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a Tulip water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase Tulip Filtration water treatment system, With 20 Sets of 20 Litre Buckets which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kyomya Primary School, Buwagi will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. James ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Axam School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Moses. He is the Director of Studies of Axam Muslim Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Mukono town in Mukono district with 74 students. Axam Muslim Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a Tulip water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase Tulip Filtration water treatment system, With 5 Sets of 20 Litre Buckets which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Axam Muslim Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Moses ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Mukono Town School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Adiah. She is the Deputy Head Teacher of Mukono Town Muslim Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Mukono town in Mukono district with 955 students. Mukono Town School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mukono Town School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Adiah ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Mothercare School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Faith. She is the Head Teacher of Mother Care Nursery & Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Mukono town in Mukono district with 177 students. Mother Care School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mother Care School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Faith ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 39-year-old married male living in Masindi, Uganda. He is blessed with eight lovely children, of whom six go to school. He sells produce such as maize, beans and groundnuts to generate more income. He desires to educate his offspring and expand his business, though he faces difficulties of seasonality changes accompanied by high transportation costs. 

Patrick needs a loan to weed and plow his garden.

loans.use: to weed and plow his garden.

loans.name: Rusayumbe Abamwe Group

texts.en:
David, with a raised hand in the photo, is a resident of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is 59 years old and a father of ten children. He buys cattle and goats, selling them in different markets and to butchers. He earns extra income from farming. 

He has dreams of educating his children and penetrating urban markets for his business; however, he is faced with cattle raiders and the high cost of transport to serve different market areas. 

David wants a loan to buy more cattle and goats to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle and goats to sell.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashewnuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: El Coyol Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario el coyol lo conforman tres socios emprendedores, quienes solicitan financiamiento a la institución por primera vez. Lo coordina la señora Norma, quien tiene la edad de 36 años, acompañada y madre de tres hijos de las edades de 8, 9 y 15 años, por quienes se esfuerza en sus labores diarios, se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos Zermat desde hace dos años y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de perfumes para damas, perfumes para caballeros, pinturas labiales, cremas corporales, tratamiento para el cabello, etc., se ha propuesto como meta comprar al por mayor para aumentar el margen de ganancia. El resto de integrantes son el joven Miguel quien tiene la edad de 20 años y se dedica a la comercialización de frutas en uno de los mercados del norte del país, y la señora Manuela de 33 años de edad, quien se dedica a la compra-venta de frutas desde hace tres años.
texts.en: The communal loan group El Coyol is made up of three enterprising members who are requesting a loan from the institution for the first time. The coordinator is Norma, who is 36 years old. She lives with her partner and is the mother of three children who are 8, 9, and 15 years old. She works hard for them every day. She has been selling Zermat cosmetics for two year. She is requesting the loan to purchase perfumes for women and men, lipsticks, body lotions, hair treatments, ect. Her goal is to buy at wholesale price so she can increase her profit margin. The rest of the members are Miguel, who is 20 years old and sells fruits in one of the markets in the north of the country, and Manuela, 33 years old, who has been selling and buying fruits for the past three years.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 36 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, egg, etc.

Nancy has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 19 years and also earns an income from candy making.

Nancy aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, eggs, etc

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew needs a loan to buy fertilizers and weed his garden. 

Mathew is a hardworking man who grows sugarcane and maize to sell in order to boost his income, as well as sustaining his family. 

He is married with one child and lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. He started up a stationery shop to supplement his income generation. 

Mathew desires to modernize and expand his farm projects so as to improve on his income. However, price fluctuations, pests and diseases affect his crops, leading to low yields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and weed his garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more  fish to sell.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said, who in in his late 40s, is married with six children; three of them are in school, two of them are grown up, and the other one is still small. He has been a tailor since 1987. He works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Said's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to keep on buying better materials and employed a good designer for making better dresses and men's suits. He is doing fine with the loan and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, built a small house and opened a small grocery. He also covered household expenses.
