Mawulawoé has been reselling condiments for some time. She sells alone to customers in the market and stocks up in Lomé. 

Mawulawoé has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to purchase condiments. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Mawulawoé would like to grow her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad  y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 3 años a la agricultura siembra maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su hermano en casa propia, el joven está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
This young man's anonymity is being protected because he's 23 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He lives with his brother in his own house. He's been a corn farmer for three years, and he sells his produce in various markets near his home. 

He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, fungicides, and other products and also to improve the land that is shown in the photo. This will help him continue to work and earn more income.

loans.use: buy farming supplies and improve his land

loans.name: Elmer  Antonio

texts.es: Elmer, tiene 26 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 3 hijos, y reside con su familia en el municipio de Siguatepeque. Desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a la agricultura con su familia en los cultivos de maíz y frijoles. Hace 5 años comenzó a cultivar café el cual le ha dado buenos resultados, esta producción de café la vende en pergamino a los intermediarios en su misma zona. Esta solicitando un segundo ciclo de préstamo a la institución por 10,000 Lempiras, para invertirlos en la compra de abono y en limpieza de la finca de café, y  con esta asistencia sacara mayor producción. Su plan a futuro es sembrar media manzana de  café y darle buena asistencia para aumentar la producción.
texts.en:
Elmer, 26, lives with his common-law wife and their three children in the town of Siguatepeque.

He worked in agriculture with his family growing corn and beans from a very young age.  Five years ago he started growing coffee, which has given him good results.  He sells his coffee crop in parchment to intermediaries in his own area.

In his second loan cycle, he's asking the institution for 10,000 lempiras [HNL] to invest in buying soil amendments and in weeding his coffee farm so he can have a bigger crop.

His plan for the future is to plant a half-manzana of coffee and tend to it well so he can increase his production.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and to weed his coffee farm

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza signed up for membership with PMPC and accessed the needed capital to start up a torta (muffin) making business. She is thankful for the capital PMPC extends to a small time borrower like her.

 Liza was able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she accessed a loan to purchase two sacks of flour, one sack of sugar, eggs, and baking oil  for her torta (muffin) business.  In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of flour, one sack of sugar, eggs, and baking oil  for torta (muffin) business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma operates a motorcycle business.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Aside from being a motorcycle operator, she also has  a welding business to cater for the needs of her family. She accessed a loan to purchase tools and materials used for welding. She dreams of her own motor units and being able to provide for the family and expand her welding business as well.

loans.use: To purchase tools and materials used for welding  as another income generating activity

loans.name: Manuel Eduardo

texts.es:
Manuel Eduardo tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su padre, su conyuge y su hijo de 05 años, el cual esta en el nivel inicial, Manuel Eduardo vive en casa propia de material rustico por un lapso de 4 años, él cuenta con buenas referencias personales, laborales y economicas. Manuel Eduardo vive en una zona rural, contando con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad se dedica básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Manuel Eduardo es la venta de aves de corral, tales como gallinas, patos, cerdos, entre otros. Sus ventas las hace en restaurantes de la zona, tiene 4 años de experiencia en esta actividad, además se dedica a ser peón agrícola. El destino del crédito es para comprar una cantidad mayor de animales para poder aumentar y diversificar su stock, y así poder cumplir todos los gustos y preferencias de su público consumidor, además de satisfacer la demanda de la zona. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios, mayores ganancias y por ende obtiene una mejora en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel Eduardo is 29 years old and lives with his father, his partner, and their 5-year-old son, who is in primary school. Manuel Eduardo has lived in his own home, which is made of rustic material, for about 4 years. He has good personal, work, and financial references. He lives in a rural area with electricity and running water. Residents in his community make a living in agriculture, ranching, and commerce. It is located in the district of Pucará in the Jaén province, which is in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Manuel Eduardo makes a living by selling birds (chickens and ducks), pigs, and other animals. He sells to restaurants in the area. He has been working in this business for 4 years and is also a farmer. He will use the loan to purchase a large quantity of animals in order to increase and diversify his stock. This way, he will be able to cater to the tastes and preferences of his customers and satisfy the demand in his area. There is not great competition in the area, so he is able to set higher prices, earn more money, and provide a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of animals to increase and diversify his stock.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
Jose Santos tiene 62 años, es casado, vive en casa propia junto a sus 02 hijos y su esposa. Su familia es unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Jose Santos se dedica al servicio de mantenimiento y soldadura de maquinaria pesada, su negocio está ubicado al ingreso de Cayaltí desde hace más de 15 años. Además, percibe ingresos como jubilado de la empresa Cayaltí. Destino del crédito es para la inversión en compra de vehículo mototaxi para traslado de equipos y servicio de transporte. Con ello tendrá mejor facilidad para traslado de equipos de trabajo, mejorando su rapidez en la atención a clientes además de generarle ahorro en transporte, de esta forma sus ingresos aumentarán, para poder dar una mejora de calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Santos is 62 years old, is married, and lives in his own home with his two children and his wife. His family is united. He lives in a community whose residents work in commerce, agriculture, and ranching. His community is located in the Cayaltí district in the Chiclayo province, which is in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

Jose Santos maintains and welds heavy machinery for a living. His business has been located at the entry to Cayaltí for more than 15 years. He also receives income as a retired employee of the Cayaltí business. He will use the loan to purchase a mototaxi to transport equipment and provide transportation service. With this, he will be able to transport equipment more easily, which will allow him to provide faster services to his customers and save money on transportation. His income will increase as a result so that he can provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a mototaxi to transport equipment and to provide transportation services.

loans.name: Buganikere Twekambe Group

texts.en:
Angella, whose hand is raised, is a fifty two year old woman married with four children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. Despite her age, she is very hard working and has a clinic for human medicine. She also has a bar and a cocoa garden as supplementary sources of income. She started her business to get money and to educate her children. She hopes to educate her children and construct a permanent house.

She wants the loan to meet her dream of buying construction materials like iron sheets to finish her house which is on wall plates.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like iron sheets to finish her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials to invest in her business, which is her family's only source of income.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Kuña Guapa, lo que quiere decir, mujeres trabajadoras en español, le han puesto este nombre, ya que todas ellas son mujeres que se esfuerzan por poder salir adelante. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liz, quien se dedica a la costura, es muy buena en lo que hace y siempre tiene muy buena clientela, es una señora muy trabajadora y luchadora. Ella pide  este préstamo para comprar telas, hilos, alfileres, prendedores para mejorar el trabajo en  la costura y así poder aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
This group is called Kuña Guapa, Hardworking Women in Spanish.  They gave the group that name because all the women work hard to get ahead.  They're in the poverty-elimination program striving to improve their living conditions.

One of the members, Liz, earns her living sewing.  She's very good at what she does and always has very good customers.  She's a very hardworking and persistent woman.

Liz is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, needles, and clasps to improve her sewing work so she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, and clasps

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is heading into the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, with special attention to the much-needed land and seedbed preparations. 

She wants to have enough of a supply of farm fertilizer, so she applied for a loan from the Cooperative. 

She hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy palay (unmilled rice) fertilizer for more produce

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda, 57, is married and lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She has an adult age son. 

In order to help the family, she began engaging in dried fish vending, and PMPC supported her to start her chosen business. It has operated for 6 years already. Rosalinda thought of expanding her resources, so she decided to engage in a hog raising business for added income. 

Now, she is planning to borrow PHP 8,000 from Paglaum MP Cooperative, of which she became a member in 2012, to buy additional stock of dried fish to sell, and to pay for bags of feed for her growing hogs. She wants to have a stall in the public market to display her dried fish and be able to sell meat too. 

Someday she will be happy seeing her family with a comfortable life and live bountifully with them.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of dried fish to sell, and to pay for bags of feed for her growing hogs

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastian tiene 52 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 03 hijos dependientes, vive con su conyugue y sus 03 hijos; en el caserío de Sondor, distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. El caserío de Sondor es un caserío mediano con aspiraciones a superarse, el cual sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Sebastian se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de café ,de variedad Catimor de 04, 05 y 06 años de edad, cuenta con fincas fruteras de café en buen estado, dichos cultivos se encuentran ubicado a unos metros de su domicilio y una parte se encuentran ubicados a unos 15 minutos lomas arriba, Sebastian además se dedica a la cría de animales de corral y cultivo de pan llevar, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, el destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio, pues desea realizar la compra de abono para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, para así poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sebastian is 52 years old. He is in a common-law relationship and has 3 dependent children. He lives in the village of Sondor, in the district of Pomahuaca, Jaén province, Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru. The community of Sondor is a medium sized village with aspirations of growing. It's main activities are agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Sebastian works in agriculture. He grows coffee of the Catimor varietal, 4, 5 and 6 years old. His coffee plantation is in good shape. These crops are located a few meters from his house and another part is located 15 minutes further uphill. Sebastian also raises farm animals and grows grain. He has 10 years of experience in agriculture and has very good personal references.

The loan will be used to invest in his business as he wants to buy manure for the maintenance of his coffee crops. Then he can generate an acceptable profit to improve the quality of living for his family.

loans.use: to invest in his business buying manure to maintain his coffee crops.

loans.name: Emilyn

texts.en:
Emilyn, who is 41 years old, lives in Casusan, Oroquieta City, Philippines. 

She has a business doing direct selling of soaps, Ivory perfumes, etc, to help sustain the needs of her children in sending them to school. 

For this, she borrowed an amount of PHP 5,000 for her financing needs. This way, she can repay the debt she owes from PMPC through her return profit.

loans.use: To purchase lotion, Ivory soap & perfumes to sell

loans.name: Dinora Suyapa

texts.es: Dinora, tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y reside junto a ellos en un sector del Municipio de San Pedro Sula. Ella tiene su propia fuente de ingresos para sostener a la familia lleva 14 años de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz, ella compra la harina y las elabora en su casa y vende a sus vecinos de la comunidad. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 5,000 lempiras para comprar la harina de maíz y leña para elaborar tortillas y vender. Su propósito es tener el negocio para trabajar y poder sostener a su familia. Ella espera poderle dar estudio a sus hijos, hacer crecer el negocio, tener empleados y que su familia tenga mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Dinora, age 37, is the single mother of two children. They all live together in a neighborhood of the city of San Pedro Sula. She has her own source of income to maintain her family; for fourteen years she's been in the business of making and selling corn tortillas. She buys the flour, makes the tortillas in her home, and sells them to her neighbors. She is requesting this loan for 5,000 lempiras to buy corn flour and firewood to make and sell her tortillas. Her goal is to keep running her business so that she can support her family. She wants to keep her kids in school, grow her business, hire employees, and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy corn and firewood to make and sell tortillas

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Fala Bougoula, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales et de condiments. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur vingt sixième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente KONIBA, personne au milieu dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de céréales. Elle compte acheter 1 sac de mil sur place au village. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Massigui à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 8 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is composed of married women. On the average, they are 46 years old, with five children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Fala Bougoula, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative district of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell cereals and condiments. The group members are on their 26th solidarity loan. With the goal of meeting high customer demand, they have reached out to Soro Yiriwaso. 

Their loans will be used to purchase their merchandise as described above.
Our client Koniba, the one standing in the middle, is illiterate. She presently works selling cereals. She plans to buy one bag of millet locally. She retails in Massigui, for cash, to a mixed clientele. She plans to earn a monthly revenue of 8,000 West African francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Las Bellas Señoras Group

texts.es:
Las 19 integrantes de este comité cuentan con diversas actividades, cada una de ellas ponen su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante, son muy luchadoras y trabajadoras.
Mirian integra este grupo, ve una gran posibilidad de crecer y mejorar su vida y la de su familia por medio de su trabajo. Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias para poder seguir con sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y por sobre todo luchadora que se esfuerza por poder mejorar.
texts.en:
The 19 members of this bank have a variety of jobs.  They're very determined and hardworking.  Each one puts forth her best effort so she can grow and get ahead.

Mirian's a member of this group.  She sees her job as a great chance to grow and improve her life and her family's.  She's a very enterprising woman and, above all, a fighter who works hard so she can improve.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy a variety of clothes so she can continue with her sales and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elsa is 57 years old and one of her children is in school.

Elsa has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. Elsa requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shorts, pants, etc.

Elsa has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy additional items to sell like shorts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 33 years old and has five children. Arlene is married, and two of her children are in school.

Arlene is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Arlene requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Arlene has been farming rice for one year now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Esperanza 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esperanza 2 está en su ciclo número 8 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, para ir creciendo y mejorando en el emprendimiento de cada una. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 8 de las integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Fátima, quien se dedica a la venta de frutas frescas, es muy conocida porque siempre tiene de todo muy fresco. Fátima es muy trabajadora y sueña con poder seguir ayudando a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
Quiere comprar frutas frescas para poder seguir con sus ventas, agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Esperanza 2 Group is in its eighth loan cycle in the women's communal bank program.  Everyone works and helps each other get ahead so each one can keep growing and improving in her business venture.  They're doing the poverty-elimination survey, in which eight of the members are below the poverty line.

One of them is Fátima, who earns a living selling fresh fruit.  She's very well known because everything she has is always very fresh.  Fátima's very hardworking, and she dreams of being able to keep helping her family through her work.

Fátima wants to buy fresh fruit so she can continue with her sales.

She's grateful for this opportunity, which is going to be a big help to her.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit to sell

loans.name: Maria Ramela

texts.en:
Maria Ramela is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maria Ramela is 30 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Maria Ramela has a farming of rice business in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maria Ramela has been in this business for six years. In the future, Maria Ramela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 29 years old and has two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur, and both children are in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Maricel requested an 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Maricel has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKOLA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 50 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Sirifila, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales et de l’habillement. Les femmes du groupe BENKOLA sont à leurs vingt quatrième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente AMI, deuxième personne de la droite vers la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter 2 sacs de riz, de l’huile et des condiments chez les grossistes à Massigui. La vente des plats se fait en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Benkola group is made up of married women with an average age of 50 and, on average, 6 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Sirifila, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other thanks to family and neighbourly relationships, and friendships. They sell prepared food, cereals and clothing. The women of the Benkola group are on their 24th group loan. They are turning to Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to satisfy their enormous customer demand. The loan will be used to buy the merchandise mentioned above.

Ami, the second person on the right of the photo, is illiterate and sells prepared food. She plans to buy 2 bags of rice, oil and condiments from the Massigui wholesalers. She sells her meals at the market to a varied retail clientèle. She expects to make a monthly profit of 75 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Niño Salvador Group

texts.es:
Niño Salvador está en su 2° ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras que se están esmerando para crecer y ayudar a sus familias. Ellas están también dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lourdes, quien se dedica a las ventas de bazar, tiene todo tipo de productos, y gracias a su sacrificio y trabajo hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela. Ella quiere poder crecer y dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar artículos varios de bazar, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo y también mejorar.
texts.en:
Niño Salvador is a woman's group that is taking out its second loan. They are very hardworking women who are putting forth a lot of effort to grow and help their families. They are in the poverty elimination stage.

One of the members is Lourdes, who sells items in her general store. She sells many types of products and, thanks to her sacrifice and hard work, she now has many good customers. She would like to grow and provide her family with everything that they need. She requests this loan so that she can purchase items to sell in her general store. This way, she will be able to continue with her job as she has been doing and continue to improve.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Susan Abigail

texts.es:
Susan Abigail tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa familiar, junto a su menor hijo. Natural de la zona. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, como sustento principal, siembra y cosecha de banano, maíz, fréjol caupí. Etc. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Susan Abigail es a la compra y venta de fruta de temporada, realiza sus compras en las parcelas de los caseríos aledaños, esta actividad la realiza desde 2 años, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con buen comportamiento la localidad donde vive. El destino del crédito será para capital de trabajo(compra de una cantidad mayor de fruta) para poder comprar al por mayor con un menor precio y poder así aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Susan Abigail is 22 years old, is single, and lives with her family and her young son. She is from the area. Life in the area is peaceful and its residents work in agriculture and ranching. In order to sustain themselves, they grow and harvest bananas, corn, and black-eyed peas. The community is located in the district of Buenos Aires in the Morropón province, which is in the Piura region on Peru's northern coast.

Susan Abigail purchases and sells seasonal fruits. She purchases the fruit from neighboring villages and has been doing this work for 2 years. She has experience in the business and has performed well in the area where she lives.

She will use the loan for working capital (to purchase a large quantity of fruit) so that she can purchase in bulk at a lower price. This way, she will be abl to increase her income and, as a result, improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of fruit in bulk at a lower price.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Paulina is 55 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Paulina has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Paulina has been in this business for four years. In the future, Paulina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Eliza is 43 years old, and four of her children are in school.

Eliza has a meat shop business in the Philippines. Eliza requested a 28,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional meat to sell.

Eliza has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Eliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to sell

loans.name: Horacio

texts.pt:
O Sr. Horacio de 32 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e a outra e menor de idade para frequentar a escola.  Ele è cozinheiro a mais de 5 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (area, pedra, janelas, barotes e cimento) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
texts.en:
Horacio, 32 years old, is married and has three children, two of whom are in elementary school and one of whom is not yet of school age. He has been a cook for more than five years.
He will use this loan to purchase construction materials (sand, stone, windows, beams, and cement) to continue the construction on his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sand, stone, windows, beams, and cement) to continue the construction on his house.

loans.name: Nildo

texts.pt:
O  Sr. Nildo de 27 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos  uma esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e a outra è menor de idade para frequentar a escola. Ele è colaborador na empresa de producao de banana com cargo de  operario Agricola e è tambem negociante informal de produtos da  1ª necessidade actividade que esta a explorar no seu estabelicimento comerial na sua casa junto com sua esposa.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (cimento, blocos, arros, area, arames, janela, porta e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para iniciar com a construcao da sua casa.
texts.en:
Nildo, 27 years old, is married and has two children, one of whom is in elementary school and one of whom is not yet of school age. He is an agricultural worker at a banana company and also has an informal business selling staple goods, which he and his wife run out of their home.
He will use this loan to purchase construction materials (cement, cinder blocks, sand, wire, windows, and doors) and to pay for labor to start construction on his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, cinder blocks, sand, wire, windows, and doors) and to pay for labor to start construction on his house.

loans.name: Absalome

texts.pt:
O Sr. Absalome de 35 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4  filhos dos quais 2 estao a frequentar a  escola no ensino primario e os 2 sao menores de idade para frequentar a escola. Ele è operario agricola na empresa de producao de banana a mais de 4 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (blocos, cimento, chapas de zinco e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
texts.en:
Absalome, 35 years old, is married and has four children, two of whom are in elementary school and two of whom are still too young for school. He has been working for a banana company for more than four years.
He will use this loan to purchase construction materials (cinder blocks, cement, and sheet metal) and to pay for labor to continue the construction on his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cinder blocks, cement, and sheet metal) and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Olga

texts.pt:
A Sra. Olaga de 31 anos de idade casa e mae de 4 filhos todos a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario. Ela è Operaria Agricola na empresa de producao de  banana a mais de 3 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera apicado para comprar material de construcao (blocos, chapas de zinco, pedra e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa .
texts.en:
Olga is 31 years old and has four children, all of whom are in primary and secondary school. She has been an agricultural worker in a banana company for more than three years.
She will use this loan to purchase construction materials (cinder blocks, sheet metal, and stone) and to pay for labor to continue the construction on her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cinder blocks, sheet metal, and stone) and to pay for labor to continue the construction on her house.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Francisco está en el primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, todas están contentas con las capacitaciones que irán recibiendo  pues esto las ayudaran a incrementar sus ganancias.
Delia es peluquera, tiene una muy buena clientela, ya que siempre hace muy buen trabajo y cada cliente que va a su negocio queda muy conforme. Delia quiere seguir trabajando para poder dar fuente de trabajo a las demás personas, ya que ese siempre ha sido su meta.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, cremas, y otros insumos para poder seguir con su trabajo, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The 'San Francisco' group is in their first cycle of the Women's Committee program. They are all pleased with the training they will be receiving that will help them increase their profits.

Delia is a hair stylist who has a very good clientele. She always does a good job and each customer that visits her business leaves very satisfied. Delia wants to continue working in order to provide a source of employment for others. This has always been her goal.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of shampoo, rinses, dyes, creams and other supplies to continue with her work. It will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinses, dyes, creams and other supplies.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
18 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, son muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, una de ellas es la Sra. Lorena, es la Tesorera del Comité, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel 3, donde están mejorando sus condiciones de ingreso.
Ella a través de su esfuerzo y por medio de las ventas variadas de comidas está procurando por una vida mejor y sin privaciones. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar carne, pan, huevos, condimentos, verduras, para  la producción de empanadas y sándwiches etc. lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The 18 women who make up this group are very hardworking fighters.  

Lorena is the treasurer or the group.  On her last survey, she demonstrated a poverty level of three, since she is improving her financial situation.  Through her effort and work selling food, she is obtaining a better life without hardships.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase meat, bread, eggs, condiments, and vegetables to make empanadas and sandwiches.  This will help her to have a concrete plan for her business, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase meat, bread, eggs, condiments, and vegetables.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Sirifila, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments et de l’habillement. Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leurs vingt quatrième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente MARIAM, deuxième personne de la gauche vers la droite est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter des sacs d’oignon, des sacs de sel, des cartons de cube Maggi et des boites de patte de tomate chez les grossistes à Massigui. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of married women with an average age of 44 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Sirifila, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other thanks to family and neighbourly relationships, and friendships. They sell prepared food, condiments and clothing. The women of the Danaya group are on their 24th group loan. They are turning to Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to satisfy their large customer demand. The loan money will be used to buy the merchandise mentioned above.

Mariam, the second person on the left of the photo, is illiterate and currently sells condiments. She plans to buy bags of onions, bags of salt, boxes of Maggi stock cubes and boxes of tomato paste from the Massigui wholesalers. She sells her meals for cash at the market to a varied retail clientèle. She expects to make a monthly profit of 100 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is driven by passion for selling. At the age of 35, a married woman in Oroquieta City, she runs a store that primarily supports her family. Everyday she never get tired of tending her store. 

Irene is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without any record of default. Now, she is taking another loan to purchase canned goods, noodles and soft drinks. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. 

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, and soft drinks for her store.

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC in 2009. She has six children of which 5 are adult age and the other one is still at school age. 

She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC  came as a rescue to Flaviana, lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she is taking another loan for this quarter's cropping. She is borrowing an amount to pay for land and seedbed preparation on her rice farm. 

Flaviana perseveres and always believes she will reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation on her rice farm for this quarter's cropping

loans.name: Teresa

texts.pt:
A Sra Teresa de 42  anos de idade, casada e mae de 3 filhos que estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario. Ela è Operaria Agricola na  empresa de producao de banana a mais de 6 anos e è tambem negociante informal de produtos da machamba na sua casa, actividade que esta a ser acompanhada junto com seu esposo.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (blocos, cimento, barrotes, area,cimento, varroes  e pagamento de mao de obra.) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
Tem com   grande desafio melhor as condicoes habitacionais e a dieta alimentar da sua familia.
texts.en:
Teresa is 42 years old. She is married and has three children who are in primary and secondary school. She is an agricultural worker at a banana company and also has an informal business with her husband selling produce out of their home.
She will use this loan to purchase construction materials (cinder blocks, cement, beams, sand, and rebar) and to pay for labor to continue the construction on her house.
Her biggest goal is to improve her family's living conditions and diet.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cinder blocks, cement, beams, sand, and rebar) and to pay for labor to continue the construction on her house.

loans.name: Regina

texts.pt:
A Sra.Regina de 50  anos de idade, casada e mae de 3 filhos que estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario. Ela è Operaria Agricola na  empresa de producao de banana.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (blocos, cimento, barrotes, area,cimento, varroes  e pagamento de mao de obra.) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
Tem como grande desafio melhor as condicoes de habitacionais de forma a dar mais conforto a familia.
texts.en:
Regina, 50 years old, is married and has three children who are in primary and secondary school. She is an agricultural worker at a banana company.
She will use this loan to purchase construction materials (cinder blocks, cement, beams, sand, and rebar) and to pay for labor to continue the construction on her house.
Her biggest goal is to improve her family's living conditions and offer them a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cinder blocks, cement, beams, sand, and rebar) and to pay for labor to continue the construction on her house.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.pt:
O Sra. Fatima de 32 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos uma a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e a outra è menor de idade para frequentar a escola. Ela è colaboradora na empresa de producao de banana com cargo de  operaria Agricola. 
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (cimento, blocos, arros, area, arames, janela, porta e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para iniciar com a construcao da sua casa.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condicoes de habitacao.
texts.en:
Fatima, 32 years old, is married and has two children, one of whom is in school and one of whom is not yet of school age. She is an agricultural worker in a banana company. 
She will use this loan to purchase construction materials (cement, cinder blocks, sand, wire, windows, and doors) and to pay for labor to start the construction on her house.
Her biggest goal is to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, cinder blocks, sand, wire, windows, and doors) and to pay for labor to start the construction on her house.

loans.name: Solfa

texts.pt:
A Sra. Solfa  de 24 anos de idade, casada e tem 2 filhos que  frequentam o ensino primario. Ela è Operaria  Agricola numa empresa de producao de banana.
O presente emprestimo sera aplicado para compra de material de construcao ( blocos, cimento, janelas, Chapas,pagamento de transporte e mao-de-obra)  para dar continuidade asua casa.
texts.en:
Solfa is 24 years old and has two children who are in elementary school. She is an agricultural worker at a banana company.
She will use this loan to purchase construction materials (cinder blocks, cement, windows, and sheet metal) and to pay for transport and labor to continue the construction on her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cinder blocks, cement, windows, and sheet metal) and to pay for transport and labor to continue the construction on her house.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.pt:
O senhor Ismael  é comerciante e presta servicos como mecanico com oficina na sua casa, pai solteiro de 4 filhos 2 dos quais a frequentar o ensino primario e 2 ainda menores de idade, vive na casa propria.
Ele diz que com este valor irá comprar capacetes, pneus para motorizadass, baterias, cameras de ar, velas, bobinas para refocar a sua oficina.
No futuro tem como planos ampliar o seu negocio na mecanica e serralharia continuar a inovar e fazer tchopelas.
Diz que ira pagar conforme o calendario e solicitar mais emprestimos e que alem  da pensao tem machambas onde pratica o cultivo de diversos tipos de produtos que servem de reforco da renda familia.
texts.en:
Ismael is a mechanic and has a workshop in his house. He is a single father with four children, two of whom are in elementary school and two of whom are still too young for school. He lives in his own home.
He says he will use this loan to buy hard-hats, tires, batteries, air pumps, headlights, and coils to restock his workshop.
In the future he plans to expand his mechanic and locksmith business and begin to build motorcycle taxis.
He says he will pay off his loan promptly so he can request more loans and that he also has a small farm where he grows a variety of products that bolster his family's income.

loans.use: to buy hard-hats, tires, batteries, air pumps, headlights, and coils to restock his workshop.

loans.name: Mujeres Divinas Group

texts.es:
Este unido grupo se llama Mujeres Divinas, todas tienen el sueño de poder ir creciendo y mejorando para poder dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y con las capacitaciones, la Sra. Carmen está mejorando su estilo de vida, ella hace comidas variadas, y ya tiene muy buena clientela.
También se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones. La Sra. Carmen está pidiendo este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, hortalizas y demás, de manera a poder continuar con su pequeño emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Divinas group is very united.  They all have a dream of being able to grow and improve so that they can give their families everything that they were not able to have.

Thanks to her efforts, continuous work, and trainings, Carmen has been improving her lifestyle.  She makes a variety of foods and already has many customers.  She also wants to highlight the work of the counselors, who have followed up on trainings and her progress.  

Carmen is requesting this loan to be able to purchase ingredients for her food, including greens, condiments, vegetables, and other items.  This will allow her to continue with her small business.

loans.use: to purchase greens, condiments, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes à domicile, Ablavi malgré son âge se bat pour apporter le meilleure d'elle même à sa famille. Pour cela, elle sollicite un premier crédit afin d'acheter des pagnes pour servir sa clientèle. A l'avenir, elle espère améliorer la taille de l'activité et subvenir pleinement aux besoins de la famille. Veuve âgée de 59ans, elle est mère de 04 enfants en âge majeur.
texts.en: Ablavia sells pagnes (highly decorative and colourful West African clothing) door-to-door and fights to do the best she can for her family, despite her age. She is therefore requesting her first loan so that she can buy some pagnes for her customers. In the future, she hopes to be able to expand her business and fully meet her family's needs. A 59-year-old widow, she is the mother of 4 adult children.

loans.use: to buy pagnes.

loans.name: Aida

texts.pt:
A Sra. Aida de 57 anos de idade casada e mae de 4 filhos todos a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario. Ela è Operaria Agricola na empresa de producao de  banana a mais de 5 anos è tambem negociante informal de produtos da machamba.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (blocos, chapas de zinco, pedra e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa .
texts.en:
Aida is 57 years old. She is married and has four children who are in primary and secondary school. She has been working for a banana company for more than five years and also has an informal business selling produce.
She will use this loan to purchase construction materials (cinder block, sheet metal, and stone) and to pay for labor to continue the construction on her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cinder block, sheet metal, and stone) and to pay for labor to continue the construction on her house.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo is from Oroquieta City. He is a very responsible father when it comes to the welfare of his family, since he has always been known to provide the best for them. 

He is earning a living in his retail business. In order to generate more income, Rodolfo decided to expand his resources after he learned that he can get financial assistance from PMPC. Consequently, he requested a loan to restock inventory for his store to increase sales. 

Rodolfo smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing his family and grandchildren with a better life.

loans.use: to restock inventory for his store and increase sales

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario, 43 years old, lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She was gifted with six children. 

Rosario is the breadwinner for the family. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself plowing the rice field, planting vegetables and other varieties of agricultural commodities. 

In need of additional working capital, Rosario decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 35,000 to pay for labor costs for cultivating her land.

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Rosario is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. 

She hopes that her children will finish their studies someday.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and land cultivation.

loans.name: Alecia

texts.en:
Alecia  is 51 years old and married. 

Through Paglaum MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets & feed. Now, she requests a loan of 14,900 PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes & prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. 

Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily maintain more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with three children. Elizabeth is 34 years old and has three children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Elizabeth has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish, ice and plastic bags.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Elizabeth  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish, ice and plastic bags.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is 38 years old, with three children and two of her children are in school, Cleofe works very hard to provide for them.

Cleofe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc..

Cleofe has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Cleofe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 44 years old and has five children. Edna is a married woman with four children of her children in school.

Edna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Edna has been raising pigs for 1 year now, and has sustained her business by borrowing once in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nasur

texts.en: Nasur is a 35-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a retailer, and at the same time a motorcycle rider. He sells shoes and repairs them. He hopes to open a bigger shoe shop in his area so as to serve the increasing demand from his customers, though inadequate capital affects his business growth. Nasur needs a loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old and married with two children.

Elizabeth is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elizabeth has been raising pigs for 17 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 26 years old and married with two children; one of her children is in school. Alma works very hard to provide for them.

Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc..

Alma has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 53 years old and has three children. Dolores is widowed; she works very hard to provide for them.

Dolores is in the agricultural business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Dolores has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Dolores would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Judelen

texts.en:
Judelen is 34 years old and has two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Judelen has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines. Judelen requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy nail polish, nail brush, hot oil, etc.

Judelen has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Judelen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, nail brush, etc.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with one child. Mary Ann is 24 years old now, and she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mary Ann has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, etc..

Mary Ann has been in this business for 2 years.  In the future, Mary Ann would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Analee

texts.en:
Analee is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analee is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.

Analee has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials for fishing.

Analee has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Analee would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 41 years old and married with three children all of whom are in school, Miriam works very hard to provide for them.

Miriam runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Miriam has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future, Miriam would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Edelina

texts.en:
Edelina is 54 years old and widowed with five children. Three of her children are in school; Edelina works very hard to provide for them.

Edelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages etc..

Edelina has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Edelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages etc.

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa is 38 years old and single. Lisa works very hard to provide for her daily needs.

Lisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc..

Lisa has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future, Lisa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Creciendo Juntas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama creciendo juntas, ya que todas se unieron para trabajar de manera unida, y por medio de ese trabajo ir creciendo todas unidas y juntas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nemecia, una mujer muy humilde, que sueña con poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida a través de su trabajo, y con la ayuda de su grupo y con las capacitaciones que le irá dando la fundación paraguaya a través de su programa de comité de mujeres.
Ella solicita de este préstamo para la compra jabones variados para la venta, ya que ella se dedica a esto, y por medio de esto ayuda a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Creciendo Juntas' (Growing Together) because they all got together to work and grow in a united way.

One of the members is Nemecia, a very humble woman who dreams of improving her lifestyle through her work with the help of the rest of the group and the training that the 'Fundacion Paraguaya' give her as part of the women's committee.  

She is asking for a loan to buy a variety of soaps to sell, as this is her business and it provides her with a way to look after her family.

loans.use: to buy soaps to sell.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Antonio se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, este grupo esta con ganas de salir adelante,  quieren emprender alguna actividad  para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia en especial.
Cindy es una de ellas, es peluquera, una señora muy sacrificada y luchadora, que quiere dar a su familia todo, para una vida digna y sin privaciones. Pide este préstamo para comprar insumos varios para su peluquería, para poder seguir dando a sus clientes una buena atención.
texts.en:
The group 'San Antonio' is in its first cycle in the Women's Committee program.  All the members of this group want to progress in life.  They all want to start up some business to improve their quality of life and that of their families.  

Cindy is a hairdresser.  She is very hard-working and tenacious.  She wants to do whatever she can for her family, so that they can have a dignified life without wanting for anything.  

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies for her hair salon so that she can continue offering an excellent service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a hairdresser's.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana, 56, is a married woman and has ten children. Three of her children are still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years.

Ana requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Ana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 54 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines.

Annie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional livestock, feed, and other supplies for her business. She has been raising livestock for eight years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF, to sustain her business.

In the future, Annie would like to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feed, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
La  Sra. Nidia  tiene 47 años, es separada y tiene 4 hijos todos mayores que pudo sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo.
Comenta que ella empezó vendiendo ropas usadas en un pasillo en el mercado, luego de varios años de sacrificio y dedicación logro conseguir una casilla en un mercado, y montar un pequeño comedor que le da muy buenos resultados ya con una  buena clientela formada . Gracias al trabajo que esta realizando puedo llevar una vida digna y ayudarle a sus hijos y nietos . 
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su comedor, como ser: aceite, carne, pollo, harina, yerba, gaseosas entre otros, de manera a poder seguir dando una buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nidia, 47, is separated and has four children who are all of an adult age.  She was able to bring them all up with a lot of sacrifice.  

She started selling used clothes in the market.  Gradually, after a lot of effort, she was able to open up a small food stall which has given her great results and a regular customer base.  

Thanks to this work, she is able to lead a dignified life and help her children and grandchildren.  

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies for her food stall.  These things include oil, meat, chicken, flour, herbs and soft drinks.  This way, she can continue to offer an excellent service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy oil, meat, chicken, flour, herbs and soft drinks among other things.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en: Amor, a mother of three, makes a living by providing photocopy and encoding services to people in her community. Her husband is now working abroad to earn more income for the family. She has been in this business for many years and earns a good income. She has repaid her previous loan successfully  which she used for buying materials. To improve her services, Amor requested a new loan to buy bond paper, ink, folders and other materials needed for her printing services. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the quality of life for her entire family.

loans.use: to buy bond paper, ink, folders and other materials needed for her printing services.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a fishing and fish vending business, in the Philippines.

Brenda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this amount to buy additional materials and gear for her business. She has been in this business for five years, now.

She would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

loans.name: Elenida

texts.en:
Elenida is 52 years old and married. She has eight children, and she earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Elenida is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in the pig fattening business for 12 years, and she earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formo en la ciudad de Asunción, con la unión de varias amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, se destacan por el esmero que están poniendo, ya que quieren superarse y crecer para ayudar a sus familias.
Alicia es la presidenta de este grupo, una mujer luchadora y con muy buena pasta para los negocios, es la cabeza de este grupo, y comenta que no es muy fácil, ya que siempre trata de incentivar a sus amigas del grupo.
Ella se dedica a la venta de lencería y comenta que pide este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de lencerías varias, y así poder tener una mayor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientas.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the city of Asunción from several friends and neighbors coming together. They are characterized by their diligence; they want to grow and improve in order to help their families.

Alicia is the president of this group, a tenacious woman who is well-suited for business. She is the head of the group and she notes that it is not very easy because she is always trying to provide incentives for her friends.

She works in lingerie sales and is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of assorted lingerie so she will have a greater variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy assorted lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Reynold

texts.en:
Reynold is a very dedicated son, who wants to become successful in the future. He studies at a university, concentrating in the field of Seafarer. His parents are both busy with their business. Reynold has five siblings, living with his family.

He borrowed this loan from GDMPC, for the purpose to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester. In the future, he would find a better job, according to his desire.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester of Seafarer studies

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Señor Francisco tiene 52 años, esta casado hace 32 años con la señora Feliciana con quien tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales uno ya esta casado y tres de ellos viven con su padre, ya que la Sra. Feliciana se encuentra trabajando en el extranjero desde donde ayuda a su marido.
El señor Francisco, se dedica a la compra y venta de mandioca (alimento típico paraguayo), carbón,  para la cual dispone de un camión en la cual reparte los productos que tiene por los negocios de los barrios y también tiene su puesto en el mercado, para esto cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, todos forman una familia muy trabajadora.
El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de mandioca, carbón, y así poder cumplir con todos sus clientes y por ende mejorar su ingreso y poder llevar una vida digna.-
texts.en:
Francisco is 52 and has been married for 32 years to Feliciana. They have 4 children, one of whom is married and three of whom live with Francisco. Feliciana works abroad and helps her husband from there.
Francisco buys and sells cassava (a traditional Paraguayan food) and coal. He has a truck with which he delivers his products to the local businesses. He also has a stall in the market. His children help him with this; they are all part of a very hard-working family.
Francisco is requesting this loan for the purchase of cassava and coal in order to satisfy all of his customers and improve his income in order to be able to live a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy cassava and coal for sale.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is a very dedicated husband who wants to become successful in the future. He studies for an Associate in Information Technology (AIT) in a university. He is earning from his transportation services and earns good income that was able to support his family and his studies. He has three children living. 

He borrowed this loan from GDMPC to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester. In the future, he wants to become successful with his family.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
Manilyn is a single mother of one who settled to earn her living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Over the past four years, Manilyn has been able to run her retail store that sells grocery goods in their village. She repaid successfully her previous loan used for the business. She learned to become a good businesswoman and her business is doing well. 

She took a new loan recently to purchase grains and canned goods in addition to her groceries to sell in her store. With this, Manilyn expects an increase in sales so she can expand her business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase grains and canned goods in addition to her groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel vive con su papá, comenta que es huérfano de madre y es él quien ayuda a su padre en la fotocopiadora que tienen como negocio, y que es sustento de la familia.
Está estudiando la carrera de licenciatura en informática, y quiere poder ser un gran licenciado y poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Miguel lives with his dad. He says that his mother has died, and he helps his father in their copy shop. This business is what maintains their family financially.

He is majoring in informatics, and he wants to be able to be a successful graduate and help other people.

He is requesting this loan to pay his tuition.

loans.use: to pay college fees

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en:
Pacencia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Pacencia is 46 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Pacencia has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Pacencia requested a 29,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Pacencia has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Pacencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is 42 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Sherlita is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Sherlita has been in pig fattening for 25 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. Violeta is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Violeta requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

Violeta has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, 31, is a married woman who has one child. Her child is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur, with a fishing and fish vending business, in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional materials for her business, like fish containers, fishing nets, etc. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Gloria would like to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business, like fish containers, fishing nets, etc.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a sewing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 26 years, and she earns more income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use this amount to buy additional materials for her sewing business, like fabric, thread, and zippers.

Leonida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her sewing business, like fabric, thread, and zippers.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is single and has a buy-and-sell mango business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase additional crates of mangoes to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional crates of mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Gabriel joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Peter, Hajara and Yakubu. 

Gabriel is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Gabriel expects to reap up to 30 bags per hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags per hectare. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Gabriel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate expenses such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Gabriel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Gabriel to generate earnings of up to $1000 per hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

“I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, "Gabriel said. "And ultimately, I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses such as his children's school fees, food, and farm loan repayments.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan es comerciante, junto con su Señora vende a cuotas todo tipo de productos, por lo que ya tiene una muy buena clientela.
El Señor Juan, dos veces a la semana va a una Fabrica de Aceite donde tiene muchos clientes y les deja ropas y calzados de marca deportivos.
Es una persona muy trabajadora que esta luchando por poder seguir creciendo y luchando.
Pide este prestamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, para poder seguir con sus ventas, ya que le trae buena ganancia y por medio de ello ayuda a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a businessman. He and his wife sell all kinds of products on credit and have a very good clientele. Twice a week, Juan goes to an oil factory where he has many customers and leaves them clothing and athletic footwear. He is a very hardworking person, striving to continue growing and fighting.

He is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of various items of clothing to continue with his sales. It brings him a good profit and therefore helps his family.

loans.use: to buy various items of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de condiments, de tubercule, de l’habillement, de savon et de pot.
Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente ROKIA, première personne de la gauche vers la droite est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de l’habillement. Elle compte acheter des puces de pagnes wax chez les grossistes à Bamako. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group TIESSIRI is composed of married women, who average 45 years of age and six children each. All the women live in traditional families in the city of Fana, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, tubers, clothing, soap, and [pots and pans].

The women of the group TIESSIRI are on their fourth solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, ROKIA, the person first from the right in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of clothing. She intends to purchase lengths of Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) from wholesalers in Bamako. 

Her sales are made at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash at her home and at the market. She plans on making a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Martha Julia

texts.es:
Martha Julia tiene 51 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, reside en el distrito de Buenos Aires en el caserío Carrasquillo junto a sus hijos, en casa propia. La localidad donde vive es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz. Y está ubicada en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Martha Julia es a la crianza y venta de gando caprino, y venta de cerveza, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 4 años en la misma actividad. Martha Julia realiza sus ventas en su domilio, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, laborales y crediticias en la zona donde vive. El destino del crédito será para mejora de sun vivienda, pues desea arreglar el techo porque ya se viene la temporada de lluvias. Con el préstamo cliente podrá darle mayor seguridad a su familia mejorando así su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martha Julia, age 51, lives with her partner and children in their own home in the Buenos Aires district of the Carrasquiillo neighborhood. They are provided basic services such as water and electricity. The area is located in the Morropón province in the Piura region along the northern coast of Peru. The population in the area are farmers, cattle ranchers, and merchants. 

Martha Julia's particular work is raising and selling goat herds, as well as selling beer. She has four years of experience in this line of work.
