Martha Julia does her sales out of her home, and she has very good personal and professional credit references in the area where she lives. This loan will be used to improve her dwelling. They need to repair their roof because the rainy season is coming soon. With this loan, this customer will be able to provide her family with greater security and an improved quality of life.

loans.use: repair her roof before the rainy season

loans.name: Rogee

texts.en:
Rogee is very dedicated to his study and wants to become successful in the future. He studies to become a Seafarer, at a university. His parents are earning income from their own farm. He has two siblings living with his family.

He borrowed this loan from GDMPC, for the purpose to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester. In the future, he wants to find a job that will enable him to support himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester of Seafarer studies

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta, 49, is a married woman and has six children. Two of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a business, buying and selling dried coconut meat, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Loreta requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the funds to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

In the future, Loreta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 35 years old and married. She has three children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for two years, and she earns additional income from keeping a general store.

Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use this loan to buy additional livestock, feed, and other supplies for her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feed, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Virginia has requested a 23,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy spare parts, gasoline, and tools for her motorcycle.

Virginia has been in this business for 6 years now.

Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline, and tools for her motorcycle

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is 61 years old and married with nine children.  

Apolonia is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Apolonia requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Apolonia has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Apolonia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 46 years old and has three children. Jean is married, and one child is still in school.

Jean is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Jean requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Jean has been in pig fattening for seven years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Jean would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 30 years old and has two children. Mary Jane is married, and one child is currently in school.

Mary Jane is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Jane has been in pig fattening for eight years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Mary Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es de la ciudad de Encarnación,  es casada, es estudiante, sigue la carrera de contabilidad, y está actualmente en la etapa de tesis, comenta que se esforzó mucho para poder llegar a donde está y que es muy sacrificado.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar los gastos que tiene por su tesis, ya que es muy costoso y quiere poder cubrirlos, para poder cumplir su meta de ser una profesional que sea útil a los demás.
texts.en:
Graciela is from the city of Encarnacion.  She is married, and is also studying for a degree in accounting.  She is now at the thesis stage, and she comments that she worked really hard to get to where she is, and it took a lot of sacrifice.

She is requesting this loan to pay for her thesis expenses, because it is quite costly and she wants to be able to cover these payments so that she can accomplish her goal of becoming a professional who is useful to others.

loans.use: to pay for her thesis expenses

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 50 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Loreta is borrowing 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Loreta has been in pig fattening for 30 years and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 30 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Maricel is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Maricel has been in pig fattening for 12 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 44 years old and has four children. Mercedita is married, and all four children are in school.

Mercedita is in the agricultural business of raising chickens in the Philippines. Mercedita requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her business.

Mercedita has been raising chickens for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Anven

texts.en:
Anven is a married woman with 6 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anven is 59 years old and 2 of her children are still in school.

Anven has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Anven has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Anven has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Anven would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 46 years old and married with six children.

Liza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Liza has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from an Internet cafe and selling charcoal.

Liza aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy products for her food sales business

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADEYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 49 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Sirifila, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales, de condiments et de l’habillement. Les femmes du groupe BADEYA sont à leurs vingt quatrième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente NENE, première personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de l’habillement. Elle compte acheter des puces de pagne chez les grossistes à Bamako. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group BADEYA is composed of married women, who average 49 years of age and six children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of Sirifila, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in grains, condiments, and clothing.

The women of the group BADEYA are on their 24th solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as already mentioned.


This client, NENE, the person standing first from the right in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of clothing. She intends to purchase lengths of Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) from wholesalers in Bamako. 

Her sales are made at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash at her home and at the market. She plans on making a monthly profit of 120,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 42 years old and married with three children.

Merlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, sugar, coffee, snack foods, soft drinks, milk, etc., to sell.

Merlinda has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Merlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, sugar, coffee, snack foods, soft drinks, milk, etc., to sell

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 41 years old and has five children. Mildred is married, and three children are still in school.

Mildred is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Mildred requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mildred has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mildred would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nomeriana

texts.en:
Nomeriana is 41 years old and has five children. Nomeriana is married, and two children are currently in school.

Nomeriana is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Nomeriana requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nomeriana has been in pig fattening for 22 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nomeriana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Indira

texts.ru: Индира, 33 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Индиры средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав в 1995 году благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Индиры, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 3 коровы, 10 овец и 1 лошадь. Также есть земельный надел мерою 2,96 ГА, где Индира выращивает картофель. Ежемесячный доход Индиры составляет от 10,000 сом (KGS). Индира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для закупки 20 овец. Кредит позволит увеличить капитал семьи и поголовье скота. Доходы от кредита она хочет направить на оплату за обучение детей.
texts.en:
Indira is 33 and married and raising three children. She has a specialist high school education and works in agriculture and animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began in 1995. Thanks to her hard work, persistence and determination, she currently has three cows, 10 sheep and one horse as well as 2.96 hectares of land where she grows potatoes. Her monthly income is about 10,000 KGS.

Indira has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase 20 sheep. The loan will allow her to improve her family's financial situation and increase her head count of livestock. She wants to use profits from the loan to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 48 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de fruits et légumes, du bois de chauffe, de chaussure et de divers. Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente DOUSSOU, première personne de la droite vers la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de fruits et légumes. Elle compte acheter des paniers de banane et de tomate chez les grossistes à Banco. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group DJEKAFO is composed of married women, who average 48 years of age and four children each. All the women live in traditional families in the city of Fana, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in fruit & vegetables, firewood, shoes, and general merchandise.

The women of the group DJEKAFO are on their 5th solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as already mentioned.


This client, DOUSSOU, the person first from the right in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of fruit & vegetables. She intends to purchase baskets of bananas and tomatoes from wholesalers in Banco. Her sales are made at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash at the market. She plans on making a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 39 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Margarita has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Margarita requested a loan from NWTF for 16,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional materials, such as abaca fiber,  for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as abaca fiber  for her business

loans.name: Roquesa

texts.en:
Roqueza is a married woman and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Roqueza is 30 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Roqueza has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Roqueza has been in this business for four years. In the future, Roqueza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. Veneranda has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Veneranda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23-year-old single man from Deir el Balah. He lives with his family in a very simple and humble house. His father works as an employee with a very low income. 

Two years ago, he started working in transferring goods using a rickshaw. It is a good business and provides the family with a good income. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to use instead of the old one. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to improve his business and also his income. 

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to use instead of the old one.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Sirifila, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments, de l’habillement et de vanne. Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leurs vingt quatrième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente BATOMA, première personne de la gauche vers la droite est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter des sacs de sel, des sacs d’oignon, du grain d’arachide et du grain de néré chez les grossistes à Massigui. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 110 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group DJIGUISSEME is composed of married women, who average 45 years of age and four children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of Sirifila, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in condiments, clothing, and wickerware.

The women of the group DJIGUISSEME are on their 24th solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above.


This client, BATOMA, the person first from the right in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of condiments. She intends to purchase bags of salt, bags of onions, peanuts, and néré seeds from wholesalers in Massigui. Her sales are made at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash at the market and at her home. She plans on making a monthly profit of 110,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Elen

texts.en:
Elen, age 28, is a married woman who has one child. Her child is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur, with a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Elen requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan, to further build her business.

Elen has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough, to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is 29 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Vicky has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending. Vicky aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is married and works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Violeta requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Susie

texts.en:
Susie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines, and other supplies for her raising livestock business. Susie has been in this business for 11 years. Susie also earns more income from selling vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Susie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Violeta is 52 years old, and one child is still in school.

Violeta has a tobacco selling business in the Philippines. Violeta requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of tobacco to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Violeta has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of tobacco to sell to her customers

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Crestita is 38 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years. 

Crestita requested her second loan from NWTF for 17,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional raw materials, such as abaca fiber, for her business.
She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials, such as abaca fiber, for her business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 39 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorna operates a charcoal business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 20 years. 

Lorna requested her second loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Silvano

texts.en: Silvano is a hardworking married man who has five children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a retailer, and at the same time, he does farming. He faces a challenge of limited capital. He hopes to construct rental units, to earn more income. Silvano needs a loan to add stock for his business to sell, including sugar, soap, and cooking oil.

loans.use: to add stock for his business, including sugar, soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en: Tadeo is a 59-year-old man who has seven children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a piggery project, and at the same time, he does dairy farming, which generates additional income for him. He faces a challenge of bees, which disturb neighbors who would be potential customers. Tadeo hopes to become a leading pig farmer in his village. He has asked for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.ru: Мавлюда, 46 лет, замужем, есть сын. У Мавлюды среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Мавлюда в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 20 лет занимается полеводством. В хозяйстве есть земельный надел мерою 0,22 ГА, где она выращивает картофель для  реализации. Экологически чистая, вкусная продукция пользуется большим спросом. Начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду Мавлюды, ее деятельность приносит около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Супруг Мавлюды - ветеран войны, он и сын активно помогают по хозяйству. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мавлюда обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля, минеральных удобрений для обработки почвы. Доходы от кредита Мавлюда планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также в будущем хочет купить земельный участок.
texts.en:
Mavlyuda is 46 and married with one son. She has a high school education and is well respected among her neighbours, who call her a kind and hardworking woman. She has been working in agriculture for 20 years as the primary source of income for her family, and currently has 0.22 hectares of land where she grows potatoes for sale. Organic, flavourful produce is in great demand. She started her business with 5,000 KGS and thanks to her hard work now brings in around 7,000 KGS per month, which serves as the main means of covering food and everyday living expenses for her family. Her husband is a war veteran, and he and her son actively help with the business.

With the goal of further developing her business, Mavlyuda has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase seed potatoes and mineral fertilizers to amend the soil. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and in the future wants to purchase more land.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes and fertilizer to cultivate her land and grow organic vegetables

loans.name: Bonswendtelgo Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA est la représentante du groupe BONSWENDTELGO. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 13 ans et le moins âgé a 09ans.  02 vont  à l’école. Elle a 06 personnes en charge.
Madame vend des gâteaux  depuis 06 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les boutiques  de son quartier. 
Elle  veut s’acheter 03sacs de farine de blé, 03bidons d’huile et 02sacs de sucre pour faire ses gâteaux.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour payer la scolarité de ses enfants et renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne construire une maison d’habitation pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. AMINATA is the representative of the group BONSWENDTELGO. A married mother, she has two children. The oldest is 13 years old, and the youngest is 9. Two go to school. She has six persons to support. 

Ms. AMINATA has been selling cakes for six years. She gets her supplies from shops in her districts. She wants to purchase 3 sacks of wheat flour, 3 containers of oil, and 2 bags of sugar to make cakes. 

She wants to use her profits to pay for her children’s schooling and to bolster her business. Her ambition is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, oil, and sugar to make cakes

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de l’habillement, de charbon, de savon et de la galette. Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente KADIATOU, deuxième personne de la droite vers la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de l’habillement. Elle compte acheter des pagnes de Bazin et des puces de pagnes wax chez les grossistes à Bamako.
 La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 110 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group TIESSIRI is composed of married women, who average 32 years of age and three children each. All the women live in traditional families in the city of Fana, in Commune de Guégnéka, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in cloth, charcoal, soap, and galettes. 

The women of the group TIESSIRI are on their 5th solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above. 

This client, KADIATOU, the person second from the right, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of cloth. She intends to purchase some lengths of damask and of Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) from wholesalers in Bamako. Her sales are made at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash at the market. She plans on making a monthly profit of 110,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products to sell for his business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 60 years old, married with five children and one of her children is in school. Norma works very hard to provide for them.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, etc.

Norma has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Norma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a widowed woman with five children. Rosalina is 41 years old and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rosalina has a buy-and-sell seafood business in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of shellfish, crabs, etc..

Rosalina has been in this business for 6 years.  In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of shellfish, crabs, etc.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 56 years old and a widow with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Corazon has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, noodles, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Corazon has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Corazon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, noodles, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Virgnia

texts.en:
Virgnia is 45 years old and married with three children. She earns a living running a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

Vignia is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 49 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by running a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Zosima is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Zosima has been in pig fattening for 25 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 54 years old and married. Virginia works very hard to provide for the family.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Virginia has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, juice, noodles, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 19-year-old single man from Deir Al-Balah city. He lives with his parents and brothers in a small house. His father is an employee in the public sector, where he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. Ahmad decided to start working to help his family and improve their living conditions. He sells pickles in the city using his rickshaw. It is a good business. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more pickles to resell. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to increase his sales and also his income. 

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more pickles to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for his farm.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Presentacion works hard to support her family. She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal vending. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs for her pig fattening business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Presentacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rizan

texts.en:
Rizan works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Rizan has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more abaca fiber and other materials for her business. She has been in this business for six years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Rizan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more abaca fiber and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Keneleyen Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de cinq(5) femmes battantes exerce dans divers domaines d'activité. Ce groupe est client de ACFIME depuis février 2011 et il a toujours fait des remboursements correctes. Sali, marié et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 sont scolarisés est l'emprunteur représentatif de ce groupe. Sali vend des sacs à mains et des portes-monnaie que son mari confectionne et cela fait 15 ans qu'elle fait ce commerce. Avec ce crédit, Sali pourrait acheter ses matières premières composer de cuire, de produit de teinture et autres accessoires pour que son mari confectionne des sacs et de portes-monnaie qu’elle va revendre. ce prêt serait vraiment important pour ce couple. Les bénéfices leur permettront de solder la scolarité de leurs enfants, de faire face à leur charges familiales et renforcer leur activité.
texts.en:
This group of five can-do women operates in various business domains. It has been a client of ACFIME since February 2011, and it has always made its payments correctly. Sali, a married mother of five children, including three in school, is the representative borrower of this group. For fifteen years, she has been in the business of selling handbags and wallets that her husband makes. 

With this loan, Sali would be able to purchase her raw materials: leather, dyes, and other supplies, so that her husband may make handbags and wallets, which she is going to sell. This loan would really be important for this couple. The profits will enable them to ensure their children’s schooling, cope with their family expenses, and bolster their business.

loans.use: to purchase leather and other materials for making handbags

loans.name: Teega Wende De Kokologho Group

texts.fr:
Mme TANGA CHRISTINE est la représentante du groupe TEEGA WENDE DE KOKOLOGHO. Mariée, elle est mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17 ans et le moins âgé à 05ans.  04 vont  à l’école. 
Madame vend des céréales depuis 04 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants.
Elle  veut s’acheter 05sacs d’haricots, 02sacs de mils et 01sac d’arachide.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer  son activité. Elle ambitionne aider  à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. TANGA CHRISTINE is the representative of the group TEEGA WENDE DE KOKOLOGHO. A married mother, she has five children. The oldest is 17 years old, and the youngest is 5. Four go to school. 

Ms. TANGA CHRISTINE has been selling grains for four years. She gets her supplies from nearby villages. She wants to purchase 5 sacks of beans, 2 sacks of millet, and a sack of peanuts. 

She wants to use her profits to bolster her business. Her ambition is to help cover her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase beans, millet, and peanuts

loans.name: Ewoetsa

texts.fr: Afin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille et agrandir son commerce de produits d'alimentation générale, Ewoetsa une ancienne cliente de WAGES fait un cinquième crédit pour atteindre ses objectifs. Elle se fait aidée par 01e personne avec une ancienneté de 04ans. Ewoetsa a pour conjoint un chauffeur avec 01 enfant en charge. Elle est âgée de 36ans.
texts.en: To meet the needs of her family and expand her grocery business, Ewoetsa, who is a long-time client of WAGES, is taking out her fifth loan to achieve her goals. She is helped by one person with four years of seniority. Ewoetsa’s husband is a driver. She has one child to support. She is 36 years old.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 57 years old, widowed, and has 5 children. Remedios works very hard to provide for them.

Remedios runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase more stock like candy, biscuits, canned goods, soft-drinks, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

Remedios has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items in her general store. 

Remedios would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like candy, biscuits, canned goods, soft-drinks, cooking oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling recyclable materials in the Philippines. Jocelyn has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy more recyclable materials to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 11 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more recyclable materials to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Judith works hard to support her family. She has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Judith is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy gasoline, spare parts, and tools for the maintenance of her vehicle for her transport business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts, and tools for the maintenance of her vehicle.

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.en:
Anatolia is 57 years old and widowed, with two children. Anatolia works very hard to provide for them.

Anatolia runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, such as soft drinks, beer, snack foods, and coffee.

Anatolia has been in this business for 31 years and she sells a variety of items, such as soft drinks, beer, snack foods, and coffee. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Anatolia would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, such as soft drinks, beer, snack foods, and coffee.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is 58 years old and married, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Bebiana has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, eggs, and bread.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Bebiana has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, eggs, and bread.

loans.name: Relwende De Kokologho Group

texts.fr:
Mme T.ODILE est la représentante du groupe RELWENDE DE KOKOLOGHO.  Mariée, elle est mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 22 ans et le moins âgé à 02 ans.  05 vont  à l’école. 
Madame vend des céréales  depuis 02 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
Elle  veut s’acheter 05 sacs de mil, 02 sacs d’haricots et 03 sacs d’arachides.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices afin d’aider pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne être une grande commerçante (une grossiste) de céréales.
texts.en:
Ms. T.ODILE is the representative of the group RELWENDE DE KOKOLOGHO. A married mother, she has six children. The oldest is 22 years old, and the youngest is 2. Five go to school. 

Ms. T.ODILE has been selling grains for two years. She gets her supplies from nearby markets. She wants to purchase 5 sacks of millet, 2 sacks of beans, and 3 sacks of peanuts. 

She wants to use her profits to help her children thrive. Her ambition is to be a major merchant (wholesaler) of grains.

loans.use: to purchase millet, beans, and peanuts

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers from her business. Lorna has been in this business for 12 years. She also earns more income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig-raising business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lolita has been in this business for 31 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lolita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers. Luzviminda has been in this business for four years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Luzviminda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marvie

texts.en:
Marvie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marvie has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Marvie has been in this business for four years now. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Marvie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a married man with six children. He is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Robert is 43 years old and has six children who are in school.

Robert has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. He has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in his fish stall.

He successfully paid back his previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build his business.

Robert has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, he would like to save enough money, so he could afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in his fish stall.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 61 years old and married, with nine children.

Clara works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Clara has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 26 years and also earns an income from banana-vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Clara aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Abdul Shakor

texts.en:
Abdul Shakor , 35, is a hardworking entrepreneur from Karachi. He is married and lives with his wife and parents in a rented house. Abdul Shakor started this business with a small investment 10 years ago and now his business has grown and he is in a better position. 

Abdul Shakor wants to restock some general and bakery items at his store. But, as most of his earnings are already invested in his business, he is short of money. Therefore, he requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner. He is thankful to Kiva lenders for their consideration.

loans.use: To restock general and bakery items at his store

loans.name: Miguelita

texts.en:
Miguelita works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines. Miguelita has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like coffee, soft drinks, snack foods, candies, biscuits, etc. She has been in this business for five years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Miguelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like coffee, soft drinks, snack foods, candies, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 16 years and also earns more income from selling root-crops.

Felipa is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Felipa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Herminita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Herminita works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Herminita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Herminita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Jarelyn

texts.en:
Jarelyn works hard to support her family. Jarelyn is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Jarelyn requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jarelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria works hard to support her family.  She has a raising pigs business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Macaria is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Macaria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy feed & vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Socoro

texts.en:
Socoro is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.    She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Socoro has been in this business for 30 years. Socoro earns more income from raising cattle.  She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Socoro has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda works hard to support her family. Luzviminda is married and has a egg vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 7 years now.

Luzviminda requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more trays of eggs to sell to her customers.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Luzviminda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy eggs to sell

loans.name: Yosia

texts.en: Yosia appreciates the loan you gave him. He was able to pay school fees for his children.  Yosia is a 51-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. For twenty-four years he has been selling sodas, and the proceeds have made it possible for him to invest in a fish business.  He dreams of educating his children to attain degrees as minimum qualifications, and of building a good residential house. Price fluctuations and inadequate food preservation equipment are his major challenges, while his dream is to own a depot. Yosia intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells dry goods in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 13 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Cirila requested a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more stocks of dry goods such as t-shirts and blouses, to sell. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry goods, such as t-shirts and blouses, to sell

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Crispina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Crispina is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Crispina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James used his previous loan to buy additional produce to sell. He sells fresh foods and is also a farmer. He faces challenges of seasonality of his business and perishability of the stock. 

James requested a loan, which he will use to buy fresh foods to sell. He hopes to expand his business to new areas in order to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase fresh food to sell

loans.name: Ester Luda

texts.en:
Ester Luda is managing her rice farm. She earns a meager income from this, which primarily supports their family. At present, Ester Luda is receiving a monthly pension from an insurance company; this has greatly helped her in pursuing her goals. 

She hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 48,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record.  

Ester Luda is very thankful when all her financing needs were supported by PMPC. Someday, she deeply wishes to live a happy and comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to provide a durable living nest for the family.

loans.name: Isacar

texts.es:
Isacar tiene 26 años, es soltero, conocido en el medio por su labor de crianza y venta de cerdos. Vive en casa familiar, con madre y hermanos de los cuales uno estudia y el otro trabaja, su madre cuenta con una pequeña bodega y venta de gasolina. Isacar es una persona con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su familia es muy unida. Vive en una comunidad habitada por gente que se dedica a la crianza de ganado y a la agricultura. Ubicada en el distrito de Pacanga, provincia de Chepén, región La Libertad, costa norte de Perú.

Isacar se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, desde hace más de 04 años. Adicionalmente trabaja como maestro albañil por zona de residencia y alrededores. Necesita préstamo para invertir en pequeño negocio de venta de productos de ferreteria, pues en su comunidad no existe competencia con el rubro, lo cual le permitirá captar a todos los clientes de la zona y alrededores así como un aumento en sus ingresos, mejoras en sus utilidades y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Isacar is 26 years old. He is single. He is known for raising and selling pigs. He lives in a family home with his mother and siblings. One is in school and the other works. His mother has a small store and sells gasoline. Isacar is a person with good personal and work references. His family is very united. He lives in a community inhabited by people who are dedicated to raising livestock and farming. It is located in the Pacanga district within the Chepén province in the Libertad region on the north coast of Perú.

Isacar has been dedicated to raising and selling pigs for more than four years. He also works as a master residential and surround areas builder. He needs a loan to invest in a small business selling hardware. In his community, there is no competition which will allow him to capture all the customers in the area and surrounding areas. This can increase in his earnings, improve his profits and thus improve his quality of life.

loans.use: invest in a business selling hardware products.

loans.name: Constancio

texts.en:
Constancio is married and from Oroquieta City, Philippines. He is 62 years old and has three children. 

Constancio is managing his fishing activities. He owns a fishing boat where he hired four fishermen to work for him. He personally sells the catch from his fishing boat in nearby municipalities. Since he became a member of Paglaum MPC, he has been a member in good standing for almost three years. 

Constancio hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing. He wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 50,000 to pay for construction materials for his house completion.  

In the future, he dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. He wishes to always provide the best for his family.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials for his house completion.

loans.name: Bernalda

texts.en:
Bernalda is a widow from Tangub City. She is responsible and dedicated to her work as a tailor, which is her only source of income. She has a business producing school uniforms and repairing clothes. 

Bernalda requested a loan, which she will use to buy additional textiles, buttons, and sewing supplies and pay for the repair of her sewing machine, in order to expand her business and increase production. This loan will enable her generate more income and be able to cater to her tailoring services.

loans.use: to purchase additional textiles, buttons, and sewing supplies and pay for the repair of her sewing machine

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a widowed woman with three children. She is 45 years old and one of her children is currently in school.   Thelma is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. 

Thelma requested a PHP 26000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods like slippers, blouses, shoes, etc. to sell.

Thelma has been in this business for 24 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy dry goods to sell

loans.name: Almamie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Almamie works hard to support her family.  She has a selling purchase order cards business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from native basket weaving. 

Almamie is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers.

Almamie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy purchase order cards to sell

loans.name: Aludia

texts.en:
Aludia is 35 years old and has three children. Aludia is married and her three children are in school.

Aludia is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Aludia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Aludia has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Aludia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a 30-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. In the group picture, Shazia is wearing a sky blue shawl.

Her husband owns a garment shop in which he has sold ready-made garments for the last seven years. Her husband purchases ready-made garments from the market at low prices and sells them for higher prices in her community. The ladies of town like his garment collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothes has increased because the winter weather has to come and people are demanding warm clothes. Her husband affords all the expenses from his earnings. His number of clients has increased a lot, due to which he needs to increase his current stock. But he he does not have a sufficient amount to buy more ready-made garments.

Therefore, her wife, Shazia, has requested a loan so that her husband can buy more variety of garments to fulfill the demand. Shazia wishes for the bright future of her children and her dream is to provide better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance in her husband's ready made garments sale business

loans.name: Venancia

texts.es:
Venancia es de la ciudad de Pilar, está casada, comenta que tiene dos hijas, que son su principal inspiración, ya que quiere darles una vida digna.
Su meta es mejorar su vida familiar, ayudar a la comunidad y al bienestar de sus hijas. Ser una buena profesional ya que es un logro muy importante para ella, pes será una abogada. Actualmente soy docente catedrática y podrá aumentar su conocimiento por medio de su carrera en derecho.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad.
texts.en:
Venancia is from the city of Pilar and she is married. She mentions that she has two daughters and that they are her biggest inspiration, since she wants to give them a good life. 

Her goal is to improve her family life, to help the community and the well-being of her daughters. Being successful is a very important achievement for her, so she will become a lawyer. She is currently a professor and she will be able to enhance her knowledge through her career in law. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to pay for her university fees.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired to support for her family. Recently, she availed a loan to buy bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of piglets for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to buy bags of feed for her growing hogs and pay for additional heads of piglets to generate more income

loans.name: Elvira Rose

texts.en:
Elvira Rose is 34 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Tangub City, Philippines. Elvira Rose is very hardworking and persevering mother when it comes to the welfare of her family. 

To generate more income,  Elvira Rose decided to start farming bananas She requested a loan from PMPC, which she will use to buy fertilizer and pay for labor in area clearing and banana planting. Elvira Rose hopes to have a comfortable life and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor in area clearing and banana planting

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es:
Rosana es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, está cursando el segundo año de la carrera de Criminalística, su meta es culminar sus estudios y poder ejercer su profesión.
Sus aspiraciones es ser una profesional destacada y así para poder ayudar a las personas que necesiten de sus servicios.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y seguir con sus estudios, que serán muy útiles a la sociedad el día de mañana.
texts.en:
Rosana is from the city of Paraguarí. She is in her second year studying criminology. Her goal is to finish her studies and practice her profession. 
Her wish is to be an outstanding professional who can help the people who need it. She is asking for this loan to pay her fees and continue with her studies which will be very useful to society in the future.

loans.use: pay educational fees.

loans.name: Paolo

texts.es:
Paolo está  estudiando la carrera de Derecho, es de San Pedo, y comenta que vive con sus padres, quienes lo apoyan en la carrera que escogió estudiar.
Su meta es llegar algún día a ser fiscal y poder ayudar a las personas y a su  familia. En el futuro se ve como una persona sobresaliente y exitosa.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir gastos de estudios que tiene, como cuotas y materiales.
texts.en:
Paolo is studying law and he is from San Pedro. He mentions that he lives with his parents, who support the career path he chose. 

His goal is to one day become a district attorney and to be able to help people as well as his family. In the future, he sees himself as an outstanding and successful person. 

He is requesting this loan to be able to cover his education costs, such as fees and materials.

loans.use: to pay for fees and materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: José Bruno

texts.en:
José Bruno lives on a small farm in Mexico and owns several animals, from cows to goats and chickens. He recently decided to purchase a 14 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa in order to become self-sufficient in his gas supply. He was especially attracted by the waste-management component of the biodigester, which allows him to transform his animals' feces into renewable energy while protecting the environment and improving hygiene on his farms (less flies, no more water contamination and piles of animal waste outside his house). 
The biodigester will also allow him to reduce the operational costs of his farm, since he will be able to displace the expensive liquefied petroleum gas (propane) and chemical fertilizers. Indeed, in addition to producing biogas, the biodigester also produces a potent organic fertilizer called biol that José Bruno will be able to use for his crops.
This loan represents 48% of the total cost of the Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, the rest being covered by a government subsidy for Mexican farmers.

loans.use: to purchase a 14 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Aloha

texts.en:
Aloha is a businesswoman from Oroquieta. She is 41 years old and has expertise in selling. She maintains her PMPC membership in good standing without records of default. 

Now, she applied for a loan to purchase basic commodities for her store to sustain the demand of the customers. Aloha continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to purchase basic commodities for her store to sustain the demand of the customers

loans.name: Cherlina

texts.en:
Cherlina is 56 years old and lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Philippines. She is married with two children.  

Cherlina has focused her farming activities and earns by selling her harvest with the support of her husband. She requested a loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizer and chemicals for her vegetable garden. 

Cherlina has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Cherlina hopes to have a good life and that her children will finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of fertilizer and chemicals for her vegetable garden to have good production

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria con mucho sacrificio está a punto de obtener su primer título en Administración de negocios, y anhela trabajar más para lograr obtener  mayores  ingreso para su familia. 
Es soltera y vive con su papa, trabaja como vendedora a la vez que estudia, es una persona muy sacrificada.
 Mi papa es  agricultor, un hombre también muy humilde.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad.
texts.en:
With many sacrifices, Gloria will soon earn her first degree in Business Administration. She longs to work more in order to make a higher income for her family. 
She is single and she lives with her father. She works as a salesclerk while studying. She is a very selfless person. 
Her father is a farmer. He is a very humble person as well. 
She is asking for a loan to pay her university fees.

loans.use: pay university fees.

loans.name: Benkady Group

texts.fr:
Benkady est un regroupement de femmes du Village M’pessoba du cercle de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 35anset ont au moins 4enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, d’arachides, Fruits et légumes, Condiment, Habillement et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe.
Mamou est un membre du groupe Benkady, assise au milieu, vendeuse d’arachides. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de sacs d’arachides en qualités au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkady comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Mamou compte réaliser  175 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Benkady is a group of women from the village of M’pessoba, in the Koutiala circle. They all live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives, and they know each other well. They average 35 years of age and four children each. 

These women are resellers of various merchandise such as groundnuts, fruits and vegetables, condiments, clothing, and more. To expand their activities, the joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, and this is their 2nd group loan cycle. 

One of the group members is a groundnut reseller named Mamou, seen in the group photo sitting in the center. She plans to use her loan to buy sacks of groundnuts as the need arises; she gets her stock at the market, and she sells retail to a diverse clientele. 

The other group members expect to earn an average profit of 160,000CFA each through this loan cycle. As for Mamou, she expects to earn 175 000FCFA.

In addition to repaying their loans, the group members will use part of their earnings to cover personal expenses and to bolster their working capital. They hope to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to avoid running out of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Clotilde to improve her business. She lives in Maliana and she is a businesswoman. Most of her daily income is from selling gasoline, so she is still happy to do her business. She started her business in 2012, with her own working capital of $300. 

She is taking this loan to add with her principal amount to buy more gasoline, because it has become her activity. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more gasoline in the future. And she will be able to have better management of her business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline.

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia is 53 years old and married with 12 children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Elpedia is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Elpedia has been in pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from candle making.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: José  Benigno

texts.es:
El señor José Benigno, es casado padre de un hijo y labora como supervisor de campo en una empresa camaronera desde hace cuatro años,  inicia su jornada de trabajo   a las siete de la mañana  y finaliza a las cuatro de la tarde, con once días de trabajo consecutivo y con tres días de descanso por mes.

El crédito que esta solicitando  a Ceprodel lo utilizara para la reparación de su motocicleta ya que es su medio de transporte para realizar su labores cotidiano, y así  llevar  el sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
José Benigno is a married father of one son. He has worked as a field supervisor at a shrimping business for four years. He starts his day at seven in the morning and finishes at four in the afternoon, with 11 consecutive days of work and three days of rest per month. 
The loan he is requesting from Ceprodel will be used for repairing his motorcycle. It is his means of transportation for doing his daily tasks, so he can provide for his family.

loans.use: repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a television

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a married woman with seven children. Teodora is 60 years old and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Teodora has a business buying and selling coconut wine in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

Teodora has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Teodora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 46 years old. She is married with two children and both of them are in school. Zosima works very hard to provide for them.

Zosima runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, coffee, etc.

Zosima has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future Zosima, would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina is 53 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Albina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Albina has been in pig fattening for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hermela

texts.en:
Hermela is 63 years old, widowed, and has five children.  

Hermela is in the agricultural business, buying and selling pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs to sell.

Hermela has been buying and selling pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Hermela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, biscuits, noodles and other goods to sell in her general store business.

Helen has been in this business for 15 years. Helen earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, biscuits and noodles to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Judith works hard to support her family.
