She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Judith is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more household goods like soap, milk, sugar and other goods for her general store business to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 20 years. Rosalinda earns additional income from direct selling Avon products.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell like soap, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Phearak

texts.en:
Phearak is a 25-year-old university student. He lives with his parents in Tbong Khmum Province of Cambodia. 

Due to a shortage of financial support, Phearak would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fees for four years. This loan will help him graduate and get a job to help his family. His goals are to work in a bank and build a big house.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Virgen De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es muy numeroso, las integrantes se fijaron como meta el crecimiento de cada una, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
La Presidenta, la Sra. Dominga se dedica a la venta de Comidas en su casa, ella todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas, ya que se levanta a preparar sus comidas para luego venderlas.
Pide su préstamo para la compra de Lechugas, zanahorias, tomates, carne, huevo, aceite, etc. Para poder elaborar sus comidas y seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
This group is very numerous, and the members have made their goal the growth of each person, not only economically, but also as people.  The President, Dominga, works selling meals from her home.  Every day she works from very early in the morning, since she gets up to prepare the meals and then sells them.

She is asking for a loan in order to purchase lettuce, carrots, tomatoes, meat, eggs, oil, etc.  This will allow her to make her meals and to continue working.

loans.use: to purchase lettuce, carrots, tomatoes, meat, eggs, oil, etc. for making meals to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ma. Luz works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of items like eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Ma. Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of items such as eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials like fabric, thread, zippers and related items for her tailoring business.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 20 years. Luzviminda earns additional income from raising pigs.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like fabric, thread, and zippers for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's graduation costs.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes works hard to support her family. Lourdes is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Lourdes requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lourdes has been in this business for 26 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lourdes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 48 years old and has six children. She is married and four of her children are currently in school.

Milagros is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Milagros has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed from NWTF five times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
A married parent of six children, Estrellita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from farming rice. Estrellita is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Estrellita has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 43 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nancy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nancy has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns income from native basket weaving.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Leona

texts.en:
A married parent of one child, Ma. Leona works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Leona is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to  purchase more ingredients like vegetables, meat, etc. for her food vending business.

Ma. Leona has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Ly

texts.en:
Ma. Ly is 39 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business direct selling Avon products in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Ma. Ly has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business direct selling Avon products for nine years, and also earns an income from raising livestock.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 53 years old with four children, one of whom in school. Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing. in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for seven years. 

In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang Province in Cambodia. Neang works as farmer, and she also digs for gold and buys and sells gold to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Koemeng's Group

texts.en:
Koemeng’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. 

Koemeng makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a construction worker to support her family. 

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phanit's Group

texts.en:
Phanit’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Phanit makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a farmer to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Pet

texts.en:
Pet, who is 41 years old, lives in a community of Battambang Province, Cambodia. He has only one dependent child who currently is a farmer. Pet is a rice farmer who can make the net income of USD 5.00 per day, on average. So far, he has been in this career for fourteen years. His wife, Bo, is also a rice farmer who can make the same income as he does.

Pet wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Chamrernretty

texts.en:
Chamrernretty, 19 years old, lives with his parents in the province of Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Chamrernretty just graduated from his high school. At this time, he wants to pursue his Bachelor's degree, and his desired major is in Engineering. However, the financial support that he gets from his family is not enough to pay for the school fees.

Therefore, this future engineer is applying for a Kiva loan now to pay for his tuition fees. He hopes that this loan will help to make his dream of being an engineer come true. He sincerely gives thanks for this Kiva loan that charges much lower interest than a normal loan does. He also thanks all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Savy’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Savy makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs to support her family. 

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Naim's Group

texts.en:
Naim’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Naim makes a living cultivating rice and he does extra work as an officer and teacher to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this man and each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia is 44 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, Nemesia works very hard to provide for her family.

Nemesia runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, coffee and sugar to sell.

Nemesia has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, sugar and other goods.

In the future, Nemesia would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, coffee and sugar to sell

loans.name: Eang's Group

texts.en:
Eang’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. 

Eang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Khceun's Group

texts.en:
Khceun’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal Province in Cambodia. Khceun makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a tailor and a construction worker to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a married woman with two children. She is 43 years old and one of her children is currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Analiza does business selling soft drinks and beers in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more cases of soft drinks and beers to sell.

Analiza has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more cases of soft drinks and beers to sell

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 61 years old and married with 10 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Angelina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Angelina has been in this business for 31 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 48 years old and resides in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of 5 children: 3 sons and 2 daughters. 

Her husband builds furniture in his own shop. He makes wood furniture such as sofas, tables, and beds. He has been making furniture for many years, and he is also teaching his craft to his sons. 

One of Nasreen's sons has become a fine carpenter. He is now easily able to run his own business, so he has opened a new shop. Their son is ready to buy all his own tools and raw materials for making furniture. 

Therefore, Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son can buy the raw materials needed for making furniture. 

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva lenders and Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to help her son purchase the raw materials and tools he needs to open his own furniture-making shop.

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es:
Rossana  proviene de una familia muy humilde y sacrificada que se dedica la venta de leche, luego ella comenta que se casó y es su marido quien la ayuda con los gastos de sus estudios.
Está estudiando la carrera de administración, donde su meta es ser una buena profesional  para de esa forma poder ser útil a su familia y comunidad y tener un digno trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para pagar sus cuotas y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Rossana comes from a humble and sacrificed family that sells milk.  She married and her husband helps her with school expenses.
She is studying business administration and her goal is to be a great professional and be useful to her family, community and have a dignified job.
She requests the loan to pay for tuition and continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Nargis Sohail Masih's Group

texts.en:
Nargis is 32, married, and blessed with 4 sons. She is the leader of her group. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. His rickshaw needs maintenance due to constant usage, which affects his income. For this reason, Nargis has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He wants to buy front mirror, new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance on his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Nargis  gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy front mirror, new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance of Rickshaw.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo con mucho sacrificio  está Trabajando y estudiando  espera llegar a un título,  anhela trabajar más  para lograr obtener  mayor  ingreso para ayudar a su familia. 
 Es soltero  y vive con sus padres trabaja como minero, con mucho sacrificio está llegando a su  objetivo y  por esa razón se está dedicando mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
With much sacrifice, Gerardo is working and studying to obtain a degree, he hopes to work more to have more income to help his family.
He is single and lives with his parents, he works as a miner, with much sacrifice he is meeting his objective and this is why he is dedicating himself to it.
He requests this loan to pay for university tuition to be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Culantrillo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Culantrillo, es de la ciudad de Concepción, una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona rural, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Justina es una de las integrantes, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada, tiene un almacén bien surtido, que con mucho trabajo pudo montar, y que hoy ya es el sostén de su familia y de su hogar. Surte a su barrio con todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, algún día sueña con poder tener un almacén más grande donde pueda tener mayor cantidad de productos. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, frutas, leches, panificados, carne y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su negocio, pero luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
The group called "Culantrillo" is from the city of Concepción, a zone that is a little distant from the central zone and is still growing. It is a rural zone, and so the members of this group want to strive to continue growing and give the zone where they live a better environment and have it continue growing slowly.

Señora Justina is one of the members. She is a very hard-working and sacrificing woman. She has a well-stocked general store, which she was able to set up with much effort and which today is already the sustenance of her family and her household. She supplies her neighborhood with all types of products of basic need. Some day she dreams of being able to have a bigger store where she can have a greater quantity of products. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy vegetables, fruits, milk, baked goods, meat, and other items; in this way she will be able to continue with her business but strive to improve.

loans.use: to buy vegetables. fruits, milk, baked goods, meat, and other items for her store.

loans.name: Renovacion Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Renovacion, ya que todas tienen la idea y el sueño de poder renovarse y renovar la localidad donde viven, ya que es una zona muy rural, y alejada de la capital del país.
Una mujer que se destaca es la Sra. Lourdes, también presidenta del grupo, quien siempre pone su mejor esfuerzo, y principalmente el ejemplo para poder ayudar a sus compañeras. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas muy variadas, y gracias a ese esfuerzo da a su familia una vida modesta, pero sin necesidades.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar más prendas para la venta, lo que le ayudará y con lo que podrá seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en: This group is called Renovación (Renewal). The name was chosen as a symbol of the collective will of the members to reinvent themselves and bring renewal to their village, which is located in a very rural area of the country, very far away from the capital. Lourdes is the president of the group and is known for always putting in the most effort. Her comrades see her as an example to follow. She sells various types of clothes. The income she derives from her business enables her to take care of her family so that, although they lead a modest life, they want for nothing. She asks for a loan in order to buy more clothes to sell, which will enable her to keep in business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lambertus

texts.en:
Lambertus is a 57-year-old man and is married to Maria, a 52-year-old lady. They are blessed four children: two of them are married and live with their own families while the rest are working and living on another island.

Lambertus owns a kiosk business selling household items such as sugar, coffee, detergent, cigarettes, bath soap, mosquito coils, snacks and soft drinks. Also, he produces cassava chips and sells them to other kiosks in the area. Lambertus initiated the business five years ago, using his own capital. The income from this business enables him to cover his family's living expenses. 

The product's price in the market is increasing, and demand for more stock from the customers led Lambertus to seek more money to buy various items. Unfortunately, he does not have enough capital for the business improvement. Lambertus then submitted a loan application amounting to IDR 10,000,000. He plans to spend the loan proceeds on stock for his kiosk and to increase production of his cassava chips.

loans.use: to buy stock for his kiosk and to increase production of his cassava chips.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
Cynthia es estudiante de la Carrera de Ciencias Veterinarias quiere poder ser una profesional que ayude a los animales, ya que desde siempre les ha gustado mucho.
Ella es una persona muy luchadora y por sobre todo emprendedora. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar sus útiles de la universidad y seguir luchando.
texts.en:
Cynthia is studying Veterinary Science to be a professional that helps animals, as this is something she has always liked a lot.
She is a hardworking and entreprenurial person.  She requests a loan to be able to pay for school items and continue working hard.

loans.use: to pay for university school items.

loans.name: Djekafo Ii Group

texts.fr:
Djekafo II est un regroupement de femmes du Village M’pessoba du cercle de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 28ans et ont au moins 2enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Fruits et légumes, Habillement,  la restauration et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour la 1ère fois.
Assetou qui est la seule assise est la restauratrice du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des kilos de patates, de haricots et farines de blé en qualités au fur et à mesure qu’elle prépare pour en faire des beignets, pâtés, patates en vue de les vendre en détail à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djekafo II comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Assetou compte réaliser  150 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Djekafo II is a group of women who live in the M'pessoba village in the Cercle of Koutiala. They know one another well, and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They have an average age of 28 years old, and have at least two children each.
 
This group of women sells diverse wares, such as fruits and vegetables, clothing, food, and various sundries. To increase the size of their businesses, the members have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program for the first time. 

Assetou, shown seated in the photo, is the restaurateur of the group. She intends to use her loan to buy several kilos of potatoes, beans, and wheat flour, which she prepares as donuts, pies, and cooked potatoes, and sells at retail to a diverse clientele. She sells her wares at the market.

While other members of the Djekafo II Group hope to earn an average monthly income of 145,000 francs CFA each during this cycle, Assetou hopes to earn 150,000 francs CFA.

In addition to the repayment of their loans, the members use part of their income to meet personal expenses and to improve their businesses. They would like to continue this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that they can keep their merchandise in stock.

loans.use: to buy several kilos of potatoes, beans and wheat flour for her restaurant.

loans.name: Mit

texts.en:
Mit, 45 years old, is a married woman who lives in the province of Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She has one dependent child and two married children.

She is an active farmer on a small rice farmland, which is located near her house. By growing rice and selling the crop to local dealers, she can make an income of USD 5.00 per day, on average. So far, she has been involved in this career for 24 years.

Mit wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon Group

texts.es:
Este grupo forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, las 16 integrantes están haciendo la encuesta de los 50 indicadores para poder conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar en esos puntos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirna, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es consciente que debe seguir trabajando, por lo que pide este préstamo para la compra de ropas de estación para vender y ademas con las capacitaciones  y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa irá mejorando cada vez mas.
texts.en: This group is part of the programme focused on eliminating poverty. The 16 members are completing the 50-question questionnaire designed to help them know their poverty level and take action to improve their situation. Mirna is a member of the group, she is on poverty level one according to the results of the questionnaire. She knows that she must keep working, which is why she asks for a loan to buy seasonal clothes to sell. She is sure to improve her situation with training, continuous work, and adopting the behaviour that leads to success.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Neris Antonia

texts.es:
Neris, una madre emprendedora desde hace ocho años, se siente agradecida con la vida, con Dios y con todas las personas que la apoyaron en el préstamo anterior para comprar materiales de segunda mano para su venta. Afortunadamente los clientes han aumentado como los sueños y metas de esta mujer luchadora.
 A sus 44 años de edad, quiere seguir trabajando fuerte, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar una paca de ropa y zapatos usados, para seguir mostrando variedad a sus clientes. Esto no solo le ayudará a generar más ingresos, sino que también es un paso más para cumplir la meta de expandirse y tener otro local que dirija su hija. Ella sabe que no le falta mucho por llegar a ser una persona autosuficiente, con una gran tienda, por lo que no dejará de seguir vendiendo e invirtiendo.
texts.en: Neris is a mother and has been an entrepreneur for eight years. She is grateful to Life, to God, and to everyone who helped her with the previous loan, with which she was able to buy used clothing to sell. Her hopes of having more customers came true and this encourages her to keep fighting for her goals. She is 44 and wants to continue working a lot, which is why she asks for a loan to buy a bundle of clothes and used shoes, so as to have a greater variety of items on offer. This will not only help her increase her income, but also advance towards her goal of expanding her business by having a second shop manned by her daughter. Neris knows that she is very close to being completely self-sufficient with a big shop of her very own, which is why she is determined to keep selling and investing her profits back into her business.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothes and used shoes.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
La palabra conformismo no está en el vocabulario de Alexander, ya que desde hace cuatro años, este comerciante de fritanga, no ha dejado de invertir en su negocio. Él se siente muy agradecido con los que lo han ido apoyando económicamente para que el negocio de este hombre de 33 años, siga creciendo, ya que gracias a préstamos anteriores pudo aumentar sus ventas debido a que compró pollo, harina, arroz, entre otros materiales para cocinar su exquisita fritanga.
Alex, como es mejor conocido, quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, pues como ya dijo, no es conformista y es bastante emprendedor. Ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para seguir comprando arroz, plátanos, frijoles, harina, carne de cerdo, pollo, entre otros materiales para su cocina, que le ayudarán a seguir aumentando sus ingresos económicos y cubrir con los gastos del hogar. Una de sus metas es acondicionar el local para brindarles mejores condiciones a sus clientes.
texts.en: The word 'unambitious' is not part of Alexander's vocabulary. He has been a fried food seller for 4 years and has always invested his profits back into his business. He is very grateful to everyone who supported him financially. He is 33 and his business keeps growing, since, thanks to previous loans, he was able to increase his sales. He used said loans to buy chicken, flour, rice, and other ingredients to cook his delicious food. Alex (as he is known to everyone) wants to keep investing in his business because he is full of enterprising spirit and has grand designs for the future. He asks for a new loan in order to keep buying ingredients (rice, plantains, broad beans, flour, pork, chicken, etc.) in order to keep making food and increase his income. His business is what supports the household. One of his goals is to make improvements to his shop so that customers feel more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La Sra. Norma tiene 34 años, es comerciante tiene dos puestos de lomitería donde vende lomitos, churrasco, hamburguesas, bebidas y demás. 
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que esta luchando para poder dar a sus seres queridos lo que ella no pudo tener. Agradece principalmente por la oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, condimentos, panificados, hortalizas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norma is 34 years old and she is a businesswoman.  She has two "lomito" stalls, where she sells lomitos (steak sandwiches), churrasco (barbecued steak), hamburgers, beverages, and similar items.

She is a hardworking woman who is fighting to be able to give her loved ones the things that she couldn’t have; and she is especially thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving, as it will help her very much. 

She is requesting this loan so that she can purchase meat, seasonings, baked goods, vegetables, and similar items.  In this way, she will be able to continue making sales and serving her customers.

loans.use: to purchase meat, seasonings, baked goods, vegetables, and similar items.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio un hombre con responsable, respetuoso, amigable que tiene un cultivo de plátanos en el sector de marinilla, la actividad la inicio por necesidad económica ante la falta de oportunidades para sobresalir y salir adelante, en esta zona escasea el empleo y es más las personas que diariamente salen a buscar el sustento para su familia y entre esas personas esta julio que a su 60 años de edad sigue en pie de lucha ya que solo tiene sus campos de plátano para vivir.
Es un hombre solitario que por familia solo tiene sus dos empleados que considera sus hijos los trata como a uno y entre los tres sacan este proyecto que aspiran a convertir en una gran empresa distribuidora de plátano. 
Julio solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos, como abonos, riegos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y gran cantidad de mallas para proteger los plátanos de su depredador natural el murciélago y ciertas aves.
Con la ayuda de este crédito podrá consolidad una red de protección a sus cultivos y esperar mayor cosecha, aunque la suma es considerable el costo de los insumos es muy elevado y el monto solicitado no cubre en totalidad el gasto que Hará el señor Julio pero sabe que todo es por el bien de sus cosecha, esos palos de plátano que le han dado todo lo que tiene.
texts.en:
Julio is a responsible, respectful, and congenial man who has a planting of bananas in the Marinilla sector. He began this activity out of economic necessity in the face of the lack of opportunities to excel and get ahead. Employment is scarce in this zone, and it is more common that people go out daily to look for sustenance for their family. Among these people is Julio, who at the age of 60 still struggles since he has only his banana plantings to make a living.

He is a solitary man who for family has only his two employees, whom he considers his sons. He treats them as such, and among the three of them, they are pursuing this project that they hope to convert into a great banana-distributing business.

Julio is applying for a loan to purchase supplies such as compost, irrigation, pesticides, fertilizers, and a large quantity of nets to protect the bananas from their natural predators, bats and certain birds.

With the help of this loan, he will be able to consolidate a protective net for his crops and hope to have a better harvest, although the amount is considerable. The cost of the supplies is very high, and the amount he has applied for does not cover all the expenses that he will have, but he knows that everything is for the good of his crops. These stalks of bananas have given him everything that he has.

loans.use: to buy compost, irrigation, pesticides, fertilizers, and a large quantity of nets to protect the bananas from their natural predators, bats and certain birds.

loans.name: Yenis Judith

texts.es:
Yudy es una estilista que busca a través del crédito una ayuda para mejorar sus condiciones, como se puede apreciar en la foto ese espacio y esos activos es todo lo que tiene y ya que le brindan la oportunidad de solicitar un préstamo con lo que comprara una silla para arreglar uñas, un lava cabezas, el tocador, una vitrina, y artículos de belleza para vender.
Yudy se siente muy agradecida con la oportunidad de progreso que le están brindando y es que gracias a esto podrá mejorar la atención al cliente y tener un salón de belleza que es su gran sueño, ahora sigue consolidarlo y empelar gente y sabe que encontrara a interactuar y a los prestamista Kiva un gran aliado y más que aliado un gran amigo para progresar y demostrar que una mujer de 28 años de edad, con dos hijos de 11 y 7 años de edad la cual vive en pobreza puede aspirar a grandes cosas y con trabajo y esfuerzo las puede lograr.
Por eso pide que le ayuden en su proyecto y demostrar con hechos lo que es tan fácil de decir con palabras.
texts.en: Yudy is a stylist who asks for a loan to improve her situation. The room and the equipment shown in the picture are all she has, and they serve as a guarantee to the loan. She will buy a nail polishing station, a shampoo station, a vanity table, and a display case, as well as beauty products to sell. Yudy is very grateful for this opportunity to grow as an entrepreneur. She will be able to provide a much better service and fulfil her dream of owning a beauty salon. The next goal is to turn it into a successful business and create jobs. She knows that Interactuar and Kiva lenders will lend a friendly hand to help her progress, thereby showing that a woman of 28 with two kids (aged 11 and 7) and living in poverty can accomplish great things if she shows courage and dedication. Thus she asks for help in her project, so that she can show by her actions that her words are not mere words.

loans.use: to buy furniture and implements for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a circular saw to make more furniture to offer to the public.

loans.name: Jose Genaro

texts.es:
Entre el olor de la carne, fresca y reposada, la sangre y los distintos olores que se desprenden todas las mañanas. La casa de José abre sus puertas para vender carne a los pobladores de la zona. José a sus 69  años cuenta con el soporte de su jubilación al igual que el apoyo de su familia, estar jubilado le  ha ayudado a estar de lleno en su negocio. El oficio al cual se dedicó por tantos años, ahora lo trasladó para su hogar el cual ha tenido una gran aceptación por sus clientes. 
José quiere seguir creciendo y prosperando su negocio por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de carne y así poder ofrecer a los clientes mayor variedad. José tiene como metas seguir creciendo y expandir su negocio, la compra de activos le ayudara a ofrecer variedad y surtir su negocio y de esa manera satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Deposita su confianza en la facilitación del crédito  ya que este le ayudara a incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Amongst the smell of fresh, aged, meat, blood, and other distinct aromas that are given off every morning, José’s house opens its doors to sell meat to the people in the area.  José, 69, has the support of his retirement pension as well as that of his family.  Being retired has helped him to devote himself fully to his business.  The trade that he has been engaged for so many years, has now moved to his home, and has been well-received by his customers.

José wishes his business to continue growing and prospering, and so he is requesting a loan to purchase meat and thus, offer his customers more variety.  His goals are to continue growing and expanding his business.  Purchasing inventory will help him offer variety and stock his business and, in this way, meet his customers’ needs. He places his trust in the facilitation of the loan as it will help him increase his profits.

loans.use: to purchase meat.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es estudiante de la carrera de derecho, de lunes a viernes debe viajar a otra ciudad, transportándose en dos vehiculos ya que la carrera que quiere estudiar no se enseña en su ciudad.
Con ayuda de sus familiares   y su  propio  ingreso esta cubriendo sus gastos de  la universidad, luchando por poder cumplir con sus metas.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda para poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en: Olga is a law student.  Monday through Friday she travels to another city, transporting herself in two vehicles because the degree she wishes to study is not taught in her city.  With her family’s help and her own income, she is paying her university expenses and striving to meet her goals.  She is requesting this loan to be able to pay expenses relating to her degree.  The loan will be a great help in enabling her to pay this expense.

loans.use: to pay expenses relating to her degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy towels, quilts athletic clothing, underwear, and mosquito netting.

loans.name: José

texts.es: Gran parte de la familia de José, se ha dedicado a la fabricación de calzado, como desde muy niño él ha estado entre cueros, cuerinas, pegantes, suelas puntillas etc, que lo han llevado a conocer muy bien este arte y las características de un calzado, hoy casado y padre de dos hijas de 3 y 6 años, está generando ingresos con esta actividad, la que inició hace 8 años, y con la que ha visitado negocio a negocio,  distribuyendo sus productos, mediante una promoción constante de sus sandalias y calzado de plataforma femenino. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propio almacén y un taller mas grande, pero su gran desafío es incrementar el número de clientes, aumentando su productividad. José está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y es un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará pegante, cuero. suelas y accesorios, con ellos diseñará nuevos modelos, apropiados para la temporada de fiestas de fin de año. Su inversión será exitosa, porque aumentará sus inventarios en una temporada muy comercial, donde el dinero rotación permanente se hace notar, pues los gastos familiares son mayores, pues cada miembro de familia quiere sentirse  muy elegantes con calzado fino y elaborado con las manos de José, quien les vende a crédito y de contado, ajustando la oferta al presupuesto de su clientela y para ello trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde sin cesar para generar ingresos y beneficiar a su familia.
texts.en:
A big part of Jose's family works and has worked in shoemaking. Since he was a little kid he's been around leather, glue, soles, insoles, etc. which has helped him learn this art very well, including the detailed characteristics of a shoe.  He is married, is the father of two daughters ages 3 and 6.  He is generating income from this activity that he started 8 years ago.  He has gone business to business, distributing his products while constantly promoting sandals and platform ladies' shoes.  His goal in the future is to have his own warehouse and a larger shop.  His challenge is to increase the number of customers and productivity.
Jose is requesting his first financing from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation through credikiva.  He wil buy glue, leather, soles and accessories.  With them he will design new models appropriate for parties at this time of year.  His investment will be succesful because he will increase his inventory in a very busy season for retail, where permanentturnaround for money is noticeable because family expenses increase, this happens because each family members wants to feel elegant with fine shoes made by Jose's hands.  He sells to his customers both credit and cash and adjusting prices to his customer's budget. He works from 8 am to 6 pm with no breaks to generate income and benefit his family.

loans.use: to buy glue, leather, soles and accesories for shoemaking.

loans.name: Saadabu

texts.ru: Саадабу 51 год, вдова. У Саадабу среднее образование, с 2003 года занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день она смогла развить свою деятельность и получает ежемесячную прибыль в размере 10,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве у Саадабу имеется: 5 коров, 10 овец и 9 коз.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства Саадабу  обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита Саадабу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота в своем хозяйстве, а также хочет накопить средства на покупку квартиры.
texts.en:
Saadabu is 51 and a widow. She has a high school education and has been working in animal husbandry since 2003. She has been able to develop her business and currently receives a monthly profit of about 10,000 KGS thanks to her five cows, 10 sheep and nine goats. 

With the intention of further developing her business, Saadabu has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 130,000 KGS to purchase calves and a dairy cow. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock and wants to save toward buying an apartment.

loans.use: to purchase additional calves and one dairy cow in order to increase her headcount of livestock

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнара, 39 лет, замужем, 4 детей. У Гулнары среднее образование. Она по характеру: спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. Супруг и дети помогают по бизнесу. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже 10 лет занимается торговлей продуктами питания. Благодаря упорному труду Гулнары у нее есть товар в обороте на сумму около 100,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего расширения своей деятельности, Гулнара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товара в обороте. Доходы от кредита Гулнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, что позволит улучшить условия проживания ее семьи.
texts.en: Gulnara is 39, married, and has four children. She has a high school education and is calm, level-headed, and hardworking. Her spouse and children help her with her business. She has been selling grocery products as the main source of income for her family for over ten years. Thanks to her hard work, Gulnara currently has 100,000 som (KGS) worth of goods in stock. In order to expand her business, Gulnara applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to increase her sales turnover. She plans to reinvest her profits in her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products and increase her sales turnover

loans.name: Gerson

texts.es:
Gerson es de la Ciudad de San Pedro, vive con sus padres, está estudiando la carrera de Derecho y Psicología, es un joven muy estudioso y luchador.
Su  objetivo es terminar sus  estudios y seguir estudiando otras carreras llevando a cabo más experiencia y ser más profesional, también ejercer su profesión en base a las experiencias que va a ir adquiriendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus matriculas, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Gerson is from the city of San Pedro, lives with his parents, and is studying for a degree in law and psychology. He is a very studious and determined young man. His objective is to finish his studies and to keep studying for other degrees, gaining more experience and being more professional, as well as to practice his profession based on the experiences that he is acquiring. He is asking for this loan to be able to invest in paying his tuition so he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Gulkaiyr

texts.ru: Гулкайыр успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей с финансированием. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гулкайыр имеется: 2 коровы и 2 бычка, также на зиму заготовлен корм для скота и подготовлены сараи. Благодаря непосильному труду и емкой работе Гулкайыр, ее  ежемесячная прибыль составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулкайыр обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 95,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого и вкусного домашнего молока. Доходы от кредита Гулкайыр планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве, а также построить дополнительные сараи для скота.
texts.en: Gulkaiyr successfully repaid her loan and used it for the intended purpose. She is very grateful to Kiva and everyone who helped with the financing. She currently has two cows and two bull calves, along with harvested winter feed and barns. Thanks to her overwhelming and significant hard work, Gulkaiyr earns 20,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue expanding her farm, she applied for a loan of 95,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy cows and increase the amount of delicious, organic milk she is able to sell. She plans to use the profits to invest in more livestock and build additional barns.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows and sell more organic milk

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Djiguisseme est un regroupement de femmes du Village M’pessoba du cercle de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 36anset ont au moins 4enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Fruits et légumes, Condiment, Habillement et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe.
Nematou est un membre du groupe Djiguisseme, debout en 2ème de la gauche vers la droite, elle est vendeuse de patates. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de sacs de patates qu’elle vend en détail à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djiguisseme comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 170000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Nematou compte réaliser  180 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Djiguisseme Group is made up of women from the village of M'pessoba in Koutiala Cercle [county] who know each other well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. On average, they are 36 years old and have at least four children.

This group of women sells various goods such as fruits and vegetables, spices, clothing, and more. To grow their businesses, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their fifth group loan.

Nematou is a member of Djiguisseme Group [and is] standing second from the left. She sells potatoes. Nematou plans to use her loan to purchase sacks of potatoes that she will retail to a diverse group of customers. She gets her supplies at the market.

While the other members of Djiguisseme Group expect to see an average profit of 170,000 CFA francs each over the course of a loan cycle, Mrs. Nematou expects to see 180,000 CFA francs.

In addition to repaying the loans, they use part of the revenue for personal expenses and to expand their business. They would like to see this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso strengthened, so that their stock [of goods] is not in short supply.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes.

loans.name: Lucely

texts.es:
Lucely es una mujer joven de 34 años de edad que quiere iniciar su negocio de confección a terceros, un negocio rentable el cual aprendió a realizar por su madre que le enseño todo sobre el oficio y a pesar de que tiene 34 años de edad tiene 5 hijos por los cuales debe  cuidar, proteger y darles bienestar y calidad de vida. 
Quiere iniciar su negocio ante la necesidad de una entrada de dinero extra que le ayuda a mantener a su número familia y por tal razón solicita una pequeña suma de dinero con la cual comprara una maquina recubridora y materiales para iniciar su negocio con el cual aspira a mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder mantenerlo en el tiempo y darle empleos a madres que como ella no pueden salir a trabajar ya que tienen que cuidar a sus hijos menores de edad.
texts.en:
Lucely is 34 years old and wants to start a sewing business. She learned about this profitable line of work from her mother, who taught her all about the trade. 

Even though she is 34, Lucely has five children to take care of, protect, and provide for. She wants to start her own business because she needs to supplement her income in order to provide for her family. That is why she is requesting a small loan, which she will use to purchase a coverstitch sewing machine and materials to get started. She expects her business will enable her to improve her living conditions and that she will be able to keep it running in the long term. She would also like to be able to create jobs for other mothers like herself who can't go out to find work because they have to take care of their young children.

loans.use: to buy a coverstitch sewing machine and supplies.

loans.name: Doris Amparo

texts.es:
Doris una mujer de 48 años de edad, casada que busca tener retoños para mimarlos y amarlos, se dedica a la venta de helado donde tiene buen éxito debido a la ternura que no solo inspira su aspecto si no su forma de ser, una persona que llega fácil a los clientes y que ahora busca en un crédito la oportunidad de mejorar su negocio y con la ayuda de este dinero construirá una barra y sillas para atender más clientes y que estos disfruten un helado cómodamente con sus familiares, amigos o parejas.  
La barra que quiere instalar para mejorar la atención del cliente le servirá mucho para acoger mayor número de personas y es que podrán ir en grupo y reunirse a disfrutar una nieve.
Está gran mujer se proyecta en 5 años abriendo otro punto de venta.
texts.en:
Doris is a married, 48 year old woman who wants to have children to spoil and love. She sells ice cream, and is very successful due to her tender appearance and nature. She connects easily with customers.

She requests a loan for an opportunity to improve her business. With this assistance, she will build a counter and chairs to serve more customers, so they can comfortably enjoy an ice cream with their family, friends, or significant others.

The counter she wants to install will greatly improve customer service. Because she will accommodate more people, customers can come or meet up with a group to enjoy an ice cream.

This great woman plans to open another location in 5 years.

loans.use: to buy a counter and chairs to accommodate more people in her ice cream shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a new line of salsas.

loans.name: Alba Lidia

texts.es:
Si de ayudar se trata, Alba es la indicada de mencionar. Esta mujer de 42 años, madre soltera de dos hijos de 9 y 12 años de edad, ha decidido entregar su vida a velar por el bien físico y mental de las personas. Además, tiene una tienda de venta de ropa usada, como un ingreso más para encargarse de sus hijos. Todos los domingos, ella aprovecha para poder culminar su licenciatura en Enfermería, pues quiere seguir ayudando a más personas por todo el país. 
Alba tiene experiencia de ser enfermera desde hace ocho años, ya que siempre ha tenido la vocación de servirle a la sociedad y contribuir a la sanidad comunitaria. No obstante, quiere seguir aprendiendo mejores cosas, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para pagar aranceles de la carrera, el título y la graduación. Esto le permitirá culminar su carrera y obtener su título en Enfermería. En un futuro quiere estudiar una maestría en salud pública.
texts.en: Alba is a remarkable person in helping people. This 42 year old woman, who is the single mother of two children, 9 and 12 years old, has decided to give her life to take care of the physical and mental well being of people. Also, she has a store of second hand clothing, which is another income to support her children. Every Sunday she uses the time to finish her Nursing degree, because she wants to keep on helping more people around the country. Alba has more than eight years of experience working as a nurse, because she has always had the vocation to serve society and contribute to community health. Nevertheless, she wants to keep on learning more. This is why she is requesting a loan to pay for the career's tuition fees, the degree and the graduation. This will allow her to finish her career and obtain her Nursing degree. In the future, she wants to study a Masters in Public Health.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees, the degree and the graduation.

loans.name: Gulasal

texts.ru: Гуласал 27 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей дошкольного возраста. У Гуласал среднее образование, свою трудовую деятельность она начала с торговли детской одеждой на местном рынке, также с 2010 года продает овощи и фрукты, которые варащивает на собственном земельном участке мерою 1,06 ГА, в частности картофель, арбузы и клевер. Дополнительно в хозяйстве Гуласал имеется 1 корова и 3 овцы. Ее совокупная ежемесячная прибыль составляет 35,000 сом (KGS). Гуласал обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 2 нетелей и корма для скота, в частности кукурузы, ячменя и жмыха. Доходы от кредита Гуласал планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Gulasal is 27 and married with two preschool-aged children. She has a high school education and works selling children's clothing at the local market. Since 2010, she has also been selling fruit and vegetables that she grows on her own 1.06 hectare plot of land, specifically potatoes, watermelon and clover. She also has one cow and three sheep, with a total monthly profit of 35,000 KGS.

Gulasal has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to increase her head count of livestock by buying two heifers and livestock feed, specifically corn, barley and oil cake. She plans to put profits from the loan toward further increasing her quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase two heifers and livestock feed, specifically corn, barley and oil cake

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a 30-year-old woman, living with her spouse and a child in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to provide better living facilities for her children, but it seems impossible, in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving a motorized rickshaw for several years. His income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the rickshaw’s body, but he does not have sufficient capital to fix the problem. 

Therefore, Saira has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to enable her husband to buy a body for the motorized rickshaw.

She thanks Kiva and the field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy a body for her husband's motorized rickshaw.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres es casado, tiene dos hijos: uno de dos años y otro de  un mes de vida, viven en casa de la tía de su esposa, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario, ahora trabaja en una empresa en la cual se dedica al fabricado de muebles. Su esposa arma una variedad de vestidos para bebe, esos ingresos cubren los gastos de la familia, pero la actividad de la mujer ha resultado ser un fracaso, por lo que ella ha cambiado a la atencion de una tienda de barrio, por eso Andres quiere un prestamo para comprar mercaderia para la tienda de barrio de su mujer, de esa manera la familia confía en mejorar su situación económica Andres espera que puedan ayudar a su esposa
texts.en:
Andres is married and has two children: a two-year-old and a month-old baby. They live in his wife's aunt's house, which is located in the city of El Alto.

He has a high school education and is currently working for a company manufacturing furniture. His wife used to assemble a variety of baby clothing, and between their incomes they managed to cover their family expenses. However, his wife's business has turned out to be a failure, which is why she switched to running a neighborhood store. 

Andres wants a loan to buy merchandise for his wife's neighborhood store. The family is confident that this will allow them to improve their financial situation. Andres hopes he can get help for his wife.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his wife's business.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El señor José es cliente nuevo de la fundación paraguaya, es dueño de una despensa bien surtida que funciona en su misma casa, en la ciudad de San Ignacio.
Es una persona muy sacrificada, que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas del día, y hasta muy tarde. 
Pide su préstamo para la compra de productos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, carnes, panificados y demás, de manera a seguir con sus ventas. El se compromete a seguir trabajando y luchando siempre.
texts.en:
Sr. José is a new client of Fundación Paraguaya. He is the owner of well-stocked food pantry that he operates out of his home in the city of San Ignacio.

He is a self-sacrificing individual. Every day he begins his work in the early morning hours and continues on until very late. He is requesting this loan in order to buy various products for his food pantry such as vegetables, meats, baked goods, and other items so that he can continue his sales. José promises to continue working and to keep striving.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, baked goods, and other products.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel es divorciada y a cargo de dos hijos Ella y su familia viven en La Paz, en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde pagan un alquiler Isabel es bibliotecaria de profesion y quiere un prestamo para invertir en los estudios de uno de sus hijos, ella quiere mandarlo a China y le falta dinero Isabel es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar, pero goza de buena salud y el hijo es una persona prometedora Isabel estará muy agradecida si le ayudan
texts.en:
Isabel is divorced and has two children in her charge. She and her family live in La Paz, in a house made out of bricks and cement, for which they are paying rent. 

Isabel is a librarian and wants a loan to invest in one of her children's education. She wants to send him to China and doesn't have enough money. She provides the only source of income for her household but she is in good health and her son is a promising young man. Isabel will be very grateful for any help she can get.

loans.use: to send her son to China.

loans.name: Thary's Group

texts.en: Thary’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Thary works as a farmer to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 20 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good and requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore, Yasmeen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Yasmeen's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Yasmeen also plans to save the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Yasmeen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Mahabat

texts.ru: Махабат 26 лет, замужем, 2 детей. У Махабат среднее образование, работает швеей, с 2010 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 2 теленка и 10 овец. Также она на ежедневной основе реализует молоко. Махабат известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день деятельность Махабат приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого и вкусного молока, которое пользуется большим спросом. Доходы от кредита Махабат планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en:
Mahabat is 26 and married with two children. She has a high school education and works as a seamstress; since 2010 she has also been working in farming as an additional source of income. She currently has two cows, two calves and 10 sheep and sells milk every day. She is known as a principled, honest, decent and hopeful person. Her business currently brings in a monthly profit of 25,000 KGS.

To further develop her business, Mahabat has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase two dairy cows to increase the amount of organic and flavourful milk she can sell, which is in high demand. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and intends to do home renovations.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows in order to increase the amount of organic milk she can sell

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila es divorciada, tiene un hijo y viven con sus padres en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su familia, afortunadamente, todos ellos viven decentemente Lucila se dedica a la venta de mantas de huanaco Lucila se ha tomado su actividad tan en serio que ha pedido un prestamo para construir un pequeño taller en la casa de sus padres Lucila es la unica fuente de ingresos para su hijo, pero ella goza de buena salud y solo necesita que la apoyen un poco para seguir adelante
texts.en:
Lucila is divorced, has one child, and lives with her parents in El Alto. They all live in a house made of bricks and cement that belongs to her parents. Fortunately they all lead decent lives. 

Lucila works selling guanaco (a type of llama) wool blankets. She takes her business very seriously, which is why she is requesting a loan in order to build a small workshop in her parents' house. 

Lucila is her son's only source of income, but she is in good health and only needs a little support in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to build a small shop in her parents' house.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. She is married and has a weaving of mats business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of old clothes for her mat weaving business.

Elvira has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more old clothes for her mat weaving business

loans.name: Doeur's Group

texts.en: Doeur’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Doeur works as a farmer to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Pao's Group

texts.en:
Pao’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Pao makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller, farmer, and tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, as well as save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con sus hermanos en La Paz. La familia esta ubicada en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde viven bien. Claudia es comerciante y artesana, ella elabora rulitos (alambres de metal que sirven para fabricar rulos para el cabello) y los vende en ferias, aprovechando que ya se acerca la temporada navideña, Claudia quiere un prestamo para comprar peluches anti estress que pueda añadir a su oferta de rulitos para tener ventas por mayor cantidad Claudia no recibe ayuda de sus hermanos ni de nadie más, pero goza de buena salud
texts.en:
Claudia is single and doesn't have any children. She lives with her siblings in La Paz. The family lives in a house made of bricks and cement, and are comfortable there. Claudia is a merchant and a craftswoman. She makes "rulitos" (metal wires used to make hair rollers) and sells them at the markets. In order to make the most of the Christmas season, Claudia wants a loan to buy stress-relief dolls, which in addition to the "rulitos" she sells, will allow her to make more sales. 

Claudia doesn't get any help from her siblings or anyone else, but she is in good health.

loans.use: to buy stress-relief dolls to add to her merchandise.

loans.name: Taing Eav

texts.en:
Taing Eav, 34 years old, is a married woman who lives in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has two married children. She is an active farmer on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. By growing rice and selling the crop to local dealers, she can make an income of USD 5.00 per day, on average. So far, she has been involved in this career for sixteen years. 

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL, which has a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia es divorciada y tiene 4 hijos, ella y su familia viven con su hermana en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que  le pertenece a su familia, afortunadamente la familia esta comoda, Silvia elabora mantas y polleras (la pollera es una falda que usan las indigenas de Bolivia, especialmente las del Altiplano) Silvia quiere un prestamo para la compra de una maquina recta que le permita costurar mayor cantidad de polleras Silvia es la unica fuente de ingresos para su familia, pero ella goza de buena salud y tiene ganas de triunfar, por eso espera su ayuda
texts.en: Silvia is divorced and has 4 children. She and her family live with her sister in El Alto in a brick and cement house, which belongs to her family. Luckily, the family is comfortable. Silvia makes shawls and "polleras" (the "pollera" is a skirt used by the native women of Bolivia, specially those of the highlands). Silvia wants a loan to buy a straight stitch sewing machine that allows her to sew a larger quantity of "polleras". Silvia is the only source of income for her family, but she enjoys good health and a great desire to prosper. Therefore, she hopes she can count with your help.

loans.use: to buy a straight stitch sewing machine that allows her to sew a larger quantity of skirts.

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernardita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell purchase order cards business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Bernardita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers.

In the future, Bernardita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is 27 years old with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a weaving of mats business in the Philippines. Vicky requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional old clothes for her business.

Vicky has been in this business for five years. In the future, Vicky would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional old clothes for her business

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 59 years old, married and has one child in school.  

Mercedita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mercedita has been farming rice for 10 years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and married with three children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Cheryl works hard to support her family.

She has a direct selling of personal collection products business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Cheryl is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more stock from the personal collection to sell to her customers. 

Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock from the personal collection to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jinefer

texts.en:
Jinefer works hard to support her family. She is married and has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional old clothes to make mats. In the future, Jinefer would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional old clothes to make mats.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 42 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for twelve years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Annabelle is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Las Valientes De Santiago Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS VALIENTES DE SANTIAGO II” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silvia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de camas, servicio de limpieza, venta de meriendas, venta de salchipapas, venta de celulares, venta de comida, venta de pescado, venta de carne de pollo.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silvia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de gorras y sombreros; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años al observar la necesidad de sus clientes. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de sombreros por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The Communal Bank “LAS VALIENTES DE SANTIAGO II” will start its seventh cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Regional Hub of Santiago II. It is formed by eight members and is directed by a board of directors, where Silvia is the president. The members have diverse businesses, such as sale of beds, cleaning services, sale of lunches, sale of salchipapas (sausages and potatoes), sale of cell phones, sale of food, sale of fish, sale of chicken meat. The loan they will get will benefit these businesswomen, where Silvia is a member. She says, that she has formed part of Pro Mujer for a year. She joined after being invited by a girlfriend, who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling caps and hats. She says that she started this business many years ago after seeing her customers' demand. She will get the loan to increase capital (to buy hats at wholesale price) which she will get from the saleswomen of the city of La Paz, and that she will later sell in her place of sale. This way of life allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, because she is married and has three children. When they ask her what she likes from Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the savings plan offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy hats at wholesale price.

loans.name: Pamela
