texts.es: Pamela es madre soltera de un hijo, ella vive en La Paz, en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Pamela gana dinero con la venta de ropa y quiere un credito para incrementar mercaderia, sobretodo ropa femenina A pesar de que la ropa usada esta perjudicando seriamente a comerciantes de articulos nuevos como Pamela, ella dice que es cuestión de encontrar un buen nicho de mercado, por eso quiere abarcar con fuerza al sector femenino. Pamela es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud, por lo que se aconseja otorgar el credito
texts.en: Pamela es a single mother, has one son and she lives in La Paz. She owns a house made of brick and concrete.  She makes money selling clothing and wants a loan to increase her merchandise, mainly women's clothing.  Even though the sale of used clothing is seriously affecting retailers of new products like Pamela, she indicates it is a matter of finding a market niche.  This is why she wants to strongly cover the women's sector.  Pamela is the only source of income for her home, she is in good health so she hopes to get the loan.

loans.use: to increase her clothing merchandise

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa and her husband have been earning a living through rice farming for 20 years now in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. They are also engaged in a variety of farming activities, including raising pigs, in order to survive. 

A persevering mother who will never get tired of supporting her family, Luisa joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative on May 2008 to generate more income, She is now requesting a loan to pay for land preparation on her rice farm and buy additional piglets. 

Someday, aside from concreting the pig pens, Luisa hopes to buy a parcel of rice land to expand her rice farming business and be able to save profits for future needs.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation on her rice farm and buy additional piglets for commercial sale

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 69 years old, a widow, and she lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City, Philippines. She sells "puso"(cooked rice sealed in a coconut leaf). She has had this business for 15 years. 

She requested a loan to purchase 3 sacks of rice and 1 big kettle. Norma has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to have additional equipment for her business in order to have greater production and more sales.

loans.use: To purchase 3 sacks of rice and 1 big kettle.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 43 years old and married to a farmer, and they have had two kids. As a farmer for 15 years, she always experienced hardships, especially in raising their children. Daisy landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC, of which she became a member in 2008. Farming is the main source of their income. Daisy came to PMPC just in time for the working capital she needed. 

Now, she has availed herself of a loan to purchase farm inputs and pay labor cost for land and seedbed preparation. This will help her farming activity be more productive.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and pay labor costs for land and seedbed preparation for more productive farming

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos dependientes, vive con su madre, en el caserío de Cabuyas, en dicho caserío la población se dedica a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de arroz el de mayor producción, así como al comercio en general. Cabuyas es un caserio mediano con aspiraciones a superarse y está ubciado en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Wilmer se dedica a la cría de animales de corral cuenta con ganado porcino, gallinas, patos, los cuales los cría en el campo terreno de su madre, quien va ser su aval, cuenta con más de 05 años en el negocio, además se desempeña como trabajador agrícola(peón) en cultivos de arroz, en su caserío, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales, el destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio para la compra de animales para cría, y posterior venderlos. Invirtiendo en su negocio y poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 31 years old, single, and has no dependent children. He lives with his mother in the village of Cabuyas. The people of this village engage in agriculture, primarily rice production, as well as general trade. Cabuyas is a medium-sized village that has aspirations of getting better. It is located in the District of Pucará in Jaén Province, which is in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Wilmer raises farm animals such as pigs, chickens, and ducks. The animals are kept on his mother’s land since she is also acting as his guarantor. Wilmer has been in this business for more than five years. He also works as a day laborer for rice farms in his village. He has several good personal and work-related references.

This loan will be invested in his business by purchasing animals to raise and sell later. By investing in his business and earning an acceptable profit, he will be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals that he can raise for eventual resale.

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en:
Crescencia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Crescencia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Crescencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en:
Mailyn is 40 years old and married with one child.

Mailyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mailyn has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Mailyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Ada

texts.en:
Maria Ada is 41 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs. Maria Ada would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Filomena is 52 years old, and one child is still in school.

Filomena has a business of direct selling Fuller Life and Tupperware products in the Philippines. Filomena requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products to sell to her customers.

Filomena has been in this business for 20 years. Filomena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Realyn

texts.en:
Realyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. 

She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, paints, nails, etc. for her furniture making business. Realyn dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, paints, nails, etc.

loans.name: Alvaro Javier

texts.es:
Álvaro es un hombre de 34 años de edad dedicado a la producción agrícola y como muchos aprendió de dicha labor gracias a las enseñanzas y arduos días de laborar con su padre. 
Adquirió el negocio familiar y desde entocnes se ha preocupado por levantarlo y hacerlo más rentable. 
Con el pasar de los años el cultivo se ha deteriorado y uno de los problemas que tiene Álvaro es que necesito reparar los canales de riegos y comprar abonos por lo que necesitara una significativa suma de dinero ya que estos en Colombia tienen un alto costo no solo en insumos si no en mano de obra. 
Solicita un crédito para poder arreglar sus canales de riegos y comprar abonos, lo necesita urgentemente ya que estos son parte primordial en una finca de cultivo.
texts.en:
Álvaro is 34 years old, and he is a farmer. Like so many others, he learned this work through the lessons his father taught him, and through long hard days spent working at his father’s side.

He acquired the family business, and since then, he has been focused on building it up and making it more profitable. The crop has deteriorated over the years, and one of Álvaro’s problems is that he needs to repair the irrigation canals and purchase fertilizer.  He needs a significant sum of money, as these things are costly in Colombia—not just the supplies, but also the labor.

He is requesting a loan in order to be able to fix his irrigation canals and purchase fertilizers, which is crucial for him, as these things are essential to a farm.

loans.use: to make crucial repairs to his irrigation canals and purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Kantutitas De Pomamaya Alta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTAS DE POMAMAYA ALTA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rebeca es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de leche, costura de deportivos, tienda de barrio, costura de deportivos.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rebeca es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su familia, hace varios años, ya que este era un negocio familiar y con el pasar del tiempo ella asumió el negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará el aumento del capital (compra una vaca) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo criará en su domicilio para la producción de leche. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank Kantutas de Pomamaya Alta is starting its first cycle with Pro Mujer. It belongs to the regional hub of Achacachi, and comprises eight members. Rebeca is the President of its governing board. The members of this communal bank run a variety of businesses, including a dairy farm, a neighborhood store, and a sewing shop.
 
The loan they are requesting will benefit small entrepreneurs like Rebeca. She says this is her first time joining Pro Mujer and that she did so through a promoter from the organization that paid her a home visit and invited her. She currently works selling milk and says she learned the business from her family several years ago because it was the family business and as time went by she ended up taking charge of it.
 
She will use this loan to increase capital by purchasing another cow from the local wholesale vendors. She will then raise it at home and produce milk. This work allows Rebeca to generate enough resources to support her family, since she is a single mother of three. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she enjoys the training sessions offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry, 52 years old, lives in Binuangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental with her husband and two children. She has found ways to attain income through snack & food vending. 

She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in March of 2006. She became a micro-finance member and has received loans several times already. 

Now, she is applying for 14,900PHP to buy assorted goods for stocking her store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods for stocking her sari-sari (variety) store business to meet the demands of the customers.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is married and she works hard to support her family. She earns a living through her ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Herminia has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like curtains, blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like curtains, blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Liwayway

texts.en:
Liwayway works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Liwayway requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase ingredients for her business, like meat, fish, vegetables, noodles, and spices.

Liwayway has been in this business for seven years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her business, like meat, fish, vegetables, noodles, and spices.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 44 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, etc.

Gloria has been in this business for eight years. 

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Izel

texts.en:
Izel is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Izel is 33 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like coconut milk, sugar, coffee, etc. for her business.

Izel has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Izel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like coconut milk, sugar, coffee, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture manufacturing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 23 years now.

She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional supplies and pay laborers' salaries for her furniture making business.

In the future, Ruth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies and pay laborers' salaries for her furniture making business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 24 years old and married with one child who is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Wilma is borrowing 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Wilma has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Sirley

texts.es:
María una bella mujer de 25 años de edad con buenas ideas y excelentes proyección de vida que tomo capacitaciones, asesorías y certificaciones para iniciar una labor que inicio desde que era joven cuando peinaba a sus amigas de colegio y familiares la cual es abrir un salón de belleza.

María se encuentra muy emocionada pues ve ese sueño más cerca y es que con la ayuda del crédito que le está facilitando la corporación Interactuar puede abrir su propio local comercial y comprar algunos elementos que le hacen falta como la silla y ciertos insumos.

La ayuda de este crédito será muy importante ya que con el abrirá formalmente su negocio en un espacio que adecuo para atender en lo que espera un gran volumen de personas. 

Su sueño de momento es ser muy competente y satisfacer completamente al cliente, con lo que lograría mantenerse en el tiempo y atraer clientes que le permitan generar empleo.
texts.en:
María is a beautiful 25-year-old woman with good ideas and an excellent life plan. She has gotten training, advising and certifications to start a business that she began when she was young, when she did hair for her high school friends and family members; she wants to open a beauty salon.

María is very excited because she sees her dream coming closer. With the help of the loan that Interactuar is facilitating for her she will be able to open her own commercial space and to buy a few items she needs like a chair and certain supplies. The help from this loan will be very important as she will be able to open her business formally in a space that is suitable to attend to what she hopes will be a large volume of people. 

Her dream is currently to be very competent and to satisfy her customers fully. In this way she will maintain herself over time and attract customers, which will allow her to create employment.

loans.use: to open her commercial space to start a beauty salon, and to buy a chair and certain beauty supplies

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 51 years old, married and has fourteen children.  

She is in the agricultural business of raising cows in the Philippines. Lucia requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase an additional cow to raise.

Lucia has been raising cows for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lucia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow to raise

loans.name: San Valentin Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Valentin está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa  se encuentras mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes y ejemplo de vida es la señora Margarita, ella mantiene a sus 4 hijos mediante una cantina que le genera ingresos, y de esa forma procura que no les falte nada y que tengan una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su cantina, como ser golosinas, yogurt, jugos, comestibles varios y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo y aportando en su negocio.
texts.en:
The group “San Valentin” is taking the poverty elimination survey. Through their efforts and continuous work, the members are applying the vital behaviors of successful women so that they can improve their poverty situations.

One member who is a living example is Sra. Margarita. She supports her four children by operating a snack bar in order to generate income. As a result, she lacks nothing and her family is able to have a decent life without deprivation.

Margarita is requesting a loan in order to buy various supplies for her snack bar such as snack foods, yogurt, juices, various food products, and other items. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received so that she can keep growing and supporting her business.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, yogurt, juices, various food products, and other items.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a repair shop business in the Philippines. Josephine has been in this business for 7 years now, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts and pay the salaries of the laborers in her repair shop.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts and pay the salaries of the laborers in her repair shop.

loans.name: Sheila Rose

texts.en:
Sheila Rose is 38 years old and married with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and has been in this business for six years.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional kitchenware and ingredients for her food business. In the future, Sheila Rose would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchenware and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 36 years old and has four children who are in school.

Leah has a direct selling business in the Philippines. She sells Personal Collections, Fullerlife and Tupperware products. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more products to sell, like body spray, body soap, kitchenware, etc.

She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Leah would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell, like body spray, body soap, kitchenware, etc.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Catalina is 54 years old, and one child is in school.

She has a manufacturing of furniture business in the Philippines. Catalina requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business, like wood, bamboo, paints, etc.

Catalina has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Catalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business like wood, bamboo, paints, etc.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta 7ª grado por lo económico ya no siguió pues creció con los abuelos. Esta casado y su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, son padres de 4 hijos;  pero 3 ya se casaron uno vive con ellos.

Roberto desde que tiene 10 años trabaja en la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de su abuelo ya que su padre murió cuando él tenia un año y 6 años mas tarde muere su mamá .

 Él  siembra maíz en una cooperativa, en su tiempo libre pastorea una iglesia. Su trabajo lo tiene como a un kilómetro y medio y para llegar lo hace caminando, labora desde 6:00 am hasta las 11:30 am y luego regresa a casa por la tarde y se traslada a la iglesia con su familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar 500 cerámicas y 27 bolsas de pegamento para mejorar el piso de su vivienda.


Desea llegar a tener un vehículo para sacar su producto, comprar un terreno para dejarle a sus hijos y cancelar el crédito para tener puertas abiertas en la institución.
texts.en:
Roberto, who is 51 years old, went to school through seventh grade due to economic reasons. He didn't continue, since he grew up with his grandparents. He is married and his wife does the household tasks. They are the parents of four children, but three are already married, and one lives with them.

Roberto has worked in agriculture since he was 10 years old, work that he learned from his grandfather, since his father died when he was a year old, and his mother died six years later.

He raises corn in a cooperative. In his free time he leads a church. His work is a kilometer and a half away, and to arrive there, he walks. He works from 6:00 am to 11:30 am, and then he goes back to his house for the afternoon and goes to the church with his family.

The loan that he is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy 500 ceramic tiles and 27 bags of glue to improve the floor of his home.

He hopes to have a vehicle to carry his products, to buy a plot of land to leave to his children, and to pay off the loan in order to have the institution's doors open to him.

loans.use: to buy 500 ceramic tiles and 27 bags of glue to improve the floor of his home.

loans.name: Eloy Dionicio

texts.es:
Eloy es un hombre que desde muy joven conoce el trabajo fuerte, siempre luchando para sacar adelante a su familia y sobre todo a sus hijos, por iniciativa propia pudo abrir su negocio de venta de comida junto a su esposa en su ciudad natal, Yungay. Diariamente se levanta muy temprano para poder ir al mercado, hacer las compras y se queda hasta tarde atendiendo a los clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesía. 
En estos momentos Eloy necesita capital para poder hacer las compras para su negocio, es por ello que piensa utilizar el crédito para poder comprar mercadería y así tener todo lo necesario para elaborar sus deliciosos platillos. Él estpa muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que con esto su negocio mejorará y así continuará luchando para vivir una vida tranquila junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Eloy is a man who has known about hard work from a very young age. He always strives to help his family, most of all his children, get ahead. Through their own efforts, Eloy and his wife were able to open a business of selling food in his hometown of Yungay. Every day, he gets up early so that he can head to the market and make his purchases. He remains there until the afternoon and attends to his customers with a great deal of friendliness and courtesy.

At the moment, Eloy needs capital so that he can make purchases for his business. For this reason, he plans to use the loan for buying merchandise so that he can have everything he needs to prepare his delicious dishes. He is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity. Eloy wants them to know that he will use the loan to improve his business and it will allow him to continue living a peaceful life along with his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his food business.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Ana; está en su ciclo número 1  del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que tiene las esperanzas puestas en las capacitaciones que irán recibiendo y que les será de mucha ayuda. 
Myrian es vendedora ambulante de ropas, comenta que su trabajo tiene mucha competencia pero que de todas formas se sigue esforzando para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan. Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas de verano, ya que se acerca la temporada alta de ventas, y quiere poder surtirse.
Myrian es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora.
texts.en:
The Santa Ana group is in its first loan cycle in the women's committee program. It is a new group that has put its hopes in the training that they will be receiving and that will be a great help to them.

Myrian is a street vendor of clothing. She comments that her work has a lot of competition, but in any case she continues exerting herself in order to be able to give her family what they need. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of articles of clothing for summer, since the season of high sales is approaching, and she wants to be able to stock up.

Myrian is a very hard-working and striving woman.

loans.use: to buy summer articles of clothing to sell

loans.name: Karla Mercedes

texts.es:
La Joven Karla Mercedes, es casada  madre de un hijo menor de edad, labora para una empresa en la ciudad de León desempeñando el cargo de atención a clientes, desde hace tres años en turnos variados de lunes a domingo, ella realiza este trabajo para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.  

La Joven,  solicita este crédito a Ceprodel para la  compra de un juego de sala, el que le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Karla Mercedes is a young woman who is married and the mother of a young child. She has been working at a company in León for the past three years. Karla is in customer service and she works various shifts Monday through Sunday. This job allows her to help her husband with the household expenses.

Karla is requesting this loan from CEPRODEL in order to buy a living room set, which will improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy a living room set for her home.

loans.name: Arbel

texts.en:
Arbel is 39 years old, married and has three children who are in school. 

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Arbel requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Arbel has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Arbel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Lucia has been in this business for 15 years. Lucia earns more income from a general store.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es: Genaro es soltero, vive con sus padres en La Paz en una casa de acabado fino que le pertenece a sus padres que cuenta con todos los servicios, incluso gas domiciliario. Genaro es comunicador social y trabaja hasta tarde Genaro vuelve a recurrir a Kiva para solicitar un credito que le permita pagar todas las formalidades que le permitan obtener su titulo en Comunicación Social, de esa manera con el título Genaro podrá optar por mejores oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Genaro is single and lives with his parents in La Paz. His parents own a house made of solid materials and it receives all utility services, including gas. Genaro is an announcer and works through the afternoon.

He has returned to Kiva to request a loan so that he can pay for all of the formalities associated with obtaining his degree in Social Communication. By completing his degree, Genaro will be able to pursue better work opportunities.

loans.use: to pay the expenses related to his degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an appliance to furnish her home

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina is 53 years old, married and has two children. She is a vegetable vendor and earns minimum income, so she hopes to sell more vegetables in their village. Carolina is now asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy vegetables such as cabbage, tomatoes, eggplant and beans to sell. This would help her to increase her sales and someday get more profits to use for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as cabbage, tomatoes, eggplant and beans to sell

loans.name: Karen Avilia

texts.es:
Karen de 33 años de edad, es licenciada en computación. Es madre soltera de una hija de 5 años de edad. Ella vive con sus padres y su hija.  


Karen es empleada en una alcaldia lleva 4 años laborando y camina 15 minutos de su casa a su trabajo de 8:00 am, hora de salida no tiene porque trabaja en comunidades a veces sale temprano y aveces tarde.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para cancelar unas deudas con personas particulares.

Su gran sueño definitivamente es ver crecer a su hija y ver que se gradué academicamente o llegar mas lejos que ella.
texts.en:
Karen is 33 years old and has a licentiate in computer science. She is a sinlge mother of a 5 year old girl.  She lives with her parents and daughter.

Karen works at the municipality, has worked there for 4 years and commutes there walking for 15 minutes from her house.  She starts at 8 am but doesn't have a going home schedule because she works in communities and sometimes she can go home early and sometimes late.

The loan requested is to pay off debt to individual persons.

Her dream is to see her daughter grow and that she graduates from all her academic studies or achieves even more than Karen.

loans.use: to pay off debt to individual persons.

loans.name: Lynjem

texts.en:
Lynjem is 29 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Lynjem runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of soft-drinks, sanitary pads, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioners, etc. to sell.

Lynjem has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of soft-drinks, sanitary pads, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioners, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nancy Beatríz

texts.es:
Nancy de 22 años de edad, estudio 9ª grado la situación económica no le permitió seguir y que luego se acompaño,  su pareja trabaja como jornalero en el campo, tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad.   
 
Nancy desde hace un año vende fresco con panes, tamales y pasteles;  lo aprendió de su suegra y que fue la necesidad de ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, antes solo cuidaba a su hijo y los oficios de su casa.  Ella vende los alimentos de casa en casa en para salir a vender primero alimenta a su hijo y lo lleva donde su suegra mientras ella sale a vender al regreso pasa sacando al niño, sale a vender a las 9:00 am hasta las 12:00 p.m los frescos pero cuando hace tamales los vende por las tardes, su día comienza a las 4:30 am pues su compañero sale a trabajar a las 5:30 am.
 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar  una plancha industrial para inicira con la venta de pupusas.

Su sueño es llegar a tener su propia casa y que su hijo se prepare, con la ganancia pagara el crédito.
texts.en:
Nancy is 22 years old.  She has a ninth grade education as her financial situation did not allow her to continue studying, and then she entered into a common-law relationship.  Her partner works as a day laborer in the field, and she has a two year old son.

For a year, Nancy has been selling fresh bread, tamales, and pastries.  She learned how to make them form her mother-in-law because she needed to help her partner with the household expenses.  Previously, she only took care of her son, and did the household chores.  She sells the food door-to-door, but first she feeds her son and takes him to her mother-in-law while she sells her products, and later returns to pick him up.  She goes out selling the fresh products from 9:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m., but when she makes tamales, she sells them in the afternoon.  Her day begins at 4:30 a.m. as her partner goes to work at 5:30 a.m.

She will use the loan she is requesting from Credicampo to purchase an industrial iron and start selling “pupusas” [a traditional Salvadoran dish made of a thick, handmade corn tortilla and filled with cheese, pork meat, and refried beans].  Her dream is to have her own home and that her son is prepared.  She will pay the loan with the profits.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial iron and start selling "pupusas".

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Emprendedoras se destaca porque cada una de las integrantes es muy activa y se ayudan por medio del trabajo unido, están además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una mujer que se destaca es la Sra. Luisa.
Ella esta en el nivel dos, es decir que debe esforzarse un poco mas, lo cual podrá lograr por medio de las capacitaciones que irá recibiendo. Ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes variados y cuenta que tiene buena venta y que quiere seguir haciéndolo para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de perfumes varios, para que pueda seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
The group “Las Emprendedoras” (The Entrepreneurs) is well-known because each member is very active and they help one another by working together. They are also participating in the poverty elimination program.

One woman who stands out is Sra. Luisa, who is at a Stage 2 poverty level. In other words, she should put in a bit more effort and will be able to accomplish her goals through the training she has received. Luisa sells various perfumes and generates good sales. She wants to continue what she is doing so that she can improve her living conditions.

Luisa is requesting a loan in order to buy various perfumes so that she can continue her sales and strive to get better.

loans.use: to buy various perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Bella

texts.en:
Ma. Bella works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Ma. Bella requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her sewing business.  She has been in this business for 30 years now.

Ma. Bella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas Group

texts.es:
Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas
Fray Casiano Puntarenas

	Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas presenta la solicitud de crédito de 3 integrantes,  ellas  trabajan en una comunidad de Puntarenas (Fray Casiano) con altos niveles de pobreza. El  grupo de mujeres en la zona mantiene un  ahorro y participan en las actividades grupales para la generación de ingresos.  Tienen 8 años de trabajar en sus actividades, han solicitado préstamos y conocen la modalidad de trabajo grupal.  Se forma la Junta Directiva y se levanta el acta No.4 de solicitud de crédito del Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas, en esta oportunidad la  presidenta es Katia.

	Su trabajo y esfuerzo,  les ha permitido tener su  actividad consolidada como es el  comercio en general (venta de ropa, zapatos, perfumes y otros).  El préstamo va a contribuir a mejorar las condiciones de trabajo de su grupo,  les va a permitir invertir para la temporada de navidad y principio de  año, incrementando su inventario y cubriendo pedidos para esta  época de vacaciones de verano que se extiende hasta el mes de Abril, en la región costera del pacífico de Costa Rica.

	 Realizan la recuperación de la cuota en forma semanal lo que les permite tener un margen más amplio del pago a realizar, la cual se comprometen a cancelar en un plazo de 12 meses. 

Algunas de ellas son mujeres jefas de hogar, tal es el caso de Evelyn , ella maneja una panadería, este es su tercer préstamo, le ha permitido dar a conocer su producto en la comunidad ganando clientes para su producto de repostería, sus ganancias han aumentado considerablemente, es apoyada por su esposo y mantiene una cartera de clientes grande, tiene 32 años y es una mujer trabajadora y de respeto en la comunidad. Además de atender sus actividades económicas por las tardes, también ve  a sus hijos y  cumplen con  las reuniones grupales. 

	El objetivo es mejorar las condiciones de sus empresas, obteniendo un financiamiento acorde con sus necesidades y apoyar el desarrollo de la zona  y por su puesto  mejorar la calidad de vida  de las familias. El nombre del grupo las motiva a ser mejores cada día, Mujeres Esforzadas.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas (Hardworking Women's Group)
Fray Casiano Puntarenas

Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas presents the loan request of three members, who work in a community in Puntarenas (Fray Casiano) with high poverty levels. The group of women in the zone keep savings and participate in group activities to generate income. They have done the same work for eight years, they have requested loans, and they know how to work in a group. They have formed a Board of Directors and created the 4th loan request from Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas. Katia is currently the president.

Their work and effort have allowed them to consolidate their activities, such as trading in general (selling clothing, shoes, perfumes, etc). The loan will go towards improving the group's working conditions. It will allow them to invest for Christmas season and New Year's, increasing their inventory and covering orders for the vacation season that extends to April, in the Pacific Coast region of Costa Rica.

They collect the payments weekly, which allows them to have a larger margin payment period, and they commit to paying off the loan within 12 months. 

Some of the women are heads of household; such is the case of Evelyn, who works in a bake shop. This will be her third loan. She has been able to promote her baking products in the community, making new clients and her profits have increased considerably. She is supported by her husband and keeps a long list of clients. She is 32 years old, a hardworking woman, and respected in the community. Apart from working in the afternoons, she also sees her children and attends the group meetings.

The objective is to improve the conditions of their businesses. Getting a loan that matches their needs, contributes to the development of the area, and, of course, improves the quality of life of their families. The name of their group motivates them to be better every day, Mujeres Esforzadas (Hardworking Women).

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baking and pastries as well as merchandise such as clothing, shoes and other.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is married, and she has one child. She is requesting a loan of $800.00 to improve her business. She will use the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as slippers, salt, milk, eggs, sardines, coffee, cooking oils, soft drinks and other things to sell.  Fatima opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of $500.00. She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin, because she will have more working capital to buy more goods.  With the loan she can improve her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy slippers, salt, milk, eggs, sardines, coffee, cooking oils, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Alma requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Alma has been in this business for 22 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: José David

texts.es:
José de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está felizmente casado con una buena señora, la cual se dedica a los cuidos del hogar. Vive junto con su esposa y 2 hijas, las cuales la mayor está por finalizar el bachillerato y la otra por finalizar noveno grado.

José se dedica al negocio de frutas y verduras. Desde temprano se levanta para ir a comprar al mercado y así salirlas a vender en un carro que tiene en los lugares cercanos a su comunidad. De 1983 a 1988 formo parte del ejército nacional de El Salvador, posteriormente cuando terminó el conflicto armado estuvo 3 años como empleado en una pastelería, luego tuvo otros empleos más,  trabajó en un camión jalando tierra, fue chofer y por último trabajó por 10 años como motorista de una panadería ubicada en su comunidad, ahí alcanzó una gran confianza con su patrón, tanto así que le prestó el dinero para comprarse el carro que actualmente posee y también para construir su casa. Con la adquisición del carro José decidió dedicarse al comercio y fue desde el 2007 que el inició con el negocio de venta de frutas y verduras.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para realizarle unos ajustes al carro, pues la dirección le está fallando y también necesita realizar los pagos hospitalarios de su esposa y necesita realizarle la operación con urgencia.

José sueña con tener otro carro porque este ya está muy viejo y bastante trabajado, también aspira a mejorar su vivienda de forma que le pueda dar a su esposa y sus hijas una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 53 years old and completed high school. He is happily married to a wife who takes care of their home. He lives with his wife and 2 daughters, the oldest is finishing high school and the younger is finishing ninth grade.

José sells fruits and vegetables. He gets up early to go to the market and then sells them in a car that he has in locations nearby in his community. From 1983-1988 he served in the El Salvador national army. After the armed conflict ended, he worked for 3 years in a bakery. Then he had other jobs hauling earth, driving, and for the last 10 years delivering for a bakery located in his community. It was there he earned the trust of his boss, who lent him money to buy the car he now has and also to build his home. With the acquisition of the car José decided to dedicate himself as a businessman and in 2007 he began his business selling fruit and vegetables.

The loan he seeks with CREDICAMPO is to make some repairs to the car, as the steering is failing. He also needs to pay his wife's hospital bills and urgently needs an operation.

José dreams of having another car because now his car is old and well-used. He also hopes to improve his home so he can give his wife and daughters a good quality of life.

loans.use: to repair the steering and also make necessary hospital payments for his wife and have an urgent operation.

loans.name: Samaun's Group

texts.en:
Samaun’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. 

Samaun makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs. She also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. 

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sak's Group

texts.en:
Sak’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. 

Sak makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a construction worker and teacher to support her family. 

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yuranis

texts.es: Yuranis es comeciante de ropa, calzado y todos los articulos que su clientela solicita porque los desea o los necesita. Hace dos años cuando inició su negocio lo hizo atendiendo a su aptidu hacia el negocio, aprendida desde muy pequeña pues sus padres ejercen esta actividad. Su colegio fue el primer escenario de su tarea comercial cuando a sus compñeras les vendia articulos economicos que pudiean comprar con el direno dirigido a la merienda. Hoy su meta de crecimento aun es mayor y necesita incrmentar sus ventas pero requiere unos mayores inventarios que impacten la necesidad de compra de su clientela. Esta es la razón por la acula cude aun credikiva, primer financiemitno que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, calzado y accesorios, acordes a la temporada que se acerca de fin de año, donde las navidades y el año nuevo, generan la alegria de vestir elegantes para compartir en familia. El éxito de esta inversión radica en que impacta el negocio de Yuranis, pues con mas inventarios, hay mayor potencial de compra y mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Yuranis sells clothing, footwear, and all the accessories her customers request because they want or need them.  She started her business two years ago, taking advantage of her aptitude for business, which she learned as a young girl because her parents are in that line of work.  School was the first setting for her commercial labor, when she would sell her classmates economical items they could buy with the money they had for the "merienda" [afternoon snack].

Now her goal for growth is even bigger.  She needs to increase her sales, but she needs more inventory that will have an effect on her customers' purchasing needs.

This is why Yuranis is going for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She's going to buy clothing, footwear, and accessories, in accordance with the end-of-year season in which Christmas and New Year create the happiness of getting dressed up and spending time with the family.

The success of this loan lies in its impact on Yuranis's business, because with more inventory there's greater purchasing potential and bigger profits.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, and accessories

loans.name: Radet's Group

texts.en:
Radet’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. 

Radet makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a construction worker to support his family. 

In his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help this man and each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Peurn's Group

texts.en:
Peurn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. 

Peurn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor and farmer to support her family. 

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this man and each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Djiguiya est un regroupement de femmes du Village M’pessoba du cercle de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 45anset ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que,arachide, Fruits et légumes, Habillement, Restauration et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur seizième prêt de groupe.
Korotoumou est un membre du groupe Djiguiya, assise qui est vendeuse d’arachide. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de l’arachide qu’elle vend en détail à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djiguiya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 175000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Korotoumou compte réaliser  180 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Djiguiya is a group of women from the village of M’pessoba, in Cercle de Koutiala. They know one another well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They average 45 years of age and have at least five children. This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, such as peanuts, fruit & vegetables, and clothing, and they work in food service. 

To expand their businesses, the group members had decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their 16th group loan. 

Korotoumou, a member of the group Djiguiya, is the one sitting in the photo. A vendor of peanuts, she intends to use her loan to purchase some peanuts, which she sells retail to a diverse customer base. She procures her supplies at the market. 

While the other members of the group Djiguiya plan on making an average profit of 175,000 francs CFA each over the course of this cycle, Ms. Korotoumou plans on making 180,000 francs. 

In addition to paying back the loans, the group members use part of the revenues to cope with personal expenses and to increase their business capital. They would like to see bolstered this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, so that their inventory levels do not drop too low.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build his bathroom.

loans.name: Consolada Jacqueline

texts.en:
Consolada Jacqueline is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and jewelry businesses. Consolada Jacqueline is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Consolada Jacqueline has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Florentín

texts.es:
Florentín de 38 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora y muy respetado en la comunidad, estudió hasta primeros años de secundaria, es soltero y vive solo en su casa.

Desde pequeño Florentín aprendió a trabajar fuertemente, se ha dedicado por largos años a la agricultura, con la siembra principalmente de maíz y maicillo. Sin embargo, Florentín es albañil y trabaja por contratos que logra conseguir por medio de referencias de clientes anteriores, su medio de transporte es una motocicleta motor 150 que adquirió en el año 2005.

El préstamo que está solicitando,  es para comprar un asiento a la motocicleta,  puesto que el que tiene esta ya muy deteriorado y también quiere pintarla porque ya está muy pálida y necesita que los datos de la tarjeta de circulación coincidan con las características de la motocicleta.

Florentín sueña con ampliar su cultivo y seguir trabajando con la albañilería, para posteriormente formar un hogar y gozar de una excelente calidad de vida
texts.en:
Florentín is 38, a hardworking person, highly respected in his community.  He studied up to junior high-school. He is single and lives alone at home.

From a young age Florentin learned to work hard. He has dedicated many years to work in agriculture, mainly growing corn. However, Florentin is a construction worker and works by contracts that he is able to get through personal references from previous customers.  His transportation method is a motorcycle engine 150 that he bought in 2005.

The loan requested is to buy a motorcycle seat, the one it has is quite used and he also wants to paint it because it's a faded color and he needs the information in the transit card matches the motorcycle's characteristics.

Florentin dreams to expand his crops and continue working in construction, in the future he wants to form a family and have an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a seat for and to paint, a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sochan

texts.en: Sochan is a 32-year-old divorced man living with an old mother and a sister in the Takeo Province of Cambodia. At home, he repairs televisions and radios from Monday to Friday, earning approximately $10 daily. From Saturday to Sunday, he instructs TV and radio repairing away from home. This is why Sochan decided to request a loan to buy a motorcycle, for his commute to instruct. This loan will help him to reduce his traveling expenses. In the future, he wants to have a shop selling TVs and radios and have his own house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Martha Mariela

texts.es:
La Joven Martha Mariela, trabaja en un centro Educativo  de la Ciudad de León desempeñándose como Directora del centro  desde hace ocho años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 10 años de edad. 

Martha Mariela  sale se sus casa a las 6:30 am inicia su jornada de labores  a las  7:00 am finalizando a las 5:00 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes.

Martha Mariela solicita este crédito para utilizarlo en compra de bloque, cemento, hierro, arena, piedrin, para la construcción de cuarto  en casa de sus padres y así darle mejor condiciones de vida a su único Hijo.
texts.en:
Martha Mariela is a youthful woman who works at an educational center in the city of León. For the past eight years, she has been the director of the center. Martha Mariela is a single mother of a 10-year-old child.

She leaves her home at 6:30 A.M. so that she can begin her work at 7:00 A.M. Her job ends at 5:00 P.M. and she follows this same schedule Monday through Friday.

Martha Mariela is requesting this loan so that she can buy blocks, cement, iron, sand, and gravel in order to build a room at her parents’ house. This will provide better living conditions for her only child.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, iron, sand, and gravel in order to build a room.

loans.name: Amor De Hermanas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Amor de Hermanas, está conformado por cinco mujeres emprendedoras, con deseo de superación, lo coordina la señora María Petrona, quien tiene la edad de 68 años, casada y madre se seis hijos, quienes fueron motivos de su superación, se dedica al destace de cerdo y venta de nacatamales, desde hace diez años, es primer ciclo que solicita el crédito para la compra de dos cerdos en pie, con el objetivo de incrementar su capital de trabajo. Las otras integrantes del grupo son las señoras, Meyling quien tiene la edad de 31 años y comercializa ropa y calzado en su comunidad desde hace dos años, Damaris de 23 años de edad propietaria de una mini pulpería desde hace seis años, Darling de 28 años de edad, quien se dedica a la comercialización de delantares en el mercado más populoso de la capital desde hace más diez años y Nery quien tiene la edad de 32 años y comercializa frutas en las calles de Granada.
texts.en:
“Amor de Hermanas” is a united group that is composed of five enterprising women who want to succeed.  It is coordinated by María Petrona, who is 68 years old and married. She is the mother of six children, who were the reasons for her success. 

She has been slaughtering pigs and selling nacatamales (Nicaraguan-style tamales) for ten years.  This is the first loan cycle; and she is requesting a loan for the purchase of two live pigs in order to increase her working capital.  

The other members of the group are: Meyling, age 31, who has been selling clothing and shoes in her community for two years; Damaris, age 23, who has owned a small grocery store for six years; Darlyn, age 28, who has been selling aprons in the busiest market in the capital for more than ten years; and Nery, age 32, who sells fruit on the streets of Granada.

loans.use: to purchase two live pigs.

loans.name: Sinthya Verónica

texts.es:
Sinthya de 25 años de edad, estudió hasta Bbachiller, por lo  económico ya no pudo seguir,está acompañada y su pareja trabaja como jornalero, tienen 2 hijos y vive su suegro con ellos.

 Sinthya  desde que tiene 8 años se ha dedicado al negocio.Fué su mamá, quién le enseño el oficio , ella siempre le dijo que era bueno estudiar, pero que también era bueno aprender a trabajar, hoy con su pareja desde hace un año tienen una tienda. Sinthya comenta que la inició con $100. 00 y cada vez le fue invirtiendo más. Además, de la tienda vende fresco en una bicicleta en los caseríos.
 
Su día comienza a las 5:00 am. Pues sus clientes ha esa hora comienzan a llegar y cierra  a las 6:00 pm aunque a veces se siente cansada pero, su sueño es sacar a su familia adelante por eso se esfuerza cada día.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 1000 ladrillos, 4 quintales de hierro, 30 bolsas de cemento, arena, piedra y mano de obra, para construir una habitación a su casa.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos triunfar en una carrera universitaria, llegar a tener una tienda grande, construir su propia casa ( hoy vive en casa de su mamá ).
texts.en:
Sinthya is twenty-five years old, and studied until the end of high school but could not continue due to her financial situation.  She is in a common-law relationship and her partner works as a day laborer. She has two children and her father-in-law lives with them.  

Sinthya has been engaged in business since she was eight years old.  It was her mother who taught her the trade.  She always told her it was good to study, but that it was also good to learn to work.  Today, she and her husband have a store.  Sinthya says that she started it with $100.00 and each time she was investing more.  In addition to the store, she sells fruit drinks on a bicycle in the villages.

Her day begins at 5:00 a.m. as her customers begin to arrive at this hour, and she closes at 6:00 p.m.  Although she feels tired sometimes, her dream is to get her family ahead and for this reason, she works hard every day.

She will use the loan she is requesting to purchase 1000 bricks, 4 quintals of iron, 30 bags of cement, sand, stone, and pay labor to build her own home. Her dreams are to see her children triumph in a university career, have a big store, and build her own home (at the moment she is living in her mother’s house).

loans.use: to purchase 1000 bricks, 4 quintals of iron, 30 bags of cement, sand, stone, and labor to build a room on her home.

loans.name: Carmen Aurora

texts.es:
Carmen es madre de seis hijos entre los 15 y 22 años. 

Aparte a su familia, se dedica a la cultivación agricultura desde hace 15 años. Ella aprendió este negocio empíricamente, es decir a través de observación de otras personas y a su familia. 

Hoy en día tiene un negocio de producción de plátano.

Ella y su familia viven una zona rural de Colombia en la cual no es fácil tener acceso a servicios financieros como los que aporta Interactuar. 

Su crédito lo va usar para construir una bodega y de este modo poder albergar la cosecha de sus cultivos.

Gracias a este crédito, la economía de su familia y la calidad de vida mejorarían pues podría aumentar sus ingresos. 

Carmen sueña terminar con la legalización de los papeles de su tierra. 

¡Impacte la vida de Carmen y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Carmen is the mother of six children between 15 and 22 years old. Aside from her family, she's dedicated her time to agriculture for more than 15 years. She learned this business empirically, through observation of other people and her family.

Today, she has a business growing bananas. She and her family live in a rural area of Colombia where it's not easy to get access to financial services like the ones Interactuar offers. She will use her loan to build a warehouse so she will be able to store her crop. 

Thanks to this loan, her family's economy and their quality of life will improve, as they'll be able to increase their income. Carmen dreams of completing the paperwork to legalize her land. 

Make an impact on Carmen and her family's life with a loan!

loans.use: to build a warehouse to store her banana crop.

loans.name: Asad

texts.en:
The person is shown in the picture named Asad, 27 years old and living in the populated area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been running a small general store for many years and it is not working very well due to shortage of inventories. His shop situated under populated area and lot of customers available here to offer miscellaneous general store’s items. He wants to keep all inventories to offer; however due to availability of lack of funds; he is unable to buy most demanded inventories. In this way he will be success to sell more products and can grow his income as well. He wants to offer demanded inventories such as flour, pulses, detergents, rice and cooking oil. 
Therefore, Asad has requested a loan from Kvia’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to buy the inventories such as flour, pulses, detergents, rice and cooking oil etc.
Asad is very glad after receiving this loan and hopeful that he will be success to fulfill each request from his customers and abstain from the disappointment.  He is very thankful to the kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy the inventories such as flour, pulses, detergents, rice and cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Darsalam de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 42anset ont au moins 6 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que,Habillement, Restauration, produits  cosmétiques et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe.
Bintou est un membre du groupe Benkadi,assise au bout et à droite, vendeuse des produits cosmétiques. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de produits cosmétiques (savon, pommade, lotion, crèmes) en quantité et en qualités au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkadi comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 170000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Bintou compte réaliser  185 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group of women from the Darsalam district of Koutiala City. They know one another well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They average 42 years of age and have at least six children. This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, such as clothing and cosmetics, and they work in food service. 

To expand their businesses, the group members had decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their 6th group loan. 

Bintou, a member of the group Benkadi, is the one sitting at the end on the right. A vendor of cosmetics, she intends to use her loan to purchase some cosmetic products (soap, ointment, lotion, cream) of various types in quantity over time to sells retail to a diverse customer base. She procures her supplies at the market. 

While the other members of the group Benkadi plan on making an average profit of 170,000 francs CFA each over the course of this cycle, Ms. Bintou plans on making 185,000 francs. 

In addition to paying back the loans, the group members use part of the revenues to cope with personal expenses and to increase their business capital. They would like to see bolstered this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, so that their inventory levels do not drop too low.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en:
Humaira is 30 years old, married, and a responsible housewife. 

Her husband is an educated man and has been running a school in his community. He is respected by everyone in the community. 

During this academic session the number of students has increased, and now her husband is in need of some furniture for the additional students. Therefore, his wife Humaira has applied for a loan in order to buy furniture for the school.

Humaira is thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her husband's school.

loans.name: Kotognokontala Group

texts.fr:
Kotognokontala est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Medina-Coura de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 32anset ont au moins 3enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que,Habillement, produits  cosmétiques et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe.
Abi qui est la seule assise, est une vendeuse de friperies. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de friperies de plusieurs catégories en qualités au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Kotognokontala comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Abi compte réaliser  165 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Kotognokontala is a group of women from the Medina-Coura district of Koutiala City. They know one another well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They average 32 years of age and have at least three children. This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, such as clothing, cosmetics, and general merchandise. 

To expand their businesses, the group members had decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their 2nd group loan. 

Abi, the only one sitting in the photo, is a vendor of secondhand clothing. She intends to use her loan to purchase some used clothing of several types in quantity over time to sells retail to a diverse customer base. She procures her supplies at the market. 

While the other members of the group Kotognokontala plan on making an average profit of 160,000 francs CFA each over the course of this cycle, Ms. Abi plans on making 165,000 francs. 

In addition to paying back the loans, the group members use part of the revenues to cope with personal expenses and to increase their business capital. They would like to see bolstered this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, so that their inventory levels do not drop too low.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Soutoura est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Medina-Coura de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 40anset ont au moins 5enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, l’habillement, Restauration, produits  cosmétiques et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe.
Fatoumata est un membre du groupe Soutoura, assise à droite,  elle est vendeuse de pièces de pagnes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des pièces de pagnes de qualités différentes au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Soutoura comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Fatoumata compte réaliser  175 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Soutoura is a group of women from the Medina-Coura district of Koutiala City. They know one another well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They average 32 years of age and have at least five children. This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, such as clothing and cosmetics, and they work in food service. 

To expand their businesses, the group members had decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their 2nd group loan. 

Fatoumata, a member of the group Soutoura, is sitting at the right in the photo, is a vendor of ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She intends to use her loan to purchase lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth of different types over time to sells retail to a diverse customer base. She procures her supplies at the market. 

While the other members of the group Soutoura plan on making an average profit of 165,000 francs CFA each over the course of this cycle, Ms. Fatoumata plans on making 175,000 francs. 

In addition to paying back the loans, the group members use part of the revenues to cope with personal expenses and to increase their business capital. They would like to see bolstered this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, so that their inventory levels do not drop too low.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Tedo Koko

texts.fr: Madame Tedo a 60ans. Elle  habite un quartier de la ville de Lomé où elle exerce son activité. Elle est veuve et pour arriver à s’occuper de ses enfants, elle fait le commerce  de céréales. Elle s’approvisionne à    Tsévié, Tabligbo et Afagnan.  Comme perspectives d'avenir, elle espère améliorer les conditions de vie et rendre pérenne son activité.
texts.en: Ms. Tedo is 60 years old. She lives in a district in the city of Lomé, where she operates her business. She is a widow. To be able to take care of her children, she does commerce in grains. She gets her supplies from Tsévié, Tabligbo, and Afagnan. For the future, she hopes to improve living conditions and make her business sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase corn and beans

loans.name: Ma. Elgafama

texts.en:
Ma. Elgafama works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rug-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 21 years now.

Ma. Elgafama requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Elgafama would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business.

loans.name: Juvy Catalina

texts.en:
Juvy Catalina is 50 years old and married with 3 children.

Juvy Catalina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Juvy Catalina has borrowed and successfully repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 7 years and also earns an income from E-loading mobile phones with prepaid credit.

Juvy Catalina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas Group

texts.es:
Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas
Fray Casiano Puntarenas

	Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas presenta la solicitud de crédito de 3 integrantes,  quienes han trabajan en una comunidad de Puntarenas (Fray Casiano) con altos niveles de pobreza. El  grupo de mujeres en la zona mantiene un  ahorro y participan en las actividades grupales para la generación de ingresos.  Tienen 8 años de trabajar en sus actividades, han solicitado préstamos y conocen la modalidad de trabajo grupal.  Se forma la Junta Directiva y se levanta el acta No.3 de solicitud de crédito del Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas, en esta oportunidad la  presidenta es Katia.

	Su trabajo y esfuerzo,  les ha permitido tener su  actividad consolidada como es el  comercio en general (venta de ropa, zapatos, perfumes y otros).  El préstamo va a contribuir a mejorar las condiciones de trabajo de su grupo,  les va a permitir invertir para fin y principio de año, incrementando su inventario y cubriendo pedidos para esta época, muy buena para el comercio.

	 Realizan la recuperación de la cuota en forma semanal lo que les permite tener un margen más amplio del pago a realizar, la cual se comprometen a cancelar en un plazo de 12 meses. 

Algunas de ellas son mujeres jefas de hogar, tal es el caso de Diana, quién se dedica a la venta de ropa,  zapatos y sandalias en la zona, la va a traer a San José, mantiene una cartera de clientes grande, tiene 27 años y es una mujer trabajadora y de respeto en la comunidad, mantiene a 2 hijos. Además de atender sus actividades económicas por las tardes y  cumplen con  las reuniones grupales. Dedica 6 horas al día y cobra a un mes, los préstamos anteriores le han ayudado mucho para fortalecer su negocio y apoyar el hogar.

	El objetivo es mejorar las condiciones de sus empresas, obteniendo un financiamiento acorde con sus necesidades y apoyar el desarrollo de la zona  y por su puesto  mejorar la calidad de vida  de las familias. El nombre del grupo las motiva a ser mejores cada día, Mujeres Esforzadas.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas, Fray Casiano Puntarenas
Communal Bank Mujeres Esforzadas presents its request for a loan for its three members who work in Puntarenas (Fray Casiano) which has high levels of poverty. The group has a savings account and participates in group activities to generate income. They have had their businesses for 8 years, have sought loans and know how to work together as a group. They form the Executive Board and this is their third loan cycle.

For this loan we introduce the president, Katia. Her work and effort have enabled her to have a business selling general merchandise (clothing, shoes, perfumes, and other items). The loan is going to contribute to the improvement of the working conditions of the group, enabling them to invest for the end of the year and new year's seasons, increasing inventory and covering the orders that come in during this season which is very good for business. They make weekly payments which allows for flexibility and they promise to pay back completely in 12 months.

Some of the women are heads of their respective households, like Diana, who sells clothing, shoes, and sandals in the area of San Jose, and she has a large customer base. She is 27 years old and a hard-working and respected woman in her community, supporting two sons. In addition to her business she attends all the group's meetings. She dedicates 6 hours per day to her business. The prior loans have helped her strengthen her business and support her home.
