The goal is to improve their businesses, obtain financing that meets their needs, support development in the area, and of course improve the quality of life of the families. The name of the group motivates the women to be better every day, Mujeres Esforzadas ( Earnest Women).

loans.use: to buy merchandise, clothing, sandals, shoes, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Jyoti Shg Group

texts.en:
Kuni, the lady standing with her raised hand, is a 39-year-old citizen living in a rural area located in the Koraput district of Odisha state, India. She is a married mother of two children. She grows paddy as the main source of income and supplements her family’s income by working as a paid worker. She has been involved with her business for twelve years. 

This is the first loan for her though Peoples Forum. She and her group members are applying for a loan. As group secretary, Kuni will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and paddy seed and pay for plowing fees for her farmland. She hopes to expand her farmland so as to make a better living. 

All the members of this group are happy with this loan and would like to thank Kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and paddy seed and pay for plowing fees for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the repairs and maintenance of her grocery store.

loans.name: Jiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe JIGUISSEME sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne 6 enfants, vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à HAMDALLAYE un quartier populaire de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme MARIAM  fait la vente de patate dans ce groupe de femmes JIGUISSEME, Elle est débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  des quantités importantes de patates. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de  ses produits, la revente se fait au marché à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42 000 francs CFA dont une partie est utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four women of the group JIGUISSEME are married, and they average 40 years of age and six children each, living for the most part in traditional families in HAMDALLAYE, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are on their 16th solidarity loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers. 

Ms. MARIAM sells sweet potatoes in this women’s group JIGUISSEME. She is the one standing first from the right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase significant amounts of sweet potatoes. She is much in demand by her customers for the quality of her products. Her sales are made to men and women customers paying with cash or credit at the market. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 42,000 francs CFA that will in part be used to pay back the loan with interest, as well as to put toward savings.

loans.use: to purchase sweet potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of Ever Bilena and Personal Collection products to resell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 50 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nancy has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Nancy has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 63 years old, married, and has three children. 

She is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to pay the laborers’ salaries for the harvest of her sugarcane.

Josephine has been farming sugarcane for two years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay the laborers' salaries for the harvest of her sugarcane.

loans.name: Marlenys

texts.es:
Con la ilusión de salir adelante y superarse, Marlenys desea montar un negocio de venta de refrescos en su propia casa en el municipio de Turbo.

Esta idea surge a partir de la motivación que le da sacar adelante a sus dos hijos menores, es así como desea generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Aunque ella siempre ha querido ser independiente, nunca había tenido el valor de arriesgarse a iniciar con un negocio; pero ahora se siente con la fuerza y capacidad para hacerlo.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar todos los elementos necesarios para el montaje de su negocio tales como 1 congelador, nevera, insumos como variedad de refrescos en distintos sabores para vender.

Con estos elementos podrá iniciar con este proyecto y podrá cumplir así su sueño de ser independiente.

Con el apoyo a este crédito estarás impulsando las ideas emprendedoras de una madre colombiana!
texts.en:
With the goal of being successful and improving herself, Marlenys wishes to open a business in her home in Turbo municipality selling refreshments. This idea is motivated by her desire to provide for her two small children as a way of earning the income needed to support her home. Even though she has always wanted to be independent, she have had the courage to risk starting a business. But now she has the strength and capacity to do so.

She seeks a loan to buy all the items necessary to open a business such as 1 refrigerator unit, ice machine, and items like a variety of soda pop in different flavors to sell. With these items she will be able to start with this project and be able to complete her dream of being self-sufficient. With the support of this loan you will be helping the entrepreneurial ideas of a Colombian mother!

loans.use: to buy refrigerated goods such as soda pop to start her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 41 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ruth requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ruth has been pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ruth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Astrid Elena

texts.es:
Astrid es una mujer de 38 años de edad, casada y madre de un de 16 años. 

Desde joven ha trabajado en la actividad comercial, inició laborando con un familiar en un pequeño almacén, luego de un tiempo decidió independizarse y comenzar a trabajar por su propia cuenta, hoy en día tiene un pequeño almacén en el que vende distinta variedad de mercancía. 

Es una mujer emprendedora y con ganas de salir adelante, por eso solicita el crédito con la Corporación, el cual desea invertir en la compra de mercancía y productos al por mayor como ropa, accesorios, perfumería, cosméticos, entre otros, con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos que le ofrecen y así poder tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar las ventas.

Astrid sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, convertirlo en un gran almacén, que le genere mayores ingresos para brindar una mejor educación a su hijo y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda la familia.

Con esta actividad tiene la oportunidad de estar al frente de su hogar y cuidar a sus hijos.

Impacta la vida de Astrid con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Astrid is a 38 year old woman who is married and the mother of a 16 year old.  

Since she was young, she has worked in her commercial activity. She started working for a relative in a small store. After a time, she decided to go off on her own and she started to work for herself. Now she has a small store where she sells a different type of merchandise.

She is an entrepreneurial woman who wants to get ahead. That is why she is asking for a loan from la Corporación. She wants to invest in buying merchandise and products wholesale, such as clothing, accessories, perfume, cosmetics, and more. She is doing this to take advantage of discounts that are being offered so she can have more of a variety of products to offer her customers and improve sales. 

Astrid dreams of making her business grow and making it into a great store that will generate more income to offer her son a better education and improve the quality of life of the whole family. 

With this activity, she has the opportunity to care for her household and care for her children.

Impact Astrid's life with a loan today!

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothing, accessories, perfume, cosmetics, and more, in order to take advantage of discounts.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA  sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à  FAMA  un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame  ALIMATA  fait le commerce de fruit dans ce groupe de femme DEMBAGNOUMA. Elle se tient à l’extrême gauche sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt un panier de fruit au grand marché d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Sa vente se fait en détail en espèce et à crédit à Fama  à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 38 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
.
texts.en:
The four women of the group DEMBAGNOUMA are married, and they average 33 years of age and two children each, living for the most part in traditional families in FAMA, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are on their 4th solidarity loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers. The previous loans were correctly paid back.

Ms. ALIMATA does commerce in fruit in this women’s group JIGUISSEME. She is standing at the far right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase a basket of fruit at the big market, where she is much in demand by her customers for the quality of her products. Her sales are made to men and women customers paying with cash or credit in Fama. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 38,000 francs CFA that will in part be used to pay back the loan with interest, as well as to put toward her savings.

loans.use: to purchase fruit
